We'll see how it works.UPDATE: 9/24/11One camera just started acting up. All I get is bright white and faint images of close-by objects. Talking to DLink Customer Service about this. Having to do multiple resets to see if that will fix it.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, but poor picture quality when used in-doors
Reviews.Author: Kumar
Reviews.Content: I am updating  the review one month after I went through a replacement and several days and hours of spending time with DLink technical support.  The product has way too many problems and does not work as advertised, in fact, it does not work.  Very flaky.The live video does not work over the internet,but works when viewed over your home network or LAN. It is a good toy to play with.  They say it should work through mydlink site, bit it never did from behind my corporate network.  So, what's the use. My camera is also behind a DLINK's own router at home, so they cannot say that it is their router problem.Kumar

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: RipeRedRobot
Reviews.Content: I got this camera primarily because it had audio and was low priced. It has been working good for a month now.I use the built-in dynamic DNS client and a port forward on my router to directly go to the camera configuration page and watch the video from there. I used the My-Dlink site a few times but I find the camera page more convenient, plus there were some UPNP issues with it that will only let me watch 60 seconds of video at a time. There are no such issues with the direct web interface.Video and audio work very nicely over the LAN. When accessing remotely, it is a little choppy. You don't notice this much in the video as much as you do in the audio, and is fairly ok.I have it installed in an out of reach location. Initially, I found that it would randomly, but very rarely, decide not to connect to the wireless network even after rebooting it, and I would have to plug in an Ethernet cable to get it back up. This had me worried. But in the month since I installed it in its final place, I haven't had to touch it or reboot it once, and it has been working fine on its own.

Reviews.Title: They gave me someone's returned unit
Reviews.Author: logicguru1
Reviews.Content: I was eager to get the unit,  when I opened it up, I was suspicious that it may have been a returned unit...  Fingerprints on the DVD, cables not tidy, quickstart guide crumbled.  I chose to try anyway... went through full setup on line and first they asked me for a password...  Which means that somebody added a password.  I learned how to reset the password and type my own...  Later in the setup I came across a screen which read  "Unable to add this device to your Dlink account, this device is already registered with another mydlink account, you must delete it from the original account first"  ...which of course I cannot do....  Beware and make sure you get a new unopened unit... I will be contacting Amazon to get a new unit.Update.  increased from 1 star to 2 stars.  Amazon exchanged the unit, and the new one was shrink-wrapped.  This time the setup was pretty quick and the unit is running.  A decent entry level camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Bricks
Reviews.Content: Same experiance as Al.  Leave the camera hardwired and can't be returned!  Purchased to operate on my wireless Verizon FIOS network and will not connect settings.  I can only imagine there is a conflict with Verizon's router (which there must be millions of in use).  Even when using wired there is an extreme feedback "buzz" (high pitched) that makes you disengage your speakers.  Support is non-existent with only the goal of blowing you off.  Sad piece of crap if you have Verizon FIOS.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ronny E. Sanchez Ajun
Reviews.Content: This camera is a very good product, it works exactly as described; however, setting it up for wifi connectivity is a lot easier from the camera configuration settings via IP #, than trying to configure with the wizard. I like this product, it has good reception for a small house under adequate light conditions. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Great and economic cam
Reviews.Author: Catherine "cath"
Reviews.Content: It served my purpose as surveillence cam. I can monitor my place from anywhere. it is the cheapest and best functional cam I could find after doing lot of research.  I would highly recommended.I would consider getting more for other rooms in my house.

Reviews.Title: It works as it says
Reviews.Author: J. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I just got my dlink camera set up.  I wanted to use it to spy on the pets when I'm working long hours.  It took me about an hour to get it set up, and I don't really know what I'm doing.  I have a MacBook as my only computer and was able to download the Mac installation wizard from the dlink website (it took a few tries to actually down load).  I was able to use that to set up the camera, along with the instructions it downloaded with.  I tried to do it without the instructions the first time and failed, ended up deleting the camera and starting over.  I basically installed it 3 times before getting it right.  It was pretty easy, I had everything I needed supplied, and I was able to get the camera working, wireless and have remote access through the dlink website (its free).The picture is adequate, nothing stellar, but I can see the dogs at the end of the 80' deck.  The microphone works, I can hear the birds chirping.  Not a lot of fancy stuff on this camera, but it serves its purpose.  I think I'm going to get a second one!

Reviews.Title: Works great if it can pick up a wireless signal
Reviews.Author: Kevin W. Gainey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this web camera for watching my front door. Overall everything works great - if the camera can pick up a wireless signal. I have a repeater on the first floor and the camera only connects to the wireless network when it's within 15 feet of the repeater with a direct line of sight. No other wireless devices in my house have this problem. So I may use it elsewhere (wired or wireless) and get something else for the front door. Great video quality related to price and pretty easy to setup.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! It took me less than 15 minutes to set up the camera and all of my accounts with D-Link! I have it set up wirelessly and all it took was pressing two buttons! It connected all by itself. I am definitely buying a few more cameras to put throughout my house! Highly recommend this product!!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Michael
Reviews.Content: I currently have a LTS Security camera set up but was wanting to buy another one to put in another room.  Set up wasn't that difficult if you know a little about networking.  I just connected it to my router then logged into the router to see what IP address it was given.  After that I logged in using the default user name and password.  The default user name is "admin" and the password just leave blank.  Once logged in you are able to manually set the settings or use a wizard.  The video when there is light available isn't the greatest but it works.  The power cord is very short.  I think they should have made it longer

Reviews.Title: Great bargain....
Reviews.Author: Radbadad "Former Fitness Freak"
Reviews.Content: $70 for this camera is a miracle, but the miracle does have flaws.On the big thumbs up side: D-link gives the user a free web account for "Mydlink" which allows access to the camera from anywhere via a web browser and Internet access.  The user can set up several cameras from various locations.  Just this alone makes the camera a big thumbs up buy.Mydlink "lite" is the application for Iphone, however I can't get it to work outside local network access.  The first thought is firewall blockage, but that's not the problem since the system able to access the local network, but cannot access video from the Internet.  At the same time, access IS allowed via web browser.The software setup wizard is rather lame.  It assumes you use 128 encryption for security.  The user has to open ports for the device to use over the Internet.  The steps are incomplete and require the user to have some network skills.So I spent a few hours researching and installing and the only major disappointment was the inability to use it via my Ipad or Iphone.The sound is poor, but complaining about that in a $70 item is petty.

Reviews.Title: easy setup on Android g-tablet
Reviews.Author: Dragonspeak "khsdragon"
Reviews.Content: Very simple installation from the CD-ROM and account setup on dlink.com .  Very easy setup on wireless network, pressing the big one inch front button on the ATT uverse two-wire gateway and the reset button on the camera to pair them in one minute.I loaded the dlink lite app from the Android market to the Viewsonic g-tablet and it streams with a 0.1 second delay WiFi to WiFi. Even switching to full screen is fast. WiFi to WiFi on the Android phone is fast but is sluggish on 3g. Viewing on broadband on pc is also fast.The resolution and color is not the greatest possible but is adequate for the cost and value for one room surveillance as a starter or proof of concept that it can be  done.

Reviews.Title: Software Great / Wireless Reception Not So Great
Reviews.Author: Jinxers
Reviews.Content: The surveillance software that comes with this camera is great. It has the ability to record on motion and handles up to 32 separate cameras at once. I have found the software to be rock solid so far with no glitches. One downfall of the software is the fact that there is no help feature or users guide that comes with it so you have to pretty much figure it out on your own. For most users that wont be a huge problem.The Camera itself does have some issues. Picture quality is OK but the real problem is the wireless antennas in these cameras. I had one set up 6 feet away from my router and max signal was 60%. If you are setting up farther than that away from your router forget about the cameras staying connected. To solve the problem of the weak reception from the camera antenna I bought a network range extender and configured it to act as a wireless bridge and hard wired the cameras to it. Now they work like they were intended to but I don't feel I should have had to spend another $65.00 to make them work 15 feet away from my router.Overall the cameras will perform satisfactorily if you can establish a good signal from your router. By the way I was using a Cisco wireless N gigabit router which should be more than sufficient.

Reviews.Title: good enough for price, however..
Reviews.Author: Patrick D
Reviews.Content: Overall units seem like a good buy. Appear robust for casual use, probably wouldn't want to adjust position too often as somewhat flimsy rotation and lock knob construction. Packaging and setup instructions sufficient to work through setup. Note ONLY PC SOFTWARE comes on provided CD, you will need to download MAC OS version from web. Installation via wireless (N, speed 54mbps or better) router was slow but worked. Second unit setup was easier once I knew what to do. Installation of webcam in final monitoring location was best achieved with looking at live image on laptop, so the camera can be setup to the exact angle needed.The bad - the uplink appears to be fast enough when the laptop is connected directly to the wireless-N router, so the speed of wireless between router and camera is fine to see about 0.5-1 sec update images. Once I left the local network it became a different experience, which makes it almost useless to check remotely from computer (maybe cellphone works but could not try). So you log in to the dlink website and it installs the needed Java real-time software (each time by the way) to provide an image from the camera. Even with 100mbps wired connection the image was very slow to update, and many times could not connect despite multiple attempts. Finally tried to login from a different work computer. Did not have password, so I used to forgot password link. It emailed a default 8 character password. Would not let me login. Tried reset twice more, same problem. So have lost ability to access web-based viewer. Also tried the d-link app on ipad. Just would never connect, timed out.Basically fine if you are on home/local network, although don't expect super fast update. Web-based or app-based access from a remote login site did not work in any useable manner. Give if 1 star for this function, 4 star for basic quality and setup. Don't recommend this if you need to see the webcam from remotely located computer or wifi device as usually can't connect. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Problems making it wireless.  My Solution
Reviews.Author: David Y
Reviews.Content: If you want to use it wired it's very easy, and would take about 5min. I wanted it wireless, and I had the hardest time setting it up, i even looked at a YouTube video that didn't help. I pretty much got to the part where it was supposed to reboot, and be good to go but it never rebooted. I use mine to keep watch of my front door since i'm usually at my computer upstairs with a headset on. Doesn't work at night so if you want that option get a different model. For $70 it does what i wanted it for.My wireless solution was to log into my Verizon Fios Router, then click on the DC-930L, click Access Device, and then enable wireless from the D-Link page there. Now it works like a charm, and i love it. Bookmark the page you used to enable your wireless also, its better than using the mydlink site.

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Pete Chen
Reviews.Content: This wireless camera has great features...on paper. In practice, it is just too buggy and not ready for prime time yet. Here are the problems I am experiencing.1. Dlink server not reliable: You have to login to their server to see live video from your camera. Within less than one month since purchase, server was not available for two times.2. Reinstall software every time: Every time I log in, it will reinstall Java Applets. I just don't understand why they cannot use a technology not doing that.3. Camera is offline for no reason: Camera is offline for no reason. I then try it later. It is online again. I tested the internet connection when it happened. It was always on.4. Password is changed for no reason: It happened two times already. It tells me that the camera password has been changes, but it was not. I just had to login at a later time to find out everything is O.K. again.5. Unfriendly software: The live video has zoom-in and zoom-out function. But the zoom-in is digital zoom not optical zoom. That is, it is the same resolution but expands one pixel to four pixels. And the "zoom-in" is always on the center of the video. You cannot zoom in on different places on the video. With these limitations, zoom-in function is pretty much useless to me.6. Mobile apps (iPhone and Android) have no audio. So if you are thinking of using it to replace Lorex baby monitor, then just forget it. By the way, you are missing much anyway. Evewn on Windows PCs, the audio is very noisy. I don't even consider it working.All in all, do not expect much. Do not belive what you see in the ad. Forget about audio, set the expectation low, and wait for the next generation of the cameras. I am going to check another popular one to see if it is better. At least it has better reviews. Foscam FI8918W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP Camera with 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - White NEWEST MODEL (replaces the FI8908W)

Reviews.Title: Nice item for the price!
Reviews.Author: foxtail_too "Kristi"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for monitoring my home (what do the dogs do when we aren't there?) and I am pleased with the product. It was not difficult to set up and register, and only slightly more difficult to run through our home wireless network.  (Hint: write down the numeric address like the directions say, when it is first assigned.)I have been able to monitor from my work computer without any problems.Monitoring from a cell phone or iPad is somewhat harder. I downloaded mydlink lite on several devices, and monitoring with mobile devices is hit or miss. They seem to disconnect frequently. Hopefully, better apps will solve that problem.

Reviews.Title: Great product, highly recomend!
Reviews.Author: Edward Kissel
Reviews.Content: I use this for checking on my cat when I go on long trips. It was pretty easy to set up (if I had to do it again, I would ignore the WPS option and install initially through a wired connection-they provide a cable). Once you get the device linked to the internet, the only wire needed for a connection is the power cord. I LOVE being able to use the myDlink Lite on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Setup Could Be A Lot Easier
Reviews.Author: thehammer
Reviews.Content: I am a Mac user and, unlike some reviewers, I could setup this camera using my Mac.  However, the software setup procedure was not simple nor straightforward.  Having a good knowledge of LAN is important.  Note, if you don't know what LAN stands for, you might not want to purchase this camera.  If you have a geek friend, keep them nearby.After playing around with the settings, I got it connected and things seem to run pretty well.  I use this as a webcam pointing outside.  On a gray sky, there is a pink to red hue in the center of the picture.  See for yourself at: VisitOregonSouthCoast.com.  Also, the white plastic causes a reflection problem in the window.  I suspect I will have to paint it black.On several mornings, I found that the cam had lost connection with my Verizon supplied wireless router.  When I pulled up the router, I found that there were about 12 connections listed as the cam.  I solved that problem by assigning the camera a fixed IP address.The range is not very good. I can use my laptop two floors away without any problems, but this cam will not connect.  As a result, I have to purchase a second wireless router and run a Cat-5 cable from my DSL router to another floor. I don't know if the external antenna of the earlier model cam would help or not. [D-Link later told me the early model has similar coverage.]I contacted technical support via email with a series of pretty simple questions and they did not respond. [Note: They responded shortly after this review appeared.]SFTP is not supported, which is a huge issue if you need to connect to your website and secure FTP is required.Someday, one of these companies will take an inexpensive still digital camera with a good zoom and modify it so that it can be used as a webcam. That would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: dog's eve view
Reviews.Author: Airbrushman "airbrushman"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be able to see our dog Jasmine in the crate from my iphone.  The camera connects to the wi fi in the house.  My wi fi was not automatic since it was an older model, but the technician at Dlink directed me through the linking process.  I downloaded the free ap from apple that allows me to see the images on my iphone and ipad.  Now when I leave home, I can see the Jasmine in her crate.  The picture is very clear.  You can even zoom in on the crate for a close up.I am very happy with the results and the price was very reasonable in comparison with the higher end models.

Reviews.Title: decent
Reviews.Author: Princess Evelyn Milano
Reviews.Content: This is a decent security camera.  I use it for checking in on my dog when I'm not at home.  The quality is very good during the day, however once the sun goes down you'll need a very bright light to be able to fully see every thing in the room.  I have also noticed that the wireless range isnt that great(I have about a 1600 sq ft house).  My router is on one side of the house.  I initially had the camera in my bedroom(opposite side of the house) because thats where my dog stays a majority of the time, but it kept going in and out repeatedly and not working.  I moved it to my living room which is in the middle of the house and it stays on 24/7 and works fine.  I also love the iPhone app, just wish it had sound.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for watching rooms in your house
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: After doing quite a bit of research on IP cameras, I settled on this DCS-930L. It was easy to set up using the software and I have had no connectivity issues with the router. I've had the camera for a few months and use the D-ViewCam software from D-Link to set recording schedules for the pets, cleaners, etc. This camera, as a complement to our home security system, is well suited.I do wish the video quality in low light was better, but I suppose it is on par with the price of technology. The power cord is long enough for most applications, but it would have been nice if it were even longer (for flexibility).I will probably buy 1-2 more when I'm ready to add them to a few more sections of the house. I would recommend this product to my friends. (I did not have to deal with D-Link customerless service, so I cannot comment on that aspect... thankfully.)

Reviews.Title: Very user friendly network camera that stays connected.
Reviews.Author: S. Power
Reviews.Content: The automated set-up worked very well with my Linksys E3000 Router.  I was quickly able to set it up to show video anywhere in my house, over the internet, and even on my Android phone, using the Dlink App.It is easy to configure the camera to send e-mails at set times or via motion activation.  It is also easy to have to camera send its data to an FTP site.The range and video quality are both very good.  The automated software and the mydlink website make it all simple to use.  The camera stays connected to the network, and never stops broadcasting.The only task that isn't very easy to set up, is having the video go to a local hard drive.  There isn't a quick and easy way to utilize this feature, though having it save a stream of pictures to a local or remote FTP site is very simple and reliable.Overall, I would recommend this camera.  Everything you would want a wireless camera for is very simple to set up.  I am a complete novice with this setting network devices up, and had no problem.------- Update February 22nd, 2011 ---------I am still very happy with this camera.  Since my initial review, I have continued to have very good experiences with it.  Here are some more observations:- It reconnects to the network within 20 seconds, if you unplug it and move it to a new spot.- Though it works great over Android, they keep updating the software to make it more and more reliable.  The camera always stayed connected to the net, but the phone would sometimes lose the connection.  That is no longer a problem.- Also works on iOS products.- I have played with the Motion Detections settings in conjunction with FTP quite a bit recently.  The camera is working great, and is highly adjustable in this regard, but the FTP service on my Linksys E3000 was giving me problems.  Initially, I thought the camera wasn't working properly, or wasn't adjusting to my settings, but when I switched the FTP to an external site from my router, it is working fine.  Either my E3000 isn't working right, or something with my network settings was causing it to intermittently disconnect.  Either way, it isn't the camera's fault, because it is now working fine, connected to a remote FTP site.  That is better than having it store the images in the house anyway.------ Update July 2011 --------This camera continues to perform very well and gives us a lot of peace of mind.  There is occasional crime in our neighborhood, but an alarm system never seemed worth the expense.  This camera coupled with our off-site FTP storage gives us confidence that we'd at least be able to give the police a photograph of anyone who commits a crime on our property or in our home.

Reviews.Title: Simple & cheap camera solution
Reviews.Author: Jack Ryan
Reviews.Content: DCS-930L was simple to configure. The CD is Windows only however once configured and linked to [...] account you can manage the camera either using Windows Internet Explorer installing D-Link's ActiveX component or on a Mac OS X Safari web browser using Java Applet that is automatically installed. No firewall port or NAT (Network Address Translation) needed for external access (i.e. at work) the cameras from Internet because linking it to the [...] website bypasses the need for any firewall modifications to your local network. To view the camera within your local network you can either use the installed software on the CD or simply use [...] website.DCS-930L is compatible with both Windows & Mac OS.You can also access each camera's configuration using their IP address. Or after logon to [...] click on the linked camera > Camera settings tab. If you're familiar with D-Link's router web interface because the DCS-930L is no different. Within that web interface, options to set camera's date/time, upgrade firmware (none yet available), configure motion detection grid, etc. There's very little modifications needed to the device itself.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good at what it does.
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Michael Chan
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these after reading the review on Engadget, that and having an Amazon package lifted from my front door step.Being that the box and the product description suggests Mac OS support it was surprising not having a way to set it up without using BootCamp, but once in Windows, setup was a breeze. I bought this mainly interested in motion capture, and I am pretty impressed with the setup, you can focus on specific areas of the view to sense motion capture in and a regular threshold based control. FTP and email capabilities let you send pictures based on a schedule or motion capture.I tried the iPhone app too, which worked pretty good, but it is just an iPhone app not a Universal iOS app (iPhone & iPad) so on an iPad you'll have to use the annoying pixel doubling.I would have given this 5 stars, but the issue with no Mac installer and lack of a native iPad app, though not deal breakers for me was a little bit disappointing.For the price, I still think I got a pretty awesome deal.

Reviews.Title: 4 stars due to price / helpful tips for Apple / Mac users
Reviews.Author: Andy PDX
Reviews.Content: When looking at the box it directs you to a web url for the setup wizard if you are a Mac user, however this version didn't work for me. I popped in the CD and followed that version (you should get prompted for an updated version). Just follow the setup wizard and if you have an Apple router, they typically do not have a WPS button, rather you launch the Airport Utility (router and has the blue wifi icon) > Manual Setup > Base Station (top left bar) > Add Wireless Clients > First Attempt and then....Power on D Link cam and hold WPS button until you see the blue light.The Setup wizard will find your camera, you then follow the next few steps and confirm your new Dlink account via email. I have the app installed on both my iphone and work android phone.Beware, the browser and Java version you have will determine if its compatible for accessing your camera stream from your Mac. Neither my Safari or Chrome browsers are compatible without OS or Java backwards changes. I am just updating my Mac to the new OS 10.9 (free) and this should resolve my access from my computer with the browsers.In conclusion, for the price I paid ($30) its pretty good, but I am only using this in my garage to monitor that access point. My higher end wireless cams are upstairs in the house. If you are not using the right setup wizard or that tech savvy you might have some issues with set up process.

Reviews.Title: Hello Spy camera
Reviews.Author: Emrad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to keep an eye on my house while I was away for extended periods of time.Overall the picture quality is pretty nice.  I didn't get the Day/night camera (purchased the day) but even at night the program allows me to adjust the brightness so that I can see pretty clearly.I'm having an issue setting up the motion detection settings however.  The setup seemed very straightforward but I had an issue with the time zone.  Changed the time zone and the hours still seem to be weirdly off.  I was getting emails 4 hours after the time elapsed.  It also picked up light changes in the living room, so when a cloud went overhead I got an email.  I adjusted the sensativity which seems to have resolved that.  The neat part about the camera is that I can view it from my phone.  The camera is fairly easy to setup.  I did try to configure the camera to communicate over WPS on my UBEE cable modem from Bright House, but it wouldn't pick up.  It did take over the wireless settings though.Pros :Can adjust brightness to view when its night timeNice Picture quality for priceSetup is relatively easyCan View on Smart phoneCons:Motion detection not working correctly and takes some toying withWish the power cord was longer

Reviews.Title: Use with a lot of devices
Reviews.Author: Joel Schopp
Reviews.Content: Support for Windows 8, 7, Vista, & XP.  Support for Mac OSX.  Support for Android & iOS.  Support for Firefox, Safari, Chrome, and even Internet Explorer.  This is a one of the most compatible security cameras made.As far as function it does about what you'd expect.  Audio and Video quality are fine for a security camera but won't rival your goPro.  Setup is not bad.  Appearance is more consumer white than industrial.Overall this camera is just fine, no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: Could not get wifi functional; unimpressed with guidance
Reviews.Author: A. Reid
Reviews.Content: The bottom line for me here is that this camera seems to have excellent fidelity regardless of light level, but after many hours of trying every possibility I could imagine I simply cannot get the Wi-Fi to work. Hence, I can only use it where I can plug it into my router (or extend a wire). I suppose that if I wanted to, I could park on my laptop somewhere and watch what my computer is doing in my absence, but that has limited utility for me.Looking at other reviews here, I can see that for some the unit works well. Others, like me, have not been able to make Wi-Fi work. The user friendly setup wizard offers no options that resolve this issue, and the instructions in the book for "Configuring the camera behind a Router" are not remotely user friendly. ("The IP address must be in the same subnet mask as the router's LAN IP" doesn't communicate as clearly to me as D-Link might imagine.) It doesn't seem to have resolved my problem, either, but, then, I'm not sure it's supposed to, since I have little clue what it means. It could be about something else altogether.I received this camera specifically for review, but the bottom line for me is that this is the point where I would return the camera and turn to other options. The image is clear (I want to avoid the word "picture" since you need additional software or hardware to actually create video from this) and the idea is sound, but implementation is just too difficult for me. I can't help but think that D-Link would have better spent the time making more easily comprehensible directions in their "Quick Install Guide" than leaving 6 blanks pages (out of 15) for "notes."As a consumer, I have more confidence where the end-user's experience seems a priority.

Reviews.Title: 2 uses in one.
Reviews.Author: Brett Gennusa
Reviews.Content: So I hid the camera in the attic to see if there are rats and I was right, this camera is sweet for mere fact of is captioning the Rat Olympics 2013. Thank you d-link

Reviews.Title: Makes a wonderful baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Jen "Geek Girl"
Reviews.Content: I am always looking to maximize my usage of the things that I have and to cut back on clutter. I was thrilled when I discovered that this is not only a nifty security camera but also a pretty nice baby monitor. Many baby monitors on the market are pricey and loaded with features I'd never use, so this works fabulously as a no-frills, high quality monitor. The audio is great. I can hear my son turn over in bed and thanks to the quality night vision, I can see him clearly as well. He tends to have nightmares so I have really loved having the ability to keep an eye on him at night and being able to go to him before he wakes up crying. I know this isn't the intended use of this camera but I think it's absolutely fantastic as a baby monitor. When not using it as a monitor, it's also a pretty good security camera as well. I've used it numerous times already when away from home to keep an eye on my property and my golden retriever. The motion detection works flawlessly and the ability to set it's sensitivity it's great. Surprisingly, the wifi extender actually works pretty well. I'm not thrilled with having to have it physically plugged into my router, but it was easy enough with the right length ethernet cable. I had an extra port so it was no big deal there. I was able to tuck it under the edge of the carpet to run it to the central room in my home when I was testing, though I did move it back to my son's room after that. Without the ability to record, I feel that it's a bit pointless as a security system but it IS able to record with the appropriate equipment. As is though, you would have to be actively watching when someone was breaking in and physically take pictures yourself of the intruder. Not as difficult as it may sound thanks to the email alerts, but still not a perfect system for security purposes. The email alerts are timely enough that you could alert the authorities if need be. For the cost it's very functional and a pretty cool little gadget. Installation was very simple and I was up and running in 15 minutes, with the most difficult part being the running of the ethernet cable across the house. Overall I really like this little camera and it does absolutely everything it says it will for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great image, not so great on a Mac
Reviews.Author: Kristine Lofgren
Reviews.Content: I have a D-Link router in my home and a a non-D-Link router in my home business, so I tried the set-up on both just to get an idea of how things would go either way.Oh the D-Link router, as you'd expect, set-up was a breeze (because there wasn't any). Ready to go out of the box.For everyone else, set-up was a bit of a challenge. To begin with, you download the D-Link software, plug the camera into your router and into a wall outlet. The software couldn't find my camera, so it advised me to plug my computer (a Mac) into the router (rather than using my wi-fi). Long story short, after reconfiguring my computer to a wired setting, finding the camera and then reconfiguring my computer to a wireless setting once again, we were good to go. An hour later. To save time, we also tried downloading the PC software version on my husbands PC and it worked fine right off the bat.On to the next step - running the internet viewing program. But once again, I ran into Mac trouble. Safari and Chrome both have Java settings that don't play well with the D-Link interface (this is a Mac issue). Rather than uninstall Java 7, change some settings around and install Java 6, as D-Link suggested, I just downloaded Firefox, downloaded Java 7 and we were good to go. On my husbands PC? We were able to log right in no problem.Once the camera was set up, I unplugged it and moved it to another room. It works great! There is a slight delay, but the picture is great for the cost and the audio is even better! Very impressive. The base is sturdy enough that you can just set the camera on a counter or you can mount it with the two included screws. I haven't mounted it yet because I will have to wire an outlet into the attic to avoid having a cord running down my walls. The infrared view is pretty darn good, too. Not perfect, but night vision so rarely is. The wi-fi repeater works ok, I got a little bit of extension out of it, but I certainly wouldn't buy this based on the extender alone.Now on to record the feed. But here again... a Mac issue. D-Link has software called D-ViewCam, which allows you manage multiple cameras and to record, including manual recording and scheduled recording. Sounds nice. But I didn't get to test it out on my Mac because D-Link doesn't even make the software for a Mac. Without being able to record, this camera is kind of useless to me. I doubt I will be watching the camera the very second a break-in occurs. So (are you noticing a pattern here?) we installed the program on my husband's PC and, after a little fussing around, got things up and running. You can set a recording schedule, run playback, etc.The Ipad app works fine - you can see a live view and set up audio or video alerts. I have two dogs, so it is awesome to be able to turn on and off sections of the video alert so that meandering dogs don't set off the video sensor.Disregard the question of whether you really trust a live, internet-connected video feed in your home (I'm looking at you, NSA) and you have a nice little camera. I would give it 5 stars if you are a PC owner, 3 if you are a Mac owner, and 0 if you are a Mac owner who wants to record the video feed. C'est la vie, I suppose.It seems to me that D-Link needs to invest a little money in their Mac users. At least make an app for the Mac itself rather than relying on internet viewing alone, and for the love of Pete, give us Mac users a way to record.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera if you own a Mac
Reviews.Author: David S. Midler "reldim"
Reviews.Content: This camera works great and is easy to setup, but if you use a Mac, you will not be able to view the camera output online,  The easiest way to monitor the camera is by going to mydlink.com.  While the manual says this site works with PCs and Macs, I assue you it does not.  Using a Mac, you will instead get a Java error.  We have tried using 4 different Macs with different operating systems and none will work. Java is installed and up to date. Even our Mac IT guru could not get it to work.  I've emailed D-Link tech support several times and they do not respond.  But, if you search for this issue, you will see hundreds of posts of Mac users with the exact same issue. So, PC, great.  Mac not so much.

Reviews.Title: great tiny camera for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Lee
Reviews.Content: A geek's dream come true. All the non-geeks out there, sorry.Out of the box, it looks like a design rip off of apple.Its tiny and way light. It seems to run warm to the touch.I got it running on my wifi access point and virtualised router. I'm able to access the camera from a remote location and images off my android phone. So far I haven't touched the manual or the included disc yet. I don't plan on touching the useless CDROM. So far the camera has been out of the plastic shrink wrap for a total of 30 minutes.I was able to telnet to it as admin. The embedded OS is busybox. 1.12.1. As user admin, you really can't do any damage to the device.The CPU is: MIPS 24K V4.12. Equivalent to an intel 486 at 100MHz. The linux kernel is 2.6.21.DLink has the entire filesystem on their support website so you can easily modify and repackage to upload to your camera. That way you can root it and modify it.Note that I never registered with dlink's video streaming website. I don't trust anyone else with videos of my home.NEWBIES!! Please don't be discouraged if the camera does not work after 16 hours. Ask someone. Just don't ask tech support. Or you'll get: please tell me the serial number for the 90th time.Not-so-beginners: plug it in your router first and get an address from DHCP. Then just fire up your browser and point to the cameras assigned IP. The IP is depends on what you set your router to serve what IPs.Beginners: tough luck. Please ask nearest geek. Its not easy. Its not your fault. This sort of thing is inherently difficult.EDIT - Feb 15, 2013:Telnet: I guess the new firmware 'fixed' that. You can't telnet into the camera anymore.The built-in HTTPD/web server seems to be dying or refusing connections for some reason. Its still sending images via ftp. But it seems that the camera's built-in web server crashes or more likely the internal flash memory is dying. Or something is wrong. Its been less than a year.

Reviews.Title: Good video (except in low light), awful audio in mine, and  be wary of the instructions
Reviews.Author: austin_Larry
Reviews.Content: This is a cool gadget and it does work as a surveillance camera over the internet and/or if you have an Iphone with a free Iphone app (no audio on the app). The video is actually good except in low light. It is amazing how basic cameras can produce decent video. However the sound is horrible. I get this buzzing and hissing no matter what room I put it in. And tech support said there was nothing they could do. Keep in mind thought that might be my particular camera or wireless set-up.Which brings me to tech support and setting the camera up to use wirelessly. Do NOT use the instructions. The instructions are going to tell you that you can set up the camera by using the WPS button on your router. At least on mine that wiped out my network settings and made it impossible for computers and phones that had connected before to connect again. My router maker, the highly rated Mediabridge on Amazon, said that every router with a WPS button makes it so that if one device connects that way, they all have to, which is why they don't recommend it. Shame on Dlink for suggesting to use the WPS button when it might mess up people's network settings they use day in day out. That deserves at least a full star off for that alone.So I made multiple calls to tech support. They were always available but not very helpful. But I was able to figure out what to do because I basically figured my only option was to physically connect the camera to my router. You have to manually connect with an Ethernet cable the camera to the back of one of the slots on your router. Then use the Dlink software. This should allow the camera to be found and set up. After you have everything set up and a Mydlink account on the Mydlink page click on camera settings. A new window will open. On that window choose setup and then on the left hand side choose wireless setup. Make sure the SSID has the network name of the network you want to use, if not click site survey and it will look up networks. Then the key to getting it to work not tethered to the router, put in your network password in the Pre-shared key box on the bottom after choosing the correct security you use on your network. Then you should be able to remove the camera from a physical connection to your router and place it where you want. After I did that the camera did take a few minutes to change from red to green, but it does work anywhere now that it has the correct security key.As I mentioned there is an Iphone app. Search for mydlink lite. You have to have already set up your mydlink email and password. Put those in and you can see the video. It does work great but there is no audio, which in my case is fine since the audio scratchiness is unbearable anyway.. It also take surprisingly good pictures and saves them to your camera roll. Tech support kept saying you download the app from our website. And I kept saying that doesn't sound right are you sure the app isn't in the Apple app store? And of course it was in the app store. So it is what it is with their tech support, not impressive. Even with the bad manual and bad tech support I still would have given 4 stars if the audio had been ok. But my audio is unusable. However that might be some quirk with my network connection. But every other job I am asking my router to handle it is doing a superb job. So I either got a lemon audio wise or the audio is a problem. But for a basic surveillance camera, once it is set up it works pretty well. And the Iphone app is a nice fun thing.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: David Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: I use D-Link Wireless cameras at work.  I purchased some a while back since they are network and support local recording.  This one is very similar to the ones I have at work, but this one has Night vision and Cloud support (although the old ones seem to have the same cloud support, it just has a new name).  The camera is easy to install, just plug it into your router (or switch) and plug in the power.  On your computer (I am using a Mac) download the software from the D-Link website and it will guide you through it.  If you want wireless you have to enter the wireless AP data into the software (or if you do not want to use the software you can do a network scan and find the camera's IP and access it that way, but the software is a lot easier and will create a D-Link account for you and it does not install on your computer it just runs once off the mounted drive.Now that you have it setup you can go to the MyDlink website and login with the newly created account (or if you added an account you can access it).  The camera is listed their and you can see a live view of the camera.  I could not get it to work in Safari, kept complaining about Java [I updated to current], but it would not allow me to view it in Safari.  I tried Chrome and it stated that I would have to downgrade to Java 6 (since Chrome is 32 bit and Java 7 for Mac is 64 bit), finally Firefox worked.  I use Firefox (mute your computer speakers if the camera is in the same room) and it connected.  I had my speakers on and the mic on the camera started to get feedback and I had to quickly mute the speakers!  The camera is only VGA so it is not a large image, but for most users it is large enough (the ones I got at work have a higher quality video feed), I do wish it was larger, but this will work for most uses.I like the D-Link cameras over some other Network cameras since it allows IP setup, and allows me to use Recording Software (D-Link has some on their website if you can find it) and access the cameras without using their setup (although you can use both).  So for work for example I have the DVR software running and it records the camera feeds and I can still use the MyDlink app.  This camera is mine so it is at my house and I do not need DVR support at my house, so I am not using that.  Although it is good to have if you ever need it.You can download the free MyDlink App to watch the feed through your smartphone (I believe that the tablet version costs money, but the smartphone is free, I am using an iPhone).  It works nicely and allows you to take a snapshot which is nice.  It has the same abilities as the web interface, and [in my opinion] works better since the Java applet is slow to load on the web interface.The night vision is nice and you can see a dark room with no problem.  It does not reach far, but for most standard rooms you can see what is happening.You can also setup alerts for certain events by going to Settings in the camera or on the MyDlink website.  This is nice for areas or rooms that have no one in them and should not have anyone in them, since it can alert you if someone is in them.The camera also has a repeater which is nice if you have a large business or house.  It will allow you to connect the camera to your WiFi and than put the camera at the edge of your WiFi reach and it will extend the WiFI further!  My home WiFi covers my house and most of my yard so I do not need this, but it is nice to have!In the end this is a great camera, it works good and the night vision is nice.  I like that the MyDlink service is free and if you did not want it you could set the camera up as an IP camera and use it that way.  The camera is very nice and can be easily mounted, although you do have to run wires.  For low end security or home monitoring this is nice and the ability to use a DVR Server is nice.  I wish it had a higher resolution, but it is still pretty nice and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work with Apple - macintosh
Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: This product is really frustrating to use with an Apple or mac computer.  It will constantly ask you to do updates and after you do them, it will ask you to do them again.I've configured, gotten it to work, then they do updates to Java, and the whole thing falls apart again, and you have to go through some set of mystery steps to try to get it working again.  There are miles of suggestions over at the apple site.  Sometimes one of them works for some small subset of people but then the thing goes bonkers again when Oracle or Apple change anything.Do not recommend for apple users.Oddly, I have good luck with it, seeing it on my iphone, but you have to be able to access the camera on your laptop to make changes to the settings remotely.For the few periods of time that I've had it working, I really liked it a lot. But otherwise, a big ball of frustration.  There is NOthing about this that is plug and play for mac users.

Reviews.Title: Software that records video (D-View) is NOT supported on OS X, therefore....USELESS to me
Reviews.Author: K. Warren
Reviews.Content: Everything involving the setup and connection of this wireless camera to my home network was a breeze, I downloaded the software and got live footage from this within 15 minutes of opening the box. I set up an account at mydlink.com for remote viewing from my iPhone and opened the iPhone app to find fast connectivity as well as all the functions I could enable on my Macbook Pro.However, the caveat is that the software used to record live footage (D-View) that comes free and supports this camera does not support OS X (only Windows)! How is that useful for Mac owners? Honestly, the fact that d-link allows setup via OS X is good, but why stumble at the finish line and not include recording capabilities that makes this security camera truly exceptional?This camera is useless to me and I am returning it for one that does support recording onto OS X systems.

Reviews.Title: great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: That's what she said...
Reviews.Content: I use it to spy on my dog while I'm at work...it's perfect for that. I discovered she sleeps all day on the couch...not the most exciting thing to watch but at least I know she's safe when I'm away.

Reviews.Title: If you have a Mac, think twice
Reviews.Author: Ron Ireland
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how well this thing works with a Windows machine, but if you are using Apple products, do think twice about buying this camera. It took a long time, and some fairly advanced skills to get this thing working with my Mac. You'll have problems with Java, then with connecting using the Mac software. Install Apple's stupid Java then go straight to your router to set up the camera. That's really the best way.

Reviews.Title: Works ok once the Java bugs are worked out
Reviews.Author: B. Christopher
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as a simple monitor for the front of our house.  The setup to my current network was easy at first, but after getting into the advanced setup there are some issues.  After finding a video on YouTube I was able to fix the problem.  Also do yourself a favor and don't use the disk that the camera comes with.  The software is already outdated.  Go to Dlink's website and download the latest setup software.Pros:Good resolution. Easy to use linking software.Cons:Advanced software settings needs some work.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs!
Reviews.Author: SEAN
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something simple to view my front door. My primary purpose was to let me know when the UPS/Fedex/Ontrac guy dropped my packages off. I didn't want to have to run cables to an AV source or rewire my entire house in order to do this. This fits my needs perfectly. Setup was pretty straightforward. Do yourself a favor and skip the CD they give you and just download the software off the website. Apparently the software they provide is out of date and you're going to have to go to the website any way. Same thing with the firmware update. Just download the file from the website. Figuring that out took the majority of my time. I'm pretty tech savvy and I had it up and running in 30 minutes flat (mind you most of that time was fiddling around with the CD.)It comes with screws and washers and a wall plug. I mounted in my front window and had a great view of my driveway and front walk. The video quality is not going to blow you away. It's okay. I don't think I'd be able to use this to give to the police to identify a criminal by their face. But for being able to tell if/when someone came up to your door it's great. The Ontrac guy came today and I could read the Ontrac on his van and I could see him walking up the walk but I couldn't make out any of his features. Setting up the email notifications was pretty easy. Just google the proper settings for your email provider and type them in. Motion detection works pretty well. I've been having to tweak it to get it to just pick up the movement I want. It's pretty easy just takes some trial and error to get the setting right. I had it too low and it didn't pick up my car leaving the driveway. I had it too high and it picked up a leaf blowing across the driveway. I'm pretty sure I found the sweet spot now though. Take your time to find the right sensitivity for your needs. I have mine set up to email me when motion is detected. You can have it take pictures every .5 or 1 second. When it detects motion it can send you the pic instantly or send you 3 frames before and 3 frames after. That's the one I chose.The iPad and Android apps work great. On my iPad and tablet it's almost real time video. On my Android phone (using the cell phone data) there is about a 10-20 second delay.All that being said, I actually ordered the night vision model (the 932L I believe.) I plan on keeping this and moving it to view my backyard and I will use the new one in my front window. This one is pretty worthless once the sun goes down (unless you leave a porch light on all night or have some other sort or light source in the area.) I knew this was only the day model so I'm not upset but I just realized I'd rather have the night vision ability. Keep that in mind when deciding.Once I get the night vision one up and running I might pick up another one of these to use when I go out of town to just monitor the inside of my house. In my opinion it's a pretty inexpensive investment for the peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera for price!
Reviews.Author: N. Cates
Reviews.Content: I do loss prevention for a living so I have a pretty good idea how IP cameras work. For $35 shipped this is a good basic camera. It lacks certain features such as night vision, wide angled view, video recorded motion detection and others. Set up is extremely easy, just plug into your router via an Ethernet cable that comes with the camera and follow the step by step instructions that also come with it via your computer. Overall good camera for monitoring day time surveillance without the need for night vision.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: James "JimLuckett"
Reviews.Content: Requires constant trouble shooting.  Not robust.  Not reliable. And a few more words to get to 12 so that I can stop typing.

Reviews.Title: For the love of god, do not buy this
Reviews.Author: Katherine Edwards
Reviews.Content: I just spent approximately two hours of my life (which I will never get back) setting up this perfectly useless camera. First, the disc didn't work, and I had to go to the dlink site and manually select my camera model and download the setup wizard. Then, when the camera came on, my ears were met with a wall of static, and every sound in the room was being broadcasted twice in a row. I don't want to broadcast all the sounds in my house anyway, but less accompanied by an ocean of static and bizarre reverb. Then the camera mysteriously stopped working.  After 45 minutes on the phone waiting for technical support, the camera did begin working again, but I was told that there is NO way to mute the hardware! So I have no choice but to share every sound in my house with the people viewing the stream. That brings us to the next issue! I set up two logins for other people to view the feed, and neither of them functioned when I tried to login with them. Then, I realized it didn't matter, because (all three...) apps I downloaded for remote viewing were completely empty after I signed in. Thats right, there was one button in the app, and that was to log out. I was staring at a blank wood texture, with no setup options, and more importantly, no video. Needless to say, I will be promptly returning this thing. This hardware and its accompanying software are *completely* useless for many reasons. Its like they were actually trying to create a completely useless product.

Reviews.Title: I will be returning this!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Diana Potter
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to get the wireless component to work for the last 3 hours. It is not simple to work!!!! The IP address given in the manual does nothing.The default IP asks for an account and password it will not except the DLink account information I set up. This is a complete waste of a time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!don't buy it!!!!!!!!!!!! The 2332L was easier set up, too many steps and you have to have a PC or MAC to set it up.DLink support useless!!!!! no phone eitherI will be returning this!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good enough, but upgrade the firmware immediately...
Reviews.Author: Mark Eichin
Reviews.Content: These have gotten cheap enough to set up as birdfeeder cams or fishtank cams - WPS makes them easy to set up (with an Asus RT-66u, just hit the WPS page, or hit the button on the back, then hit the button on the DCS-930L for a few seconds, and it's live.)  Just be sure to UPGRADE THE FIRMWARE as soon as you get it online; it's easy to do, but the firmware as-shipped is ludicrously buggy, https basically doesn't work until you've done the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Good low-priced, low featured camera.
Reviews.Author: Michael D Opel
Reviews.Content: Good basic webcam. Very good for price. Easy to install and easy to access remotely thru MyDlink. Res is kind of low and doesn't have a very wide angle.  Also, lack of IR limits its use for security functions

Reviews.Title: Impossible to Install on Win7 or iMac 10.6.8 (Mountain Lion)
Reviews.Author: S. D Helbig
Reviews.Content: I have given up on this camera.  There are three versions of the installation software, none of which works properly.So it appears that this camera has very severe software problems that prevents its use.  It certainly is not worth the purchase price of $94.  It only installs as an x86 and not as a x64 so I think that the software is not designed to be installed on a Windows 7 computer but on Winxp and it will never go in on a Windows 7 PC.  It won't install at all using Firefox.  I could only use IE in my efforts to install the software.I have emailed Dlink twice regarding error messages.  There is a very quick Java error message on the screen but it is only there for a fraction of a second so I cannot read it.  The Java box indicates some kind of applet is missing. I uninstalled Java and installed a update. Still the same thing.  I turned off my firewall.  Still the same thing.  Did a reinstallation.  Still the same thing.And a certificate is necessary, but you can't get it unless you authorize it but there is no way to authorize it.I sent 2 emails to Dlink.  No response except an acknowledgement.I'm not an expert, but I am not a novice either with computer hardware.So far my experience has been very very poor and I don't think I can make this thing work.Maybe I'll order the 89 cent camera that is available.  It should work as well as this one.In any event, I will wait a couple of days to see if Dlink contacts me with a solution or x64 software or something.We'll see.Update: Well another day has gone by and nothing from Dlink.  I tried to install the camera properly again, but just that it just about impossible on a Win7 environment.  I am going to have to return it because I cannot get the software to work properly.  Amazon should mark this item as "FOR DLINK ROUTERS ONLY" AND "NOT FOR WINDOWS 7."  I do not understand how anybody can say installation is easy.  Installation is a nightmare.Further Update:  Another day has past and nothing from Dlink.  I was able to get to the configuration server bypassing the certification problem by "trusting" the configuration site.  I was able to make the software a little more responsive by making it compatible to Vista, but the underlying problem is that there are no drivers for windows 7 for this camera so you just cannot operate it with the software.  Thus it cannot do all the little goodies the manufacturer claims in Windows 7.I thought I would try to install it on my iMac Intel which is an older computer, but the built in webcam on it is spectacular, but this camera needs Java and, CONTRARY TO THE COMMENT PLACED HERE BY DLINK, there is no Java for Mountain Lion 10.6.8, so I am SOL there too and I am not going to upgrade the iMac which I rarely use.I have spent too much time trying to make camera work so it is going back.Moral of the story is:  Don't buy if you are using Windows 7 or Mountain Lion on an IMac.  The camera is not designed for them.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating start but got it going
Reviews.Author: O. Awad
Reviews.Content: I was almost about to return this product to Amazon until I decided to give the WPS with my TimeCapsule a shot!If you are a Mac user you need to setup this product on a Windows machine I used bootcamp. You need to use the enclosed CD wizard which is slow and frustrating (you'd think in 2010 setting up an N network device would be straight forward!). I ran the wizard with the Camera attached to my TimeCapsule router which is really an Airport extreme with built in hard disk multiple times. It found the Camera and allowed me to assign a password to it. It wouldn't identify the internet access (DHCP) in my case. And the most frustrating point was once it scans for the network and I put my password for WPA security it wouldn't go through. I kept getting an error message with an advice to use an Ethernet connected computer to complete the process. I had to move my router to another room to try to do that and still with the same result. I actually gave up and started repackaging to return to Amazon. But I googled WPS connection to see if I can try it. Luckily I could. WPS is a way for you to connect a wireless device to a secured router without entering a password. Most of the time it gives you one to two minutes to press a WPS button on both the device and the router and they connect to each other without having to enter any information. Airport extreme and from my understanding a lot of other routers while not having a physical button to push do have the capability for WPS from the administrative software for the device (check your router manual or google it) . On the Airport extreme you launch the Airport Utility, select your router, Go to manual setup and from the top menu choose base station and then select add wireless client and Click the WPS  on the camera and then the corresponding software button on Airport Utility and just like magic they connect. I wish I knew this before I wasted more than an hour trying to setup a connection with the Ethernet Cable.Once setup you go on with the CD wizard you setup a mydlink.com account and it works. Once you do that you don't need the CD (or windows for that matter) I setup 2 iphones to check on the Pets bedroom which is why we got the camera.The quality is not that impressive but I got it for surveillance and for that it does what it should.The bottom line it does what it says. The setup can be much easier (something for D-link to work on) and most of all if you can use WPS connection and avoid Ethernet cable configuration.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for $30.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Kelley
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth the 30 something dollars I paid for it with only one exception.Picture is good enough for my needs and price.The set up was much easier than I thought it would be based on the reviews.  I didn't have any problems.  Simple.The iphone app works well.The only negative comment is the audio.  Too much static.  If audio is important for you, this is not the camera for you to buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: dianne smith
Reviews.Content: This is a great product!I bought this item to watch my dog to make sure she isn't destroying my house and I couldn't be happier with the purchase.Shipping was fast and installation was even easier.I don't understand the people who are having trouble installing this because you literally sign up on the internet and plug it in.  That's it!You can see during the day and night with sound.  For the price I don't thin you can get a better deal!

Reviews.Title: Good starter cam
Reviews.Author: E_HILLMAN "e_hilllman"
Reviews.Content: Good starter cam for home secirutiy.  Love the my d link page to go view activity and the motion e-mails seem to work fine.  Wish it handled high and low light better.  It does not do well with extremes of either.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup and the App is great
Reviews.Author: J. Jackson
Reviews.Content: The setup for this camera is easy as it gets.  I love that it works remotely using the Dlink Lite app for both my Android and my wife's iPhone.  For the price this camera is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Eyes on
Reviews.Author: Rippedoff
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item as extra eyes with my home security system.  I have 2, one on the kennel and one for inside the garage.  Easy setup on my Note 3 and PCs.  Fun to watch the dogs. I would love to find a doggy cam.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, works just fine. Clear video. Can be put in any place that has an electrical outlet.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Web Cam
Reviews.Author: Michal L. Jones "geomason"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I suspected a teenager I was "babysitting" was eating my food when not home.  I needed some way to confirm my suspisions and this proved to be the ideal inexpensive way to do it.  (It worked btw).  Set up was easy although to get it to work with the wifi took a couple of minutes to decipher the instructions but not hard.  Once "on line" it provides a clear picutre and fair audio portion.  Snapping a picuture can be a bit "tricky" at first but comes along easily after the first couple of attempts.  I've very pleased with the product.  I knew it didn't "record" when I bought it, so if you're looking for a easy "real time" web cam this works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Long Time to Setup
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis Mike
Reviews.Content: Wow!  That took a long while to get working.  My first lesson learned - don't use the enclosed CD.  Go to mydlink.com/support, click to find the right device, and download the Setup Wizard - either Mac or PC.  (There were apparently needed firmware upgrades that prohibited the CD from working properly.)  You need to almost complete your registration before the camera will run.  Also, you need to first make it work from a wired configuration before it will work wirelessly.  I don't remember everything I had to do, but somewhere along the line I had to download and install Java.  I'm trying to use this with SightHound, which presented more obstacles.  The jury is out on how well this works or how useful it is.  One thing is for sure, D-Link's documentation could be a whole lot better.

Reviews.Title: Ordered three, two now working
Reviews.Author: William I. Griffith
Reviews.Content: Handy for checking up on the house.  One died fairly early on.  The feature to alert you via email if image movement ocurs did not work, even after spending a good bit of time with DLink customer support.

Reviews.Title: Great for sale price
Reviews.Author: Craig B. "Dream. Explore. Discover."
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to add some network cameras to my house but had not yet purchased.  Then I saw this camera on sale for about $30 and decided for the price I had to try it.  The setup and configuration of the device was very simple.  I've seen people say they had issues with it, but just plug it in to power and Ethernet and run the setup app.  During the setup, you can choose to configure the wireless and will then be prompted to remove the Ethernet cable.  1-2-3 simple!This camera serves its purpose in the room I have it placed and is easy to access through locally while I am at home, from any browser at the MyDLink website or through apps on my Android and Windows Phone devices.  Only iOS and Android were listed in the Amazon description, but Windows Phone is supported, a huge plus in my book.The sound quality is OK and the video is fair... nothing better should be expected as this is not an HD camera, but if you can catch it on sale as I did and don't need to see every little detail, it's hard to beat.  There are other locations in my house where this camera would not suffice, but for many uses this is just fine.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: Greg Weaver
Reviews.Content: I purchased two camera's initially and then decided to purchase one more.  That along tells  you that they worked as expected, plus they were easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Works Good on My System (Mac) - Easy Set Up
Reviews.Author: David L. Charlesworth
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dismayed to buy this and see Windows system requirements, but went to their website and found a version for Mac OS. Downloaded the app, connected the camera to my router, ran the set-up wizard, and it worked flawlessly. Downloaded the basic viewer for my iPad and that works OK too. I'm going to buy some more of these guys.

Reviews.Title: Best for the money
Reviews.Author: Kevin Depeau
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, so good that I bought another and will buy another one soon. A Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, power cord is too short
Reviews.Author: Greg Olde
Reviews.Content: I have both a 930 and a 942 - the 930 works fine, but the power cord is way too short.  I'm considering extending the wires because in stock form don't give me many locations to mount it.

Reviews.Title: You're on your own
Reviews.Author: Scotty
Reviews.Content: Very confusing in how to view remotely from internet. The instructions are not helpful. I've had it for a month now and I'm still trying to get it to work. And this is supposed yo be one of the easiest to set up?

Reviews.Title: Easy Set up
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: A great surveillance camera and free app for iPhone.  easy set up with any wireless network. Dont waste money on expensive alarm companies and watch your home from your iPhone.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: loveda
Reviews.Content: I really like my camera. It is working very nicely for what I wanted it for . It picks up everything and works nicely with wi fi.

Reviews.Title: Amazed at How Simple It Is To Set Up and Run!!
Reviews.Author: Lucy Ference
Reviews.Content: Don't let the subject line fool you. It was not exactly a piece of cake for me until I happened upon Francesca (ID# AR004277) at D-Link technical support. She very patiently and courteously walked me through the steps necessary to set up my camera. It really IS simple to set up, once you know what you're doing. And, without Francesca's help, I don't think I could have done it alone in a million years!! She is a paragon of customer service in every sense of the word!! Thanks, Francesca, for making what seemed impossible a breath of fresh air!! WOIW!! The camera quality is very good. Now to install the other cameras onto the Cloud! Wish me luck!! :)

Reviews.Title: DLink Customer Support for product setup
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Glusman
Reviews.Content: I am pretty unadept at any sort of set up involving my computer but after calling D-Link Customer Support I was very smoothly walked through the set-up process of my DCS-930L.  Though the set up is probably easy on it's own I personally like taking the stress off of myself by being walked through.  Now that everything was easily set up I look forward to seeing how the camera works!ID #ar004277Case #:c6481639

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: julio
Reviews.Content: great camera REMEMBER no night vision !indoor use only,I have mine enclosed so I can use it in my back yard.easy to set up.Cloud works great !

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: AZ
Reviews.Content: It cover pretty good the function, is a good choice versus more expensive brands. easy to install and access via phone

Reviews.Title: works very well
Reviews.Author: Mark Giovati
Reviews.Content: well I like the D-Link camera and it easy to set up.The phone assistance made the set up very easy.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera . Very nice and cheep solution
Reviews.Author: Shmyak "Shmyak"
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to watch my new born naby and there were planty of expensive solutions for that. My friend bought a camera/screen kit for arround $150, i thought it is too expensive and after a short reserch desided to go for this one. The installation process wasn't that easy, but it worked after all. First I connected this camera to the rauter with the network cord. Then desided to use all the advantages of it and  go wireless. After some hard time with installation it woked out and now i am happy.Camera works well . No need to buy night vision camera for the babby coz there is always some light in the room. You can see and hear the baby no problem. I installed corresponding software on the desktop, laptop, iPad and both my wife's and mine Android. It works perfectly so far, no issues. I can even watch my baby from work or from any other place.Recomended as a cheep solution for survilase and baby watching

Reviews.Title: great help from support person.
Reviews.Author: russell broussard
Reviews.Content: i was able to get great support from d link support person francesca #AR004277 case #C6478263 I was able to get my camera connected to my pc.

Reviews.Title: Did not work. Requests from D-link got a robo ...
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Vinson
Reviews.Content: Did not work. Requests from D-link  got a robo reply but not follow up from them. I will never buy another D-link product again

Reviews.Title: Everyone needs one of these
Reviews.Author: J. Williams "Gdaddy101"
Reviews.Content: I really love this little camera.  Today I figured out how to adjust the camera resolution so the video feed and the motion detection pictures are much, much better.  What I really like is how you can just unplug the camera and move it to another location and it just hooks right up to the wifi without a lot of muss and fuss.  This thing is great to put an eyeball on your property or to just know who is coming and going around your home.  The app you download from Apple and for the droid is really simple to work with.  When I show people around my office how I monitor my house with this camera everyone is shocked when I tell them what the price is for the camera.  I've really had no problems at all using this camera, and may get another one to monitor different locations around my home.  You can't go wrong with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works with Synology and that's what matters for me.
Reviews.Author: Coffeehouse
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to monitor the front room of my house and record that using the Synology system, which works perfectly so far.Pro:Small and concealable in our curio cabinet.Works with Synology.Cons:Image quality is of the price range I purchased it for, not great, but i didn't spend a lot either.Instructions do not point out that the MAC address is shared between LAN and WiFi, which I needed as I use MAC authentication on my WiFi network. This resulted in a call to D-Link, which went well and was completed in less than 15 minutes. I reviewed the operator with high marks for their attitude and thoroughness.I will not purchase another of these due to the image quality. This is my first IP camera and I had assumed a higher image quality that what was presented, my fault but I have no previous experience in this regard.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: hmongPop
Reviews.Content: It's pretty solid in the design and ease of use. I was more looking for something real-time but for the price, its pretty good.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera
Reviews.Author: u23fan
Reviews.Content: Easy installation and easy app to see it on the smartphone. The only reason why I don't give it 5 stars is because if I'm to move it from room to room (which we often need to do), you need to resync both the camera and the router, which is a bit of a headache, really. I wish it would find the network by itself and resync with the router without additional steps.

Reviews.Title: its cool
Reviews.Author: Richard Reid
Reviews.Content: Worth the purchase...Design: design gets 8/10 looks good even though plastic.Functionality: 8/10 does what it is suppose to do, love the mydlink website and bandwith and FPS is good.Bang for buck: 8/10 looking for an Ip cam...this might work for you

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Jose Moreno
Reviews.Content: I purchase this product to be able to check on my house and see what our dog do when we are out working. We have no child at this moment so we only need to track our dog.The app from dlynk is awesome, the quality of the image, depending on your bandwidth is great. You have one way audio (you can hear what's going on but they can't hear you), using the app you can put a motion sensor and receive a message on you phone, tablet or device to check the situation and the installation is done with 3 simple steps. For the price of this product I recommend it, if you want more video quality or night vision, this is not the right product for you.

Reviews.Title: Wifi connection didnt work
Reviews.Author: BorisTheBear
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on the phone with D-link customer diservice trying to figure out how to connect the camera via wifi. Nothing worked. Not worth the head ache. Product was returned

Reviews.Title: dont buy D-link  cloud camera  dcs 933L
Reviews.Author: FIRSTCLASSUSAA
Reviews.Content: D-link support by phone  waiting time is  35 min  & then they pick up the phone &  hang up the phone.  now you call .....5  times......so i called the paid phone number and waited 1 min  & they pick up the phone but want your credit card for any help.  D-link support by phone was awful to deal with (poor english, unable to understand the problem, poor troubleshooting...etc)

Reviews.Title: Bad batch?
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Cobb "dj"
Reviews.Content: The camera would work for a day or so and then it would go "offline". The only way to get it back was to pull the power cord and restart it. I returned it and got another one and it did the same thing. Just didn't work for more than 36 hours.

Reviews.Title: Would Not Connect Using Setup Guide
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Tried connecting using the included software. Could not find camera... Ended up going into router settings and finding IP address of individual camera. Configured it that way but now I can not create a mydlink account... The only way to view is by port forwarding etc... I have a CCNA and work with a tech company. I am very tech savy and this camera would not connect for some reason
