Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have several of these cameras and I love them, the price is really good, the day/night models I have really don't work well at night.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this network based camera, works as expected. No delays. Only the down point of this item is less resolution.

Reviews.Title: Its Ok depending...
Reviews.Author: P. Fields
Reviews.Content: Depends on what you need it for. I bought a couple to set up in my home while it was on the market for sale. I concealed them in picture frames and hoped to get information from what buyers thought of the house during the showings. It was moderately easy to set up with the disks. The picture quality is reasonable, but the sound is questionable. It records well but inconsistently. I would find that it breaks and lose bits of every few words. Definitely needs better sound, but for the most part, price considered, I would recommend for general purpose use.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: mgtprofessor
Reviews.Content: This is my second D-Link camera. It works well. However, it does not have the ability to move the camera in different directions. I was very pleased with customer service. However, I would recommend Wansview camera over this.

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: smlprop
Reviews.Content: purchased one camara and liked it so much i bought 2 more, the pic quality on phone is fine, on computer so-so but it does the job. easy set up, only complaint is no night vision but at the price not a problem. i reccomend.

Reviews.Title: Great quality.
Reviews.Author: Scott House
Reviews.Content: We had a great deal of difficulty with installation. Once we contacted tech support they took us step by step to get connected. We have DSL and I do notice a significent reduction in speed though. The picture is perfect during the day but not at night.

Reviews.Title: not simple, customer service phone disconnects.
Reviews.Author: old man dan "dan"
Reviews.Content: i have no idea if the camera works or not. the  other d link i had worked most the time, but the infered led's bouncing off the window  blinded it, so i got this supposed extended range camera, sans ifr. the d-link box says SIMPLE SETUP i have had two (2) real geeks work on this SIMPLE SETUP system for 2 years now and it still does not work correctly. i am now getting unauthorized access block.when i call customer service they say i have a 20 minute wait then hang up.the extended range booster i also got is blocking my wife from groin on the internet even when its not plugged in now.

Reviews.Title: A ROYAL PAIN.
Reviews.Author: Tom Robbins
Reviews.Content: The instructions told me to push the WPS button on my router.  This disconnected every wireless device in my house, which was a royal pain to rectify.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Simple combination of video and audio. I have a net of 9 items in my office. I did wired them..
Reviews.Author: victor torres
Reviews.Content: Excellent simple combination of video and audio. I installed 9 pcs that I see on my laptop.I preferred wired them because there is a lot of steel and concrete in the building.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: King W Chan
Reviews.Content: Setup not too difficult to do.  Motion detect and email notification function OK.  Picture quality is poor; whitewash in sunny days.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Willie Ramos Genes
Reviews.Content: The IP Camera aduerco behaves with the technical specifications of the manufacturer and the statement by the seller. Meet the need for which the acquired. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Has audio glitches/noise, bad in low-light, forces user to enter a password... but has good image quality
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I have a few Foscams, an old Zonet, and a newer Granstream IP cameras.  I have them in a variety of indoor spots, and have used some of them for years.Pros:* Has good image quality* It's *very* small* Has been very reliable over wifi (most wifi cameras seem to have issues)* Has a very good web UICons:* There is a glitch in the audio where it has a ton of noise* Can't easily integrate with some camera software, since this camera always requires a password on the MJPEG streams* No IR or low-light capability.  In darkness, you just see a black screen (some other non-IR cameras can at least see some low-light).If the audio worked, this would be 5 stars.  It's amazingly cheap & small, perfect for small monitoring.  But the audio contains some digital background noise, rendering it nearly useless for baby monitoring or clear listening.  Most people wont need this, but it's a known issue and very annoying.  Some background: the noise happens even with wifi disabled.  It's not (that I can tell) a power-related problem.  It appears to be digital (not analog) interference, like a sampling issue.  And it has a regular interval of silence every 10seconds or so, which makes me think there is some overlap with the 60hz cycle power and the audio encoding that don't quite match up.  Guesswork there, but this isn't "move it around and get static".  It's just part of the electronics.Also - it would be great to loop this into camera software so that I can monitor it along with other cameras in my house.  However, my foscams can take username/password in the URL itself, but this camera cannot (indeed, I can find almost no information about integrating this camera's CGI/API), so it's harder to work with vs. the foscams.Overall; if the audio worked, this would be the perfect cheap non-IR fixed wifi camera.  But this is a pretty big glitch; they should fix it.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Bobby thomas cherian
Reviews.Content: The setup is simple , the pic is not all that great. Does the job so no complains.Would recommend it as a low end solution.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I have this configured as my second camera.  When it detects motions it uploads pictures to my external ftp service (exavault).  I gave up setting time periods for detecting and uploading motion. (my first camera which works at night is setup the same way)Setting this up is a hassle but it's sort of working in a compromised way.  The good news is that other security hardware and vendors are a complete nightmare.The day camera (vs night/day) has some inherent issues with partial light.Part of the software problems comes from using browsers and Java for the setup and viewing.  If you're running Chrome the latest Java doesn't work.  Putting the previous version is an issue on Mac.  Also, you have to add IP or DNS exceptions for the Java security which is tricky.  I ended up starting the setup at home on the mac and finishing it at work on my windows machine.It's confusing why you have different ways to access the camera and setup.  One through mydlink and another directly to the camera IP.  I gave up mydlink since there were many requirements to get the second camera added.  Fortunately, the direct IP does the job even though it looks like it's an advanced setup screen.You'll need a good understanding of router port forwarding if you have multiple cameras.On another note, for 20 bucks more the day/night camera is worth some serious consideration over this one.The picture quality is ok (not great).  The wide angle is fairly limited.  It is nice an compact and easy to screw into the wall.  The light indicators are accurate and it boots up fast.  It's small and discrete.And heck... if it doesn't work at all who cares.  If it's in plain view it's still a deterent lolI like it and it's mostly doing what it says it does.  Lucky I'm an engineer otherwise I would have tossed it off the terrace :)In a real world it's probably worth 3 stars but on a curve it's worth 4.Please read this feedback D-Link.  And don't defer problems to browsers and java.  Ultimately, if the customer isn't happy it's your problem too.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value for money
Reviews.Author: M. Suidan "Marco"
Reviews.Content: I initially ordered more expensive cameras but then found these on amazon. For the price, they work very well. Limitations compared to $200 dropcam is smaller range of view, and no night time visibility.

Reviews.Title: It serves my purpose
Reviews.Author: Careshopper
Reviews.Content: If nothing else, the camera serves as a deterrent to 'shady' characters.  I also like that I can easily move it around.

Reviews.Title: After finally figuring out how to get it to work...
Reviews.Author: Loving It! "Mary"
Reviews.Content: I'm giving it a three star because it was pretty hard to get it to work. The instructions weren't clear, and I was stuck with a read light for days and there is not working tech support number. But once I figured it out, all on my own it works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Not at all easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: Cindy Wolfe
Reviews.Content: Could not get the camera to recognize my wi-fi router.  Emailed support and got a "we received your question and will get back to you."  They have never gotten back to me.  I had a tech savvy co-worker come over and help me, and it took her over 2 hours to get it set up...

Reviews.Title: Good picture.  Reliable.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We have a half dozen of these or so at work for remote monitoring of processes, so I bought this one for home use.  Setup was easy enough and once connected to the wireless, it hasn't failed me yet.  The picture is very clear and the colors are vibrant.  Mounting options are plentiful.  I have mine mounted to the bottom of a shelf.  For a simple, reliable, and relatively inexpensive webcam, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: worth it
Reviews.Author: Shira Gray
Reviews.Content: It works great, does exactly what I needed it to do, no issues at all, glad I made this purchase

Reviews.Title: OK for some things I guess
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I bought this for general use around the house and planned to point it out a window to view activities in the front yard. The problem is that if it sees _anything_ lighted by the sun, the picture just bleaches out to all white. I know it is advertised as an indoor product but even sun light coming in through a window has this effect (who has no windows in their houses?). I connects to my wireless stuff fine so that is a plus. I am currently undecided between sending it back or considering how cheap it was, just to keep it for some other general utility use.

Reviews.Title: Setup is a headache, and they suck up all your wireless, but great for home security
Reviews.Author: RMS "mariposa70"
Reviews.Content: Setup is a pain in the butt.  However, if you have a brilliant techie brother like me, once they are setup, it's a real convenience to be able to keep an eye on second homes via my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jenny Hamons
Reviews.Content: I now have five 932L cameras. I can view remotely day or night. It also has audio. The support staff is great. I have never been able to simply connect to my wireless. All I do is call the support number. I get connected with a real person mostly within 5 minutes. They lead me through the connection procedure. Everytime I have a connection. I love this product.

Reviews.Title: OK for novelty purposes and at $30, it has uses. But overall experience is so 2008
Reviews.Author: M. McCrystal
Reviews.Content: OK for novelty purposes and those with more time than money. 640x480 video/stills are oh-so-very 2008, as is the Dlink web configuration app (I don't think it's substantially changed in 5+ years). Picture quality ok for broad, undetailed scenes and maybe watching your pet nap on a couch, but certainly not for meaningful facial identification (e.g. security purposes). Now that HD video is so commonplace on phones and even cheap laptops, the low-res nature of this camera is a let down.No facility to embed streaming video into a web page without a lot of trickery most people won't have the time, patience, or skill to exploit. Video feed on the MyDlink page is marginally reliable. Only sends images by email or FTP (FTP?!) Don't even dream about hooking up to those fancy, modern tools like Dropbox and GoogleDrive all them young whippersnappers are using these days. (sure you can roll your own IFTT but again, if you have more time than money....)Hopeless to set up on a MacOS workstation... you will be presented with endless Java warnings, errors, and admonitions to install an older version of Java (seriously?). Fortunately, I was able to use a Parallels virtual machine to bypass that headache. But seriously.I bought four 930's to install at some remote lodges where it might be fun to see the grounds on our website. For $30-ish bucks I guess its OK but given where everything else is at on your phone, on the web, even in your car, the Dlink experience feels anything but well-put-together.I'll end on a positive note: these are surprisingly small and light... flip-phone-esque.

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Duane L. Pedersen "DuckfanO"
Reviews.Content: Works good enough. Wish it had a two way mic, but other than that it's what I expected. For an inexpensive camera you can't go wrong up with this. I'm going to by a more expensive one that will rotate and has mic, but am going to by another one of these for areas that I won't need anything more than a stationary camera

Reviews.Title: Does a reasonable job for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael Thomas
Reviews.Content: It takes some configuring on your PC, but in the end you will get a low-res view of the area you want to monitor.  Note that it comes with a wall wart power supply, so there is no decent way to conceal the power wiring.

Reviews.Title: Horrible and inconsistent
Reviews.Author: Christine Kirk
Reviews.Content: I just got this a few days ago, and specifically wanted it for the motion detection. First I had some trouble setting it up because I have a Mac so instead of the CD I had to download a program to install it, as well as downloading Java to view the video stream online. It took me about an hour of messing around with the "advanced settings" to finally get it to send me emails regarding motion detection, and then it worked for about an hour. After that I could wave my arms right in front of it and it still wouldn't detect anything. I finally just tried to reset it, but now it won't let me find it to re-register it. I am just having so much trouble with this camera even though I'm actually a very tech-savvy person! Not sure why mine doesn't seem to be working consistently but I definitely would not recommend this camera to anyone else. You really do get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Not working at all
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: No matter wireless or wire, it seems linked to the internet but just cannot see it from website interface or the laptop (tried on windows and Mac). The company didn't give useful response. Not suggested.

Reviews.Title: Works Amazing
Reviews.Author: Christian Wood
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. Didn't have any problems with it. Im hoping to get another one soon. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera but beware of wireless extender setup
Reviews.Author: VJ
Reviews.Content: I've been in technology for almost 20 years and my forte is networking so I am not a novice here. While setup was very easy, be *very* careful of configuring the wireless extender under the SAME SSID as your existing wireless network. I don't know what the heck happened but it completely hosed-up my entire wireless network to where I had to blow away and redo several wireless devices. When I set it up under a DIFFERENT SSID, everything was great. I just set up profiles on all my devices to connect to each SSID and they jump onto the best signal for the most part. As for the camera quality, I'd say the picture was darn good for the price. Can't complain there. The whole java plugin thing was annoying because it doesn't work under Internet Explorer without significant pain so I just use Chrome instead. Not a big deal for me. The motion detection works fine and the audio is decent. Overall, I believe this is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: BILL
Reviews.Content: Constantly having to reconnect using wireless. Next stop the circular file. This is a low end camera that's not worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Day/Night
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my childs room to monitor them in the crib. Was a breeze to setup using the included software and connected to my network quickly.. Made a free dlink account and now I can monitor the crib anywhere..The quality is very good and the sound pickup is much better than I expected for this unit.Overall excellent wifi cam!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Prisoner zero
Reviews.Content: Decent enough camera for the price. Set up was fairly simple and straight forward. Audio is passable. Video is decent enough. If you want options this probably isn't for you. If your looking for simple and utilitarian then this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: it's a good choice !
Reviews.Author: Guillermo L.
Reviews.Content: I bought the second one and so far is good! The only problem is that the Wifi signal is not too strong.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ari overby
Reviews.Content: I love this camera the picture is great and it even has sound. Best camera for the price. I have two and probably will get a third.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Natchios
Reviews.Content: Its a simple and economic way to keep an eye on what you care at home. Lets face it the image quality its not the greatest of its kind, its like a webcam, but for the price im guessing its fine. Its dependable and affordable.

Reviews.Title: setting new password? limit is 8 digits
Reviews.Author: D. Hg
Reviews.Content: if you are setting a new admin password, there's a limit of 8 characters.  I didn't know this at first and didn't use the setup CD, and after setting a long password I can't access the device, tried multiple times. Till I used the setup CD and saw my original long password got truncated, I realized the 8 digit limit.3 stars considering the overall performance.if you are considering getting a ip camera, maybe those with pan/tilt is better fit. they do cover a much bigger area, so even twice the price, it might function as many as 5 cams really b/c the pan/tilt.

Reviews.Title: Fun and functional cameras!
Reviews.Author: S. Pigford
Reviews.Content: We use three of these handy little things to monitor a mountain cabin. Two are aimed out windows front and back, and the third is set to view an internal thermometer. With the motion-detection email feature, we have a number of photos capturing animals, including a moose. Fun! The inside camera sends me several overnight pictures that have reassured me about the inside temperature's staying OK after some heater issues. We can of course look at any time to see the current outside (and inside) weather conditions.A recent Dlink website update and new camera firmware (easy to install), have greatly enhanced the viewing with larger, even full-screen views and easier access to functions such as motion detection areas and sensitivity.We've had no technical problems, though some settings were hard to do, but all this seems recently fixed with the new website and firmware. Also, smartphone viewing is possible, even with a Windows (Nokia) app!Great, inexpensive solution to our distant monitoring needs.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L Camera
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the fairly low price and the fact that i didn't need nighttime viewing. I have some Samsung Smartcams that have IR. The D-Link serves my purpose, but the image is not as sharp as the image from the Samsungs. It was fairly easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and works great
Reviews.Author: Sheila Clover
Reviews.Content: I put off setting it up because I thought I'd have to read a manual to get it all going. That was not the case. It was pretty easy to get it set up and to get the app on my iphone.  The only problem I have with it is now I'm addicted to spying on my dogs!! LOL  I do a lot of animal rescue and fostering and now I can keep an eye on my own dogs and the new foster dogs all day long and from anywhere! This has been such a successful purchase I plan on getting another one!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Jaime 1969
Reviews.Content: First I want to say thank you to all of the people who have left reviews of this product.  They were quite helpful in understanding why the setup was difficult.As many reviews pointed out...the firmware on the camera and the sofware on the CD are not up to date.  So to get it to work wirelessly I had to go to the Dlink website to upgrade the firm from 1.00 to 1.09.  Also had to download an updated version of the installation wizard so it could locate my router.  One I performed these functions, I was able to get the camera to work with my wireless router.Definitely not a high quality picture...and has everyone has said the sound quality is very poor.  That being said it works quite well for what I need it to do - a pet moniter.  I sometimes have to leave my dog home alone 10-12 hours.  Now from my laptop or Galaxy S4...I can check on him when I need some piece of mind,  I just ordered a second on for my bedroom...as he likes to crash on my bed on occasion.One last point, seems everyone slams the Dlink support hotline.  My experience was really positive.  They answered in about 4 minutes and walked me through the setup process in about 10 minutes.  Was an out of country support line, but to be expected nowdays.For $35 direclty from Amazon....a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: R. Carmichael
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera so I could keep an eye on my mother when I am not able to be home.  I have now purchased three more, this is an excellent cam and is so simple to set up it is unbelievable.  Definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Typical D-Link
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D. Potter "Ken"
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with the hardware, just the company.  But, the setup disk I received had a star in it and wouldn't run.  I contacted customer service via email.  After a day, they got back to me and gave me a point to a web page that had the setup software on it.  After setup, the product worked just fine.  I went to the My D-Link website, created an account and set up motion detection and email notification.  This is where things started to go really bad.  I started to receive an email every five minutes.  I thought, "well it is just the motion detection being super sensitive".  That night, I turned off the ceiling fan and went to bed.  The next morning there were 123 emails in my inbox.  I went back to My D-Link and shut off motion detection and notifications (yes, I did hit save at the bottom of the page).  This did not stop the torrent of emails.  Then I contacted D-Links support and told them what was happening.  No response.  I went back to My D-Link and double checked the settings.  I reset the motion detector window to nothing.  No help.  Finally, I unplugged the device to stop the torrent of email.  I waited for D-Link to respond to my request for help.  Nothing.  After a couple of days, I sent another request detailing all the above.  Nothing.  I plugged it back in to see if the loss of power to the unit had changed anything.  Torrent of email started right back up.So, typical D-Link - Hardware is just fine, but God help you if you need help, because you sure won't get it from D-Link.

Reviews.Title: Work better than expected
Reviews.Author: Mark O'Dell
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, better than expected. I will purchase more of them in the future for different applications as needs arise

Reviews.Title: Highly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Roy V.
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras a couple years ago, and from the very start they were problematic.  First they wouldn't link up to my wireless network, so I got on the phone to D-Link support, and after over two hours on the phone the best they could do was set it up so it would work on my wireless network but not on the internet.  In other words, I could only access the cameras when my pc was hooked up to the same wireless network that the cameras were on, which is basically useless.  After some more wrangling over the next couple months I finally got the cameras to work properly, in the meantime discovering that the audio quality was so poor as to be virtually useless.  If someone was talking in the room I could only hear a garbled sound with no chance of understanding what was being said, and there was more background hiss than there was actual audio.  An then the firmware upgrades began...I had to upgrade the firmware (the website won't let you view the video until you do), which meant uninstalling the camera and power supply and taking them to the wireless router because it requires wired connections between the camera, router, and PC.  While upgrading seemed to go fairly well, the uninstalling and re-installing took time and effort that I really didn't need to be spending.  Then a week later I tried to access the camera over the net, and ANOTHER firmware upgrade had to be done, which meant going through the entire process all over again.  I'm so disgusted with these cameras that I'm going to just throw them away rather than go through the entire upgrading mess all over again--if I'm going re-install my cameras I'd just as soon do it with new ones from a different manufacturer.  I don't recommend these, especially if you want to hear what's going on the room.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for the money.
Reviews.Author: Stephen C Pyle
Reviews.Content: It works as designed. A little difficult to set up if your a novice, but works well. I love the text messages to my phone when the camera detects motion or sound. Peace of mind goes along way!

Reviews.Title: Working for a year now
Reviews.Author: P. Krumpter
Reviews.Content: I have had multiple ones of these for over a year, generally they work well. They are inside looking out. I have some floodlights outside. When I tried the ones with infra red night vision, they were blinded by hitting the window. Even minimal outdoor lighting is enough for these to work well at night from inside.

Reviews.Title: Sooo much easier to setup the the Belkin!!!
Reviews.Author: Paxinbel
Reviews.Content: I bought a belkin and it was a pain in the butt to set up.  You have to set up a 3rd party ip redirect, etc etc.  took for ever and a pain.  The d-link was super simple.  Basically put in your email and it set everything up for you on a d-link site.  The picture quality is not great but works fine.  For the price and easy of use it's a great product

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: D-link cameras are good quality, they offer a range of settings and features. If you are looking into buying an Ip camera, purchase a D-link over the cheap off brand ones. Setup can be confusing, but I figured it out. If you need any help D-link is always glad to help.... This is a good camera, but buy the night vision camera over this one.

Reviews.Title: decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Scott A Stelling
Reviews.Content: good value for the price, works well, although the night vision isn't as strong.  easy to setup and get going

Reviews.Title: Limited use
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: Can't record anything.  Had to buy a different router to set it up.  Yes I am a novice.  Does have good picture.  Micrphone doesn't pick up as well as I would like.  Have a second one and yet to get it connected to the network.  The one button setup not quite that.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money and more
Reviews.Author: Dave B-35405 "hi sir hi"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money, easy to setup and looks OK when viewing with the remote software on my Cell Phone. Here is a tip tho.. When you setup this camera use the CD that  comes with the camera. The App that you can download for setup doesn't work as good as the CD that comes with the camera. After useing this camera for two days I bought another one.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: David C wehunt
Reviews.Content: Does what I needed.  However instructions are not very clear and need to set up camera separately from internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Had some issues with this camera too at first like others did.
Reviews.Author: CyberSaver
Reviews.Content: But Amazon came to the rescue, and actually  got a rep on the phone at D-Link while I was on the line with Amazon. Thanks Amazon, kudos! Because I could never get through to them before that! One time I got through, and they put me on hold for over an hour playing that horrible audio tape! I finally hung up and contacted Amazon. OK, after that call, and that day and once I had a reference number with D-Link,  I was magically and luckily able to get through to them and get some  actual help sometimes (there seems to be a trick on what time of day you call them). One time a rep there (in India I guess?) seemed totally clueless of my issues, nor was he much help. The communication on his part was very bad. I then got a female rep there who was a lot more educated on the system and more aware, and nicer. She was the one who helped me get my cameras up and running.  So to make a long story short, the cameras are up and running nicely, (for now).  With a clear picture. Yeah! Hooray! But I don't really want to get excited too soon. Had another maker camera die on me in less than a year! Oh, and I still haven't been able to get the D-Link app on my smart phone. Guess I'll be calling D-Link back again for that matter. Anyway, good luck with your D-Link cameras too buyers.  :>)

Reviews.Title: works but can't see video outside my home
Reviews.Author: MikeNewark "Mike"
Reviews.Content: It works, when i'm on my local wifi network, but if i try to access via my iphone, can't see video or connect. Setup was difficult.

Reviews.Title: good value camera
Reviews.Author: cooper
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty hooking this up wirelessly at first, but then followed the advice offered by others posting reviews for this camera. I logged into my Netgear router and it had a wps button I could push on the computer monitor screen, and then I pushed the one on the camera within 10 seconds and the wifi synced up right away. Wish I had of tried that first. The app works great! I downloaded it on my android phone. I can check in and see what's going on at home anytime I want. The pictures are pretty clear and I can adjust them using the mydink website. I also have the motion detector set so that I receive 6 screen shots by email whenever movement activates the camera. I can adjust when I want these sent. That's pretty handy! I like this camera and ordered a second one.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality u get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Hondagal
Reviews.Content: The quality and sound is very poor and there is no recording optionLike they say you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: I've used other slink cameras for security at home. We set this one up for our daughter to monitor their newborn. Audio and video is excellent. Give us grand parents the ability to check in on our grand daughter as well. Security setup was a snap.Only draw back is the sensor that determines if it's color or it is not sensitive enough in our application, due to the brightness of the room. I wouldn't call this a flaw in the camera but more the room we are using it.We still can manually switch from one mode to another.Great product!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive camera does its job
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine. The audio quality is less than ideal and it seems to be a issue across many d-link models w/ no solution.Pro:Very easy to setup (had to be wire to the router for the initial setup)Does not require a computer for storage(I set it to upload to online cloud cam storage via ftp)This is probably the cheapest nanny cam solution anyone can find - many others are 3~5x the price.ConsThere's a constant static in the audio feed, especially noticeable when the room is quiet. Doesn't seem to be a defective product, as many online users complained about this and no solution could be found.Wish listWould like to have a even wider viewing angle - I put it to a corner of the room, there's a 20-30 degrees blind spot.There's a LED indicator on the front. It's usually solid green and blinks when I'm viewing live feed on mydlink.com. This is a bit annoying and especially if you want it to be somewhat concealed. I wish there's a way to disable the LED lights (in the end I covered the LED w/ couple layers of stickers).Overall, if you just want to monitor daytime activity in the house (nanny, burglary, etc.) then this will do the job just fine at a fraction of the cost of higher end models.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected, but not good if you need a detailed image...
Reviews.Author: Karl R Adams
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy to set up, color quality is good, works as expected, decent value for the low price...Cons: Image quality is very low, especially in low light. Even in bright light you can't make out facial features if the camera is set up more than 10 feet or so from the subject matter.  Android app does not appear to work.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Sucks BIG TIME very dissapointed with Dlink
Reviews.Author: A.M
Reviews.Content: Gave it 1 star because could not give it zero.although the picture quality and video quality is very good the sensitivity control and motion detection is for the birds...even at lowest setting I was bombarded with image emails and could not configure it to work properly.about the only thing good about this camera is live view if you like staring at the screen all day

Reviews.Title: good camara, no night vision, but does the job as advertised
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Really easy setup and works as advertised.  I had a small issue, and kinda still do with the email function...where it e-mails you a picture per your setup...but over all the camera works just as advertised.  I have it plugged in 24/7 and so far so good.  Purchased 2 more from e-bay as they were a little bit cheaper (2 for 55 bucks, for the exact camera, new).  love the ability to view from my android phone when away from home as well.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for under $60.00
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price.  Easy setup.  The sound monitoring is a nice feature too.  Its nice to be able to check in on things via mobile phone.

Reviews.Title: good for real time viewing
Reviews.Author: Jeff "Stem"
Reviews.Content: this works and is easy to setup but it does not record.  I thought it some how recorded but guess that is diff model.  I think this would be good for like a baby monitor or something where you just want to watch a certain area for a short period of time.  The app seemed to work pretty well and viewing online was pretty easy also.

Reviews.Title: D-Link is the WORST
Reviews.Author: peter conova
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of these cameras for use inside the home. Within 1 month, one camera stopped working and Amazon replaced it. Within 6 months the second camera stopped working. I attempted to fix this camera thru Dlink's technical support desks for 5 months before giving up. Dlink would constantly transfer me to a different department and place me on hold for up to 30 minutes at a time in other words their technicians were incompetent and customer service did not want to issue an RMA. In the end, Amazon Customer service offered to replace the defective camera even though it was not their responsibility. I highly recommend Amazon Customer Service but I would NEVER recommend buying any Dlink product!

Reviews.Title: Great cameras for the price
Reviews.Author: Elect. Eng.
Reviews.Content: I have three of these cameras linked to the dlink cam view software.  All three function well.  Motion alerts are sent to my email account. One is in Florida monitoring my back door with an indoor/outdoor thermometer in its field of view to keep an eye on my a/c and in house humidity.Two in MA monitor my front and back door with another weather station in the field of view so conditions can be monitored.The system has only been running for 6 months, but so far so good.All cameras are inside with cfl's on 24/7 to provide illumination.  Primitive, but it does what I want.All three cameras are on wireless networks using Linksys 1200 routers.  All three provide motion control.Camera  Firmware Version 1.06 (2012-08-15)Setting up the cameras is needlessly complicated.  Having to use Java to setup motion sensitivity is just plain silly.4 stars because of setup software.

Reviews.Title: Easy Install and user friendly
Reviews.Author: Yon Ching Huang
Reviews.Content: Easy set up and the Dlink Cloud management is pretty user friendly. Built in functions are very diverse and useful.

Reviews.Title: My only complaint are
Reviews.Author: MAURICIO GANEM
Reviews.Content: It's very easy to setup all cameras, the  android app it's ok.My only complaint are about the image quality and the angle viewer.you cannot move the camera, so It show have a better angle like 180.and the quality it's very bad.

Reviews.Title: great brand but beware
Reviews.Author: papalas
Reviews.Content: this was the cheapest unit I could find. I am happy with the seller but this has to be upgraded and the software is more complicated than Chinese cursive.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera if you can pick it up cheaply and DON'T want to get motion detection notices
Reviews.Author: Brian McL
Reviews.Content: The camera works ok in good light, and the IOS apps have gotten much better for this camera..  The main issue I have is the web management to send alerts when motion is detected will NOT work on any of my computers mac, linux, windows, using ie, safari, firefox, opera, chrome, or seamonkey..If you just want to view, and don't want proactive alerts, this is a decent camera.

Reviews.Title: All good but Wifi.
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Good image quality,, easy to mount, worked great wired, Wireless was very dodgy. My older version of this camera the dcs 920 had none of the wireless issues this one did. For my needs it was a big enough issue I returned it.

Reviews.Title: A bit tricky to setup but works well once it is
Reviews.Author: Matthew C. Grohgans
Reviews.Content: The setup can be a bit tricky. An IP camera viewer application on my android phone was able to connect without issue. An IP camera viewer app on my PC was not able to connect. UPNP is enabled on my router and the port I had chosen (86) was being forwarded via UPNP. There was an additional port (554, RTSP, Real Time Streaming Protocol) that also needed to be manually forwarded in the router. The router is running DD-WRT. I'm not sure why the cameras UPNP did not forward port 554 also. Once added manually the PC app is able to see realtime video.

Reviews.Title: Easy web cam
Reviews.Author: St Anne "VA Career Woman"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use, and love the easy mydlink site to watch when away from home. Picture okay.

Reviews.Title: I SEE YOU!
Reviews.Author: Savvy Shopper "Steph G."
Reviews.Content: This was an inexpensive alternative to other wireless cameras. It came as a recommendation from a friend. Use it to watch the dogs all day log and remotely on our iPhones and computers at work. Simple install. Keeps you signed in. I wish there was more of a rotating mount to put on the wall from behind instead of a post but it works fine just sitting on the window sill.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Sal Castillo
Reviews.Content: Great for the prize. works great, a few minor glitches on viewing, actually an easy setup.  recommend it .. ..

Reviews.Title: Bad Motion Detection,and bad support.
Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: The only good part of this camera is the wireless connection to my wi-fi, it have not dropped a connection since I installed it more than 2 weeks ago.Bad part,1. the motion detection is out of control, it keeps recording and sending me a Motion Detected email when nobody else is around,  I don;t know what triggers the camera, it sends and records about 15-20 times in about 6 hours.This is a problem for both of my 2 cameras.Since i can't control this problem, even after trying different settings on the sensitivity.i plug them both into a timer to minimize the files on my Hard Drive and my email notifications.2. Night vision is bad, Cameras view is so narrow.3.  I have sent 2 message to the DLINK Company support and after a week, nobody is interested in addressing this problem.Is anybody out there have a solution to this Motion Detection malfunction?

Reviews.Title: Wish I had gotten night view
Reviews.Author: Charnell Temple "LadyFlyer"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, works in the light only - if it is even semi dark, you will get nothing but sound.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: jasanpa77
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it's so easy to install and set up and I can use it anytime, anywhere in the world!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not perfect for every application
Reviews.Author: whit1t "Tony"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to add to my POS computer system in my automotive lube business, to view license plate numbers on the back of vehicles entering the building. The camera works just as it's supposed to. However, in order to get a good image of a license plate, the camera would have to be mounted in a position that cannot be attained. So I'll install it at my house to spy on the pets while I'm away all day.

Reviews.Title: An OK camera
Reviews.Author: R. Traini
Reviews.Content: video is choppy.  And the camera requires a lot of light.  It's not bad,  Just don't expect to stream video from it

Reviews.Title: Not what you expect from reading the specifications.
Reviews.Author: Byers
Reviews.Content: This camera is fine for the basic person. first, It says it will display 640 X 480. That's true, if and only if you are viewing it from your own local network. Other wise if you are logged in somewhere other than your house it will be 320 X 240, which is one sorry resolution. Also, it sets up easy, but don't expect to EVER change anything after the first setup. Does't work with other Apps. I have 4 other cameras that i view with one app, but have to switch to ONLY Dlink app to view this camera. My advice is spend a little more and get a Foscam. You get pan and tilt and MUCH MUCH better resolution. I am sure there is others that work well too. I just have 4 foscams and have had no problems. They are a little harder to set up, but they also do a LOT more cool things..

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, Better than a Trendnet TV-IP110WN
Reviews.Author: Hakan Kisin
Reviews.Content: Good product. Camera set up easily out of the box on my Win7/64 system. The picture quality is also ok with a constant red or blue line that scrolls on screen. Makes it look like a "security camera" and is tolerable.

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Larry Rondeau
Reviews.Content: This is my second D-Link wireless camera. Neither of them worked for me. I have spent over 2 hours with D-Link technical support (Ticket#C6374841). Today I held for 30 minutes, then D-Link's system hung up on me. I called back and have been on hold for 65 minutes as of right now. Is this D-Link's idea of good service?

Reviews.Title: skip
Reviews.Author: HappyConsumer "justanid"
Reviews.Content: Terrible.  I returned it the next day.terrible wifi range. Terrible server. It can't handle multiple concurrent connections.. no no

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Shobee
Reviews.Content: The motion detection is very sensitive to light. No matter what threshold you set it on. It send many false alarm emails. But the rest is great.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Toni King
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the quality of the picture and range of the lens.  It made everything seem much farther away than in reality.  Also disappointed that it didn't have an ap for Windows smartphone.

Reviews.Title: DLink cam review
Reviews.Author: William E. Mitchell "Kickasscigartool"
Reviews.Content: Works perfect!  Love to be able to see our back yard in Tahoe!  Note to self-- if you are on a VPN- turn it off to 'build' this.

Reviews.Title: Does not work well on wireless network
Reviews.Author: BC & VP
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to set up. Does not work on my wireless network. So, I had to plug into an ethernet port.I bought the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera and it's way better. The Foscam was easy to setup and it's working great on my wireless network. And the Foscam has two way audio also.

Reviews.Title: Great, simple to setup camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mikeklement.com"
Reviews.Content: Already bought and reviewed the dlink pan and tilt version of this. I have been playing with IP cameras for years and the normal IP camera is a long, tedious process to get setup, configured and working. I wanted an IP camera that i dont have to do that anymore, this was it. Worked great, installed, setup my account and had access to it from pc, website, ios and android. Now there is a compromise for this, it runs through their servers, so as long as you dont mind that, def a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Setup process needs improvement but overall great camera.
Reviews.Author: Techy Owl "Blaine Miller"
Reviews.Content: This would be an amazing security camera for the low end market if the setup wasn't so impossible for mac and windows 8 users. First they haven't finished getting their mac setup utility programed so it is still on beta and windows 8 didn't work with the installer until i got the one from the mydlink com website instead of using the disc. it literally took 4 hours for someone who is quite experienced in networking and computer software and compatibility and diagnostics. Also the anti flickering setting does not help with the flickering noise of the overall great picture quality granted it is only 480p but it looks quite nice. mydlink is too simple for setup so I went into the cameras settings after assigning it a static ip address on my router. The web portal works if you put java on your mac but for regular monitoring i use a 10 dollar app from the mac app store that works great. Motion alerts are very fast almost instant. The iPhone app is dead simple. Overall it is a great camera for through the window shooting.

Reviews.Title: Didn't get a chance to check it out.
Reviews.Author: SLV
Reviews.Content: I sent it back because the instructions read (This Camera will not work with a WEP secured network).  The software didn't install properly twice.

Reviews.Title: Good camera at a good price.
Reviews.Author: Maria T TorresOrtiz
Reviews.Content: The D-link wireless camera works great.  It is easy to install and use.  The cord to the camera is short so it may require an extension cord to be used.

Reviews.Title: Good nanny cam for the price
Reviews.Author: Ruben Dario Hiciano "Music Maven"
Reviews.Content: Good baby monitor CAM. Will send email alerts and take snapshots if configured correctly. The mobile app needs some improvement. I got it for 24.99 and would not pay more than 30.

Reviews.Title: Blurred Picture
Reviews.Author: Red Beard "Go Green"
Reviews.Content: Slight blur of the video.  Could be lens or optics software not sure.  It meets the needs I have for it's use.

Reviews.Title: Works out of the box easily
Reviews.Author: Drossmill06
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up and looks great.  This model has no night vision which I knew when buying. during the day the images are crisp and of high quality.

Reviews.Title: my security camera
Reviews.Author: Jon E.
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about this security camera. I use it inside my house, at the front door, aimed on my outside porch.Physically, the product is fine. It seems slightly flimsy at the base though - but acceptable.I set it up by using the wps button on my router to wirelessly connect, and that worked very easily.I especially like the option where I set it up so that anytime it detects motion on my porch, it sends me several pictures of what it detected - sent to my email account.One thing I don't like is that in order to change most settings, you need to do this at a computer - even though there's a phone app. The phone app doesn't let you really customize settings - it just lets you see the camera feed. The problem with the computer is that in certain browsers, I can't seem to access the features. I can't seem to use Chrome or IE; but Firefox seems to work. Logging into your MyDlink web account gives you access to the settings - kind of looks like the settings menu on a typical internet router.One issue is that in order to use the phone app to view the camera feed when you are OUTSIDE of your wifi network, it is required for you to use dynamic dns settings (DDNS). It's not that difficult. There's an option in the settings from the MyDlink web account (you'd have to be inside your wifi network to do this) where you can add in information for DDNS. But first, you'd go to a DDNS provider (I use DynDNS - dyn.com) to obtain a dynamic DNS of your choice (mine is $20 per year). This DNS allows you to have a customized IP address which you would input into the MyDlink web account settings to tell the security camera what your router's IP address is (because IP addresses change from time to time - but your DDNS customized IP address won't change, and will always map onto your router's IP address even when the router's IP Address changes).

Reviews.Title: Great Cloud Camera for the price,
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pro: Price is reasonable at around $35 and camera optical quality is adequate ,Con: Setup was a guided wizard that I had to run 5 times to get it right. I am not a computer newbie and this was complicated.  Doable but not easy.  The camera is not compatible with my home security system. (I had dreams of being able to integrate it so that the picture would display on the primary security screen, but alas I can only view it remotely.)Conclusion: Dropped a star for the complicated setup that is required to use the dlink website to view the camera feed.  I would give it the star backi if Dlink allowed you to register the camera manually in case the setup disk is lost or the install wont take on your operating system.

Reviews.Title: Great cam!
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: Easy set up for someone with moderate ability to understand tech jargon. Performing well 50 yards from my house in chicken coop. Easy to check from all devices, PC Mac phones!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy Mineau
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera strictly because it was on sale, image quality is low and wifi strength is low. only use it close to wifi router or direct connect.

Reviews.Title: very good.
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: very good.  very good.  very good.  very good.  good dollars value.  I got 8 units of it.  D-link, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: Simple
Reviews.Author: John Doe "John Doe"
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with this little camera.  It does what I want it to do.  The motion detection sends me an email when something triggers it at the front door.  My purpose was to avoid the Jehovah Witnesses. I can now look on my phone, ipad or computer to see who is at the door without getting caught peaking out the window.  I get an email when UPS/FEDEX drop a pkg at the door so I know to get it when I get home, also if someone decided to steal it they'd be caught. Home invaders would automatically have their picture taken and emailed to my wife and myself so if we were to loose that battle, they would get caught.  Thinking about getting a second one. I'm attaching a screenshot of the android app.**It was a pain to setup on a mac but with an old PC I had I was able to set it up and get my DLINK account setup properly.

Reviews.Title: clunker
Reviews.Author: C. Cherry "ed"
Reviews.Content: I bought five.  Four work great.  Number five is still not connecting to my network.  I will be calling for help.

Reviews.Title: Reccomend
Reviews.Author: John Y "JohnY"
Reviews.Content: Works very well.  Easy to setup.  Easy to use.  Each feature is as described.  App is easy to use and convenient on every device.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Jaqueline
Reviews.Content: I was surprised of the picture quality, very impressive. The installation was easy. You can get up to 7 days recording, once you download the video main software "Netgear genie firmware" "genie2_tray.exe file", make sure you update Java too.

Reviews.Title: Good image for an inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to watch my dogs in the house while at work.Perfect for this use.  For such a reasonably priced camera, it's a perfectly fine picture and motion is pretty decent too (obviously if they run through the room I don't catch it)!I didn't bother w a night vision camera because it wouldn't be useful for me.Sound is somewhat static-y... I just put it on mute...I really don't care about the sound.Love accessing the feed via my iPhone.Set up was pretty easy.  The install CD didn't work for me.  It said I wasn't using IE as my default browser...which I am (and above the minimum version they stated).  May be an issue that I'm using Windows 8 and the documentation says it supports up to Windows 7?But I WAS able to download and run the install from the [...] website w no problem.Now I want to get additional cameras so I can check out the other rooms in the house! :)

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and works well
Reviews.Author: Dsinned
Reviews.Content: FOV (field of view) could be better, but otherwise great camera at an affordable price.  I bought 3 for the price of one full feature surveillance IP camera.

Reviews.Title: It would work after tinkering with it
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: You must have a minimum knowledge of networking, especially wireless, to get this thing to work but once you do, you would breeze through the next cameras.  I bought two.  Initially I had to call support (in India) and they walked me through and got the cams to work.  I later forgot the password of one of the cams so I couldn't view it on line; I wasn't able to reset to manufacturer settings.  I gave up but months later downloaded the newer software version, tried again and successfully got it working.  Now I can remotely monitor my house and these cams have audio so you could hear what's going on also.

Reviews.Title: Works 99% of the time
Reviews.Author: 2K1Toaster
Reviews.Content: Works most of the time. It has really crappy nighttime vision, i.e. non-existent. But every now and then the camera just shows a green screen for a couple frames, like the image packet just drops and never recovers. This is fine, except these green frames throw off the motion detection causing false triggers. But for the price, I am very happy. I am using it in both wired and wireless modes, I have 4 of them. They all exhibit the same green problem, but then also work almost all of the time. I would buy more if this is what was in the price range.

Reviews.Title: Will not power up
Reviews.Author: JERRY D. BURNETTE
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for 3 months and it will not work. I have tried to call D-Link and been on hold for over 3 hours. The one person I got could not understand English and put me back on hold. The camera did a fair job, but if customer service is this bad why would you want one. I have 3 of these cameras but will be replacing everything that has D-Link on it if this is the way they respond to problems.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: MRJ "MrJ"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It is a little delicate though. The stand broke off an hour. But that doesn't really matter. It does what it says it would do.

Reviews.Title: Image is good for price, was very easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Eli Lilly
Reviews.Content: This was probably the easiest device I've ever installed on my network.  For once, the instructions (3 or 4 simple steps) actually worked.  Once the camera was online, I was able to easily view the output from my Android tablet (Nexus 7), my Windows Phone, or from a regular web browser.  The only setting I changed was logging into mydlink.com to up the image size to 640x480.  The image is much clearer than I expected for a camera at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient
Reviews.Author: Ray Cochran "addict"
Reviews.Content: Works very well with Android app (iPhone, too, probably?). Does NOT work very well with web interface on Mac. D-Link does almost all of the video in Java which is extremely unpleasant if you're using Chrome or Firefox on your Mac (or Safari, even, if you've got any sort of security enabled). I just ended up grabbing my wife's Windows laptop to setup the camera.If you're thinking that you will want to use this where it's just sorta dark, don't. Get the better one (with the IR illuminator). This model sees nothing once it starts to get dark. Also, and I haven't verified this, but I believe this only used the 2.4GHz N-band and loses quite a bit of range because of that.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Samster
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera after reading the reviews which indicated it was easy to setup and had the features I wanted - wireless connectivity, color, decent resolution and a good price. Camera setup was easy. I mounted it outside and am able to see the scene clearly, take a snapshot and move in and out. I would recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Wendi
Reviews.Content: What a bargain!  I live being able to check in on my household and my dog while I am away. You can see AND hear everything that is going on.

Reviews.Title: Java issues - Download JRE (again, and again, and again)
Reviews.Author: J Mhr
Reviews.Content: I have two of the 930's.  D-Link requires Java Runtime Environment, which means it is vulnerable to the performance of the notorious crapware known as Java.  Java sucks.  ALTHOUGH, I have other apps that rely on Java and still manage to function consistently, but I can't DEPEND on this camera because of the software it uses repeatedly failing to just "work."Beyond that, the required version of Java doesn't work with Chrome (blame Chrome, or blame D-Link for not engineering it to be more robust). It doesn't seem to work with Safari either, so I'm using Firefox, and once again, Firefox tells me something is wrong with java.  See below:The Java Runtime Environment cannot be found.You will need to download and install the Java Runtime Environment in order to view your View1.If you ever installed the Java Runtime Environment, you may need to check the Java status in Java Preference setting.For Firefox users, please install the latest version of Java Runtime Environment to continue.I followed the instructions.  And as usual (with Java), it STILL doesn't work and there is nowhere else to go but Google and those troubleshooting forums that soak up hours if you let them.You can't rely on something like this. D-Link's camera is okay when it works but that's of little use at the moment.  To further complicate things, Java is so finicky, quirky, flakey - well, it's just crap.  So installing whatever upgrade it demands is usually a multi-attempt process. Then there's the issue of Java vulnerability to all kinds of bad things, which will probably never be resolved.D-Link is blowing these cameras out now, but they are no bargain at any price if they don't work.

Reviews.Title: short life span
Reviews.Author: Neal
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for only 12 months and it failed. I also had trouble using my Mac to setup and update. It seems that Java does not work to well with Safari. I also did not get good support from dlink. The camera has very low resolution as such the picture was not to useful on my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Paid For
Reviews.Author: FloBoss
Reviews.Content: I really didn't like this camera.Cons- You have to have your own smtp setting to configure the email alert feature. If you don't know what this is then this is not for you.- The motion detection is awful. I pointed it directly at a wall and I got hit with over 50 emails in less than 30 mins even with the sensitivity level set at 10 percent and minimizing the detection area.- The GUI to configure the camera settings appears to be a bit old and looked outdated even after I updated the camera software. You have to enable Jave or Active X on your browser to view the live video if testing from the GUI.-Power cord is very short.- Unless there was some type of backlight the night Vision really sucked.- The phone apps allows you to view the camera and take a snapshot but that is pretty much all you can do. Unable to configure any setting or update anything from it or record video.Audio was not that great as other have stated.- You can't record actual video unless you us a 3rd party app.Pro- You can setup access to an FTP and the images will get saved to the FTP server.- Camera has Audio.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, could have better software
Reviews.Author: Scott Webb
Reviews.Content: Works well, with hookup via wifi being a more advanced process than I expected. one other issue id with the software timing out. I want to have a continuous connection to use at night as a baby monitor.  video quality is very passable,. but only if you have a wifi connection, otherwise the frames per second is way too low

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Abimael
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I received delivery of the cameras. They were in excellent shape and they were easy to install and run from the mydlink website.

Reviews.Title: Good, Great & Cheap
Reviews.Author: NOE PELAYO
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to watch my house when I'm at work and so far so good.  Not expensive. Works great for me.

Reviews.Title: good through internet connection but not through direct link of network
Reviews.Author: ssggbroot
Reviews.Content: could not view directly from my computer, had to go through d-link and I wanted to view from my computer directly

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Monica Upshaw
Reviews.Content: I have several of these cameras they are easy to install and use.  It has a mobile app that allows me to check the cameras, from anywhere. Great reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: CodeJ
Reviews.Content: It is a good buy.  The motion is a bit choppy but it does what I need.  I bought it to watch over my porch for package deliveries.

Reviews.Title: Very Very easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: Renzo Berardi
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a camera you can watch from the internet, this camera is perfect. I wouldnt use it for anything else though. Very Very easy to set up. To set up, plus it in. Insert disk. And the wizard does the rest in just a few steps. Once its set up, if wireless, all you need to do is supply it power anywhere in the house and it works!

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: Kamal
Reviews.Content: slow and does not cover my entire room. Missing a lot of features like audio is not clear in my iPhone

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: It does give me the ability to check on areas of my home, easily when away, the picture is not very clear, but at the same time, the camera was inexpensive, so I guess there is not any reason to complain. It does what it is supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: Dlink Wireless
Reviews.Author: John H. Frazier
Reviews.Content: AR004628  was extremely helpful and very patient.  UP and running now and really like this camera.Would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: JuanCS
Reviews.Content: The product is OK. Setting up is really easy as well. I'm able to view the cameras using my android smartphone by using Dlink lite app. The only thing is that I'm not sure if the camera is capable to record, or at least I don't know how to do that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, But  Odd Setup Issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for it's price.  I use a password manager with my web browser can this caused a ton of problems with setting up the camera through it's web interface. So, if you are using a password manager, I recommend that you turn it off while setting up this camera.  The other thing to be aware of is that you absolutely have to use the setup CD software in order for the camera to be recognized on mydlink.com.  For the novice user, this will probably not be an issue.  But, for those of us who prefer to set up things manually, this is an unavoidable issue.Also,  the camera does have a motion sensor feature.  However, there does not appear to be a way through the web interface to turn this feature on/off depending on the time of day.  Relaying on the accompanying software may be the way to solve this particular issue.Having said all this, I'm probably going to order another camera or two like this.

Reviews.Title: 10min setup - Works so far
Reviews.Author: tty
Reviews.Content: Wanted something simple to monitor (and motion detect) my front door area.  Setup, I thought, was pretty straightforward (for wireless-N).  You will need Java installed on your PC so that you can configure the motion detection settings.  I have it set to use gmail smtp server (smtp.gmail.com, port 587, with STARTTLS).It's worked pretty well so far (last 2 weeks).  I mount it from inside and thru a window.  It is only for indoor use.The free app (running on my Galaxy S3) works fairly well.Note: I read elsewhere about issues when updating firmware.  I haven't and probably won't as it seems to be work 'as-is'.  Current firmware I have is 1.06 (2012-08-15).

Reviews.Title: so easy I could do it!
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I hardly ever write reviews but this product is just crying out for one.  Have been meaning to do something for awhile to keep an eye on things at the house when I am traveling, at work etc.  Wanted to make sure the pet sitter is coming by on time, the cleaning woman is showing up when she is suppose to and the kids aren't having too many friends over before I get home.  I planned about 90 minutes to set this up/get it going on my windows laptop/wireless network assuming there would be some glitches along the way.  20 minutes later I was looking at me looking at the camera on the iphone app I had just downloaded.I am a user with only the barest of IT skills.  Setting this up was insanely easy and the picture is excellent.  I was looking for something to get a basic sense of who is in the house and when.  This is way beyond my wildest expectations.Based on price, ease of use and quality of the picture I don't think this really can be beat as an all around "what's going on at my house" camera.

Reviews.Title: up date on D-Link DCS-933l Camera (no tec support)
Reviews.Author: DG
Reviews.Content: (up dated Review) camera has a good pic. in day light and night mode. not a lot of distance in night mode, took several times to get it set up,power cord is way to short if you plan to mount it over 3ft off  the floor. software is not very reliable, both phone and pc.tec support is nonexistent! called for help on soft ware, got thailand or some place. after being on hold with tec for 15 min. tec came back and told me to e-mail them my question.camera is ok. ((Up date)) Have called tec support twice now on Motion detection, it seem that D-Link is field trialing there cameras and letting Joe Public find all the problems . if you buy this camera for motion detection or sound detection (DONOT) it don't work, I have spent several hours on the phone with tec. support and have yet to fix the problem with motion detection. it flat does not work!!!! I have set sensitivity to 40% and only two Square's checked for detection, it will still send 80 to 178 Picture of nothing to your e-mail.if you want to Monitoring live video, it will do that. I give this Camera 1 Star instead of the 3 I gave it early on. have had the Camera 2 Mo and it is just not as advertise. it is a e-mail monster.

Reviews.Title: Easy Set Up - Good Image
Reviews.Author: Kent L. Weitkamp "kweitkamp"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased three of these and use them around the house both for internal viewing and external viewing out of windows.  The cameras provide a good image and the software is extremely easy to set up and use remotely.  I can check on the house from anywhere via the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for its budget
Reviews.Author: James & Masami Otto
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a wireless IP camera. Have used a Trendnet version before but this is very nice improvement for the cost.It works flawlessly in my garage, and I have it send an email to my Gmail account; and I get a nice ringtone every time somebody passes through the garage.

Reviews.Title: A bit disappointed
Reviews.Author: Deebo
Reviews.Content: The setup process was easy for WPA2 but i have issues using WPS.up to this day. Based on how much i paid for this device the video quality was good. The connection dropped occasionally which can be annoying. However you get what you pay for. It's an ok purchase for the price.

Reviews.Title: Ip camera
Reviews.Author: Moises Paniagua
Reviews.Content: Excelent product....it would be better a the camera with  night vision.I will recomend this item to my friends and partners

Reviews.Title: Good for the money if you don't pay too much
Reviews.Author: Mike Itashiki "M"
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 of these and they work well. Power supply went out on one. Craftsmanship is kind of flimsy, but good enough for indoors. Software somewhat tricky. Initializing the cameras was difficult and had to plug in ethernet directly. When it all works it's good - motion detection emails and uploads pics to my web server offsite. I can view cameras from my smartphone, when I have WIFI.

Reviews.Title: Good, easy to use security camera.
Reviews.Author: phoneguy
Reviews.Content: This was a very low cost camera that works very well.  I set it up in the front window aimed at the front porch and door.  Now I can see everything that approaches the house and even delivery trucks when they pull up in front of the house, all while we are in our basement office.  The web connection and wifi work brilliantly.  Plugs into an Apple usb wall plug, so no batteries to bother with.Good product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and reliable
Reviews.Author: Nona J. Podschlne "Noniejean"
Reviews.Content: We use this camera to see our lake house. Only problem is, we did not read far enough and did not realize the night vision does not work at longer distances. We wanted to see our boat from the kitchen and we cannot. I also think there has to be a light source somewhere because we see nothing in the dark. Isnt that what a night vision camera does? Or is it just too far. Otherwise we like the other three we have.

Reviews.Title: Cant beat them for the price
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I installed these D-Link cameras in our home. Had issues getting them setup at first, be sure to update their firmware. After I had updated them, they worked like a charm and have been running for over a month without any hickups. I use my I-Phone to monitor them and my wife uses her android and both have no problems.If I would change anything, a wider field of view would be nice, also maybe a heavier base. For the price I cant complain.I am very happy and would purchase these again!

Reviews.Title: great little product
Reviews.Author: Housatonic
Reviews.Content: Owns 5 of them, they work very well on wireless, no issues at all, easy to set up and bring online for live feeds. Not great in low light environment but there are other models for that, at a different price obviously, Do recommend.Can watch video feeds on Iphone, iPads, laptop/desktop Mac and PC. Good enough, don't expect HD quality though, not that it is required for such products.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PICTURE QUALITY,GREAT PRICE,LENGHTY SET-UP
Reviews.Author: MUSICMAN
Reviews.Content: I HAVE USED D-LINK PRODUCTS FOR MANY YEARS AND FOR THE MOST PART HAVE BEEN HAPPY WITH THEM.THIS CAMERA WAS ON SALE FOR AROUND 40 BUCKS AND I HAD A GIFT CODE SO I THOUGHT I'D GIVE IT A TRY.HERE ARE MY SUMMATIONS OF THE PRODUCT:PROS- GOOD IMAGE QUALITY, GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY, LOTS OF SET-UP OPTIONS AND EXPANDABILITY.CONS- THE FULL SET-UP CAN TAKE SOME TIME, THE POWER CORD COULD HAVE BEEN MUCH LONGER, WEBSITE SUPPORT AND DOCUMENTATION SHOULD BE MORE EXTENSIVE (ESPECIALLY FOR A NOVICE).I GAVE IT 4 STARS AFTER USING IT TO KEEP ON EYE ON MY HOME WHILE ON A WEEKEND TRIP VIA THE WEB INTERFACE AND PHOTO EVENT EMAILING. OVERALL IT WAS A GOOD PURCHASE FOR AN ENTRY LEVEL IP CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Great Value....WIFI or 3G/4G...
Reviews.Author: Clifford D. Main
Reviews.Content: If you have a D-link router with WPS button, this unit configures so easy wireless. The D-Link equipment has impressed me. There is a smart phone application for D-link devices. Alot of creativity in the D-Link software. I can view this camera with the PC shut down, just goes through the D-Link router, it is so cool. I have another security camera with Seedonk, which views my backyard area and it alerts me via iphone with motion detection, at a cost of $6 a month. The D-link camera connection on iphone will time out after awhile, but thats ok. So if my monitored camera sends me an alert, I can view that camera and also bring up the D-link to camera inside of the house. D-link has impressed me so far, with their DIR-605L router and this camera.

Reviews.Title: USE IT FOR THE GRANDBABY
Reviews.Author: kttyctlady
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS.  I HAVE ONE IN THE BABY ROOM AND ONE IN THE DEN OUTSIDE THE BABY ROOM.  IF THE BABY IS IN THE SWING AND ASLEEP (UPSTAIRS IN THE DEN) I CAN LEAVE THE ROOM AND SEE HER THE ENTIRE TIME ON MY IPAD OR IPHONE.  IT'S A WONDERFUL PRODUCT.  WORKS GREAT

Reviews.Title: D-Link does not work well with Linksys Routers.
Reviews.Author: K. Houghton "Wisconsin"
Reviews.Content: I tried for three and a half hours to get this camera to connect with my wireless network. No luck. It worked beautiful wired, though, great picture. Called customer support they were fantastic but even though she tried for an hour to get me going she could get by the firewall. She knew nothing of port forwarding.The camera was a little cheap feeling and would easily break if it dropped.Sent them back.Sorry I wouldn't recommend  this camera. I will keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Does what I want - But I Wish There Was More Functionality...
Reviews.Author: Cameron J. Martin
Reviews.Content: It does everything I want it to do...almost. I got this to monitor my house when I'm not there. I wanted to tell it to record, or do motion detection on a set schedule. Unfortunately, my schedule is different every single day and you don't get customization to that level. You get a VERY BASIC ability to set up a schedule (pick the day mon - sun and then pick an hour range). What I need is to pick like 2 or 3 different ranges each day...You can't set it up for that.But it uploads to an FTP server that I have (unlimited space...nice!) both pictures and video using motion detection...some of the features are really cool.

Reviews.Title: Decent low-light surveillance cam for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Fabbri "afabbri"
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent low-light wireless camera for the price.  I used a Mac to set it up, and use ZoneMinder on linux to monitor the camera.  I don't use the included cloud service, but it is a nice way for people to access their cam from the Internet, without having to be a networking expert.Likes:- Low light performance.  This thing showed great detail in my dark basement.- Size.  Compact, easy to mount.- Mounting hardware included.- Manual setup possibility.  I was able to plug this thing in, look on my router's GUI for a list of attached devices, then go to the IP address it was assigned in my web browser and configure from there.Dislikes:- Narrow field of view.  Wish it was wider to show more area.  As is it is only useful for monitoring a narrow area.  This seems to be pretty normal in this price range.- Audio noise.  I noticed some popping noises on audio.Overall recommended for the price.I will update this review with any new issues I encounter while testing.

Reviews.Title: VERY PLEASED
Reviews.Author: Margaux Paschke
Reviews.Content: This is a great security or nanny-cam option for the price listed.  It was super easy to set up on our Windows 8 PC.  It even has the added benefit of boosting our wi-fi in the area we placed it.I ordered this more for a monitoring purpose than security.  It is strictly for indoor use and I don't require security for inside my house.  I would like to be able to keep an eye on my active young boys while they play in the basement and this wi-fi camera works like a charm. After installing an app on my cell phone (you will need to set up a D-Link account, all the info is supplied), I can now watch over them without actual hovering.  The video is clear and easy to access from multiple devices.  The infra-red ability of the camera for night vision is not used so I cannot comment on its performance.The wi-fi is spotty in our basement but this D-Link surveillance camera has no connectivity issues and helped strengthen the wi-fi connection for a nearby tv, an unexpected and much welcomed bonus.  No more cries from the kids about losing the Netflix connection!I am thrilled by the performance and function of this security camera.  I'm so pleased that I will be looking whether D-Link provides outdoor surveillance cameras.  I think this product is worth the price listed at just under $100.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!
Reviews.Author: Teetee
Reviews.Content: If you are in the market for a monitor, do yourself a favor and get this D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and a Built-In Wi-Fi Extender and do it NOW!  We are using it as a baby monitor.At the price point of ~$95 this unit is hard to beat. The infrared works out nicely the sound quality is superb and the app.  Wow, I've struggled recently with these kinds of apps for monitor but this was EASY to install and easy to connect and easy to use.  It a triple whammy of love that D-Link's used to get loyal customers and I'm a convert.You have to sign up for a dlink account off of their website but it's relatively pain-free. The app sends you email notification when motion or audio is detected in the location - which is truly handy.The app does time you out after a while (about maybe 5 mins) to free up bandwidth for all of their users but you can log back in quickly and easily enough (sometime you have to wait a little).
