Also, the sound detection will take picture and email you when you are not logged.  So no worries if you are timed out. You can still get pictures sent to you.One flaw: no Pan/tilt remote control.  Sometime baby will be out of  range and I can't move the Camera via the app remotely :(All in all, a really, really good option for a monitor. It's cheap and handles well.  Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: A good network camera that has audio.  It has been very easy to use, set up, and customize.  The audio is decent, picture is better.

Reviews.Title: Convenient and Cost-Effective Surveillance
Reviews.Author: J. Perkins
Reviews.Content: The D-Link Cloud Camera is a great tool for keeping an eye on your home while at the office or vice versa. The installation was easy, taking me only about 10 minutes to connect the camera to my router with the provided Ethernet cable and to run the setup program on my computer.  Once installed, the camera can be disconnected from the router and taken to any indoor location within reach of an electrical outlet and the router's WiFi signal. The camera housing is lightweight plastic and is easily tipped over, as I discovered when I initially placed the camera on the same table where we keep our TV remotes and Xbox controllers. I recommend either mounting the camera on the wall or placing it in a low traffic area. The camera is small -- about the size of a cell phone with the stand adding a couple of inches in height -- so it could be concealed fairly easily for use as a nannycam. To view the video feed from the camera on your computer, simply set up a mydlink account and login. From the website, you can turn the audio feed from the camera on or off, switch between daytime and nighttime modes, adjust the brightness, take a snapshot, and zoom in or out. You can also set the camera up to detect sound or motion and send email alerts.  You can even have snapshots sent to your email address at designated intervals. The video quality is good.  Unfortunately, you cannot remotely swivel the camera to pan around the room, so the view is dictated by where you place the camera. The camera itself does have a nice swivel mechanism at the top of the stand that allows you to adjust the camera angle easily. Overall, a nice user friendly camera that can give you some peace of mind while away from home.

Reviews.Title: what was described
Reviews.Author: dewayne
Reviews.Content: Item showed up on time and was what I expected. It stinks that there isnt an app for the windows 8 phones. Hoping dlink adds that app to the windows store.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant Security Tech
Reviews.Author: JSB Morse "JSB Morse, Author"
Reviews.Content: I find it amazing that what used to cost companies or people thousands of dollars just a decade ago can be yours for just $100 today. That's the case for this fascinating remote view and controlled security cam with sound and night-vision. Now you can view your vast empire (or at least one room of it) from anywhere in the world through the mydlink app. Just brilliant!And... added bodus , the NSA can watch what you're watching at no additional charge! j/k It's hard to tell if this can be hacked and your viewspace broadcast to all the pervs at Fort Meade but in the meantime, this offers a great personal surveillance system.The drawbacks have already been documented: short power cord, no mounting device, and low picture quality, but the benefits greatly outweigh the drawbacks.Hook this puppy up and monitor your front porch to watch for creepers, watch your baby after you put her down to sleep, or just set it up wherever you want to stay connected.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Functional
Reviews.Author: YSC
Reviews.Content: Pros:-MyCloud service along with its mobile apps takes all the hard work out of connecting to your camera away from home. You can always configure it to your liking if you mind the security issues of having the data routed through D-Link's servers, but it's truly plug-and-play.- Slim, light weight form factor makes for easy mounting and positioning. The build quality is excellent.- Night vision with infrared LED (similar to Sony's nightshot in that it mechanically removes a filter) really does work well, though you would also be seeing only in monochrome.- Sound pick-up is pretty good. Makes for usable sound detection.- H.264 compression makes for smaller video files and lower data transmission rates.- Added function as a wifi-extender, which is essentially a repeater, useful in expanding your wireless network to cover dead spots at a sacrifice of speed.. If you manage to get hardwire ethernet at the site of the camera, you've effectively turned it into a full speed WIFI access point, which is even better.- Wireless N means ease of positioning. Reception has been decent.Cons:- Gets pretty hot, though it has not presented issues with crashes.- The image quality really leaves a bit to be desired. Granted it's not meant to be HD, nor does it have optical focus, but this is just a mid-low end webcam quality--from 5 years ago--with all that fuzziness, low color saturation, and sub-par low-light performance (without nightvision turned on). It's serviceable, but a low end PC webcam from a reputable brand should do at least as well and more likely better.- MyDlink app feels unfinished and can use not only more options but also more polish.This is akin to a mini computer with webcam and network capability. Therefore the software and firmware really makes a tremendous difference in its functionality. Thankfully D-Link has provided with My-Dlink feature that makes for easy set-up--I was able to set up remote viewing with minutes. The software has the most basic features: activate motion or sound detection, activate night vision, and turning the sound on or off. The interface looks unfinished, however, and there are multiple versions of my-dlink app on the Google Play Store, with some that's already obsolete (why is it still there to confuse people?). I hope D-Link eventually polishes up the interface software and maybe add more features and controls. However as it stands, it does deliver on its promises--you can easily view from the web (via smartphone, tablet or PC) without any issues or the toil of setting up port forwarding. Some image quality and software quibbles aside, the decent build quality, good wireless connectivity and repeater feature, as well as a solid night-vision IR mode--this is a truly functional camera without many useless frills. It can be better, but it's already pretty good.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: AR004624  Very Good Product & Very Helpful Service!!A Beautiful picture and everything turned out fine.And Ronnel was very Patient with Me.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly simple to use
Reviews.Author: Atomicwasteland
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to think when I first picked up this camera.  In fact it sat in a box for a few weeks silently intimidating me with its networking cable and my worry that it wouldn't want to connect to my router.Well, long story short, though the camera wasn't as easy to install as the box made it seem, it was all right in the end.  (Basically, unless you have the exact router that the package mentions, your camera will not automatically synch up when you plug it in.  That's ok, as I never believed a camera would synch up so easily anyway.)In the end, I had to install the camera using the "alternate" method.  I connected it to my router (with the included cable), went over to my computer, created a new account on the D-Link website, looked for my camera, and linked it.  Then, I downloaded an app on my phone (for free) which allowed me to also link up to my camera (and then typed in the credentials that I had recently generated on the website).Finally, I logged in to my iPhone App, saw all available D-Link cameras (which, in my case was just the one), clicked on the link, and was able to view streaming video in about 5 seconds.  It was pretty amazing.The quality of the broadcast signal, however, varies depending on your phone connection.  When I was in the house (using Wifi) I got a perfect connection.  When I was at work but viewing the camera remotely, using a 3G signal, I got a good connection, with screenshot updates every 3 seconds.  When I had a half signal (3 bars) I got a decent connection, which basically showed screenshots that updated every 5-10 seconds or so.  Finally, with only 2 out of 5 bars on my phone I was not able to connect.I was really pleased with how simple it was to use my camera for remote viewing.  I did not think it would be so easy, and I can see how this can be really useful for those who want to just plug it in and view away without installing any special cabling.  (It has a 3 foot power cable, so you really can just place it anywhere in the house with an outlet.  And, as long as you also have wifi, you are good to go.)Note: this camera does not offer a DVR service, so it is not a security camera, per se, it is just for live viewing.Another thing I loved about this camera was the "night view" option.  When the room didn't have enough light you just clicked a button (on the camera app) on your phone and suddenly your picture switches to a black and white night mode, which increases viewability tremendously.The only thing that I couldn't get to work was the volume -supposedly I can hear through the camera, but it did not work remotely.  Perhaps the signal needs to be wifi for that to work?All in all, I was pleased with the camera.  Relatively simple to install (though you need a computer with internet access to do so), or a large phone screen so you can do the website registration on your phone...The free phone app and the night mode make this a very cool product.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: DCS 930L camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Wegner
Reviews.Content: There was difficulty getting the camera to go to Wi-Fi using the CD Wizard. Instructions were not clear as when to use the Ethernet cable. Finally, downloaded the Wizard on line, which is more comprehensive, and it worked. I want to use it to view a thermostat when I am away for the Winter. However am having difficulty being able to read it. Maybe the camera resolution is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: Strong signal, some buffering
Reviews.Author: C. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I used this camera to extend my current wi-fi for a stronger signal in a remote part of the house and it does show a stronger signal, but experienced a bit of buffering when viewing movies over an ipad.  The night vision works well if it is not thru a window, viewing outside activities from inside.  It seems the infrared LEDs will cause interference with the picture at night, maybe reflecting off the window its looking thru.  Without the infrared LEDs the camera will not show a good video at night.  During the daylight hours it works well behind a window.  The configuration of the camera was fairly easy.  Most default settings work fine and the web based interface has helpful features and instructions for most any configuration needed.  The email and alerts are nice and work great.  Once this camera is configured for wireless access you can move it anywhere within range of your router and get good results.

Reviews.Title: Flexible Mobile Monitoring Solution with Superb Image Clarity and Decent Audio Too
Reviews.Author: J. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: The D-Link DSC-933L is a fantastic surveillance camera for checking on things while away from home. The mobile mydlink app makes it easy to check in with little effort after initial setup. I am not limited to using the mydlink app; if I have a static IP address, I can do my own custom setup without using D-Link's remote service.I use the D-Link DIR-850L wireless router to connect with the camera, which made setup a simple, automated process by simply connecting the camera's included Ethernet cable directly into the router and the system took care of everything for me. Once finished, the Ethernet cable is disconnected and it is ready to go.The camera's options are abundant. I can set the day/night mode to automatically detect daylight, or I can put it on a timed schedule. I can change the bandwidth allotment for the camera to my own preferences to manage the network traffic it uses. The image can be sized, I can set the frame rate, I can turn the audio on or off and I have the ability to use the camera's built in wireless transmitter to extend the network coverage throughout the home.I believe I would need to keep my computer turned on to take advantage of letting the software access my e-mail client to send captured images triggered by the fully customizable motion and sound detection, but I do not use the feature at this time. It offers the ability to select image regions to use for motion detection, so I can choose the grid area that is on the top of the door without worrying about excessive alerts caused by it having been triggered by pets walking past other sections of the monitored image. It is quite an effective and flexible system.I think this is a great camera, considering all of the basic PC webcams I have bought over the years for nearly the same price, and all those did was open up an interface for an image, and nothing else. The DSC-933L is an affordable monitoring solution, with both audio and wireless network extension, and it is quite user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Why Would I Buy a Dedicated Video Monitor?
Reviews.Author: E. Volenec "Certified Reading Specialist"
Reviews.Content: When I can have this?The camera is not plug and play like my Motorola video monitor, but it is so easy to set up that it might as well be, and if you happen to have a DLink router, it is plug and play. For others, basically you plug it into your router, load some software on your computer, and your smartphone, and voila, you have a baby monitor!So, why would I want this over a dedicated baby monitor? Well, the picture is stellar compared to my monitor. I didn't realize my baby monitor was so awful until I used this wifi camera. The picture on the monitor is grainy and it is impossible to decipher a product from across the room. With this camera, it is simple which gives me more options for placement.The monitor has nearly as many features as my baby monitor and more! I can view my child in night vision and day vision, and I can hear him as well. What it does not have is the ability to talk to him from my end, and it also does not have pan. However, if pan is important, DLink sells other cameras with pan. This camera does have features my dedicated baby monitor does not. It allows me to take pictures, and it also allows me to zoom in on something.I think this camera is perfect for my purpose, and I can see it being useful for other purposes as well, so I feel totally comfortable recommending it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good, not perfect, not as easy to setup as expected
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2LOO6W8F20PKM', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2LOO6W8F20PKMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2LOO6W8F20PKMcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2LOO6W8F20PKMcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:17 MinsSorry about the no audio. I couldn't figure out how to get it to record audio. It plays audio on the computer and tablets. I even got it to play audio on the realtime view when the camera was recording. But when I went back to play or save recorded video there was no audio. If I figure it out, I'll do another with audio. +update+ So I called again was again for help on recording the audio. I was told I was in the wrong area when I picked the correct options in the phone tree. Then I talked to someone who was completely unhelpful and when she didn't think she could find an answer, she hung up on me. But this camera doesn't advertise audio recording, so I don't feel that I should punish it for that. I almost knocked it a star for the horrible phone support. +end update+Really this was pretty good. The video/audio quality is as expected. The app for ios iphone/ipad is pretty good. But it is not nearly as easy to setup as I expected from what the box said. For easy setup, you have to have a dlink cloud router.If you don't have a cloud router, you need a pc with java and active-x to setup the camera. Durring the installation you have to plug the device into your router with the included cable. When it's done setting up, you no longer need a network cable (but you still need a power cable). It does want you to create a mydlink account during the setup. You don't have to use mydlink, but you can't use the mydlink app without it and remote access is more difficult without ti.Pros:-good video and audio quality.-once it's setup, it just works.-the app works well on my iphone 5 and ipad 3. I get good connections over cellular and hotspots.-you can take pictures with the app.-you can set it up to email you when sound or motion is detected.-auto day/night feature works very well. It's nice to be able to see the kids sleeping in the middle of the night.-network extender sounds like a good feature, but I'm not going to use it.Cons:-no two way audio for this model. I can see and hear the kids jumping on the bed, but I have to go upstairs to tell them to stop.-the only way to record video is the extra D-ViewCam software. It's cumbersome and I can't figure out how to record sound. It's really clunky to use. It turns off UAC. It autostarts when the computer boots. It's annoying and dumb, but I didn't get the camera for recording. I want this for the easy phone/tablet viewing. I'm going to uninstall the D-ViewCam software.-the view is about the same as other cameras I've used, but I wish I had a wider view.-The power cord is short for higher mounting.-Called Dlink support at 2pm on a weekday and was on hold for 30 minutes before someone told me I was in the wrong area. There was only one camera selection on the first menu, but they said I needed to be to the Mdlink area, not just the camera area. Then I waited about another 30 minutes before giving up. I just wanted to know about recording sound, and I didn't find help on the website either.It wasn't horribly difficult to setup, but there is easier. If you really want easy to setup, the Motorola Blink1 is the most easy to setup I've seen. The Blink1 also has 2 way audio, tilt/pan, temperature, etc. But this is less than half the price. This Dlink was easier to setup than a Foscam.So I had a few issues, but it was with things I didn't care about in the long run. So I rounded up my 3.5 to a 4 star review. The main thing I care about is the app view and that works well.

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera
Reviews.Author: B. Muller
Reviews.Content: Have a few of these now. They have worked well for my proposes, never had a glitch.Good bang for the buck...

Reviews.Title: 930L model
Reviews.Author: phylh
Reviews.Content: great product - a little difficult setting it up, but customer service (May AR004630) was amazing. May spent 2 hours working thru all my issues with the set up and orientation of the product. Good to know this company hires well informed, pleasant, and patient techs.

Reviews.Title: Decent surveillance camera
Reviews.Author: Wixby Bonnet
Reviews.Content: Overall I've been pleased with this D-Link Surveillance camera. It was really easy to install. The daytime video is good, but faces are hard to identify on the picture. Audio support is decent. Capturing video and still images to FTP works well. The capture length for video is configurable with a maximum capture time of 15 seconds. I have mine set to 10 seconds which equates to about 2 MB per video file. Still pictures are about 32 KB each. One downfall is that there is no optical zoom and the digital zoom on the camera is very pixelated. It is attached to my wireless network and it has no problems transferring the capture files to my FTP server. I have also used it on a cabled network and that works well too. Email alerts are configurable, which is a great feature for a security camera. An interesting ability of the camera is the ability to act as a wireless extender. For the price, this camera is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: NOT SURE WHY this product is so badly rated.
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: This small network cam works great to serve as a home record. And remote viewer. The setup software is a little unstraightforward but if you are able to set up a router you will be fine. Right now I set it up to send a picture to my home server every two seconds as well as enable it as remote or cloud camera. just to make sure that the landlord will not break into my apartment when I am away from my apartment.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Cloud Enabled Surveillance Cam - DLINK Makes It Easy. But How Secure?
Reviews.Author: APC Reviews "APC Reviews"
Reviews.Content: The D-Link DCS-933L Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and a Built-In Wi-Fi Extender is an excellent surveillance and security camera for use in interior situations. It does not pan and tilt, and is not weather proof. How "excellent" it is may come down to how comfortable you are with "the cloud" as a natural extension of your personal space. Although sold as "secure" recent news developments and reports clearly show you are potentially taking a Big Brother into your life when you get involved with this technology.The D-Link DCS-933L has different levels of functionality that depend on how integrated you are into the DLINK Cloud system and whether or not you have a recent model DLINK router. The further you get away from the DLINK eco-system the more manual the configuration becomes, and the fewer of the advertised features are easily available. At its most base configuration, it's a day/night video camera that can be accessed via your router. To get the remote monitoring, from a smartphone or laptop, you have to be registered into the DLINK Cloud system. To get the instant "Zero Configuration", plug it in and go, easy setup you have to connect the camera to a DLINK router with MYDLINK account access. To use the Windows or Mac setup Wizards you have to download your OS specific Wizard from the DLINK site.Using the Wizard guides you through setting up a MYDLINK account. That, to me, is the weak link, so to speak, in the whole deal. What you are basically doing is setting up a 24/7 monitoring device in your personal environment that needs to go out to a remote location and then back in to your system, or to a linked remote device, to be accessed. That's a lot of trust to put in pictures with sound of your home being broadcast continuously, to outside your own space. As it is the stated ambition of the government cyber security forces to capture everything that everyone transmits, stores and communicates everywhere all the time, and retain it forever, if they can ever build a big enough server farm to store the stuff, you might contemplate whether or not you want years worth of your personal life in real time video stored somewhere that may then be mirrored and archived elsewhere, not under your control, and porous to snooping.Secure? Of course, as much as anything is. Absolutely secure? Well, these days, if someone wants to access it they are going to access it. They may be hackers. They may be someone with "authorization". Who knows? Some people may think this is a ridiculous worry and not worth thinking about. Others may consider it a serious issue.Using manual setup is more like setting up another wireless router, bridged to your main router. This "routerness" of the camera is in fact part of the camera's function as a range extender for your wireless devices. More complication and security concerns. It's also how you configure the camera to email you snapshots, alert you, email you vid clips and so forth. If only this was all being handled from within your home network, and not via a remote system. But I digress...Depending on your level of router security, the setup may be more or less difficult. If you have port isolation enabled, for example, you are putting up a wall to certain functionality of connected devices. All devices that claim to work seamlessly with your home network depend on you having a rather low, integrated level of router security.As to how it works: it works very well, with excellent image quality, but is feature limited somewhat by the level of integration into the DLINK Cloud and MYDLINK system. RECOMMENDED, with reservations about cloud connected privacy and security.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Set up and go
Reviews.Author: Talvi
Reviews.Content: We needed an easy to use surveillance due to some packages disappearing from the doorstep.  This was easy to use and install and allows us to watch on the ipad from a downloadable app.  The picture quality is decent both day and night and we've had no problems with it at all.  Does exactly as promised.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite D-Link Camera
Reviews.Author: AmandaGal
Reviews.Content: I have three versions of this camera that I use to check up on pet sitters.  I love the D-Link cameras because they are pretty easy to setup if you are minimally competent with technology and I find them to be reliable.  This is my favorite of the three.  I love the day/night setting.  That setting coupled with the small size of the camera make it more useful and less conspicuous than my other two.The camera resolution is not the best, but it is a security camera.  It is good enough to check-in and even identify people.  In pitch black rooms, you can still make people and their features out.I really like that nobody notices the camera.  It's about the size of a thick iPhone.  Some of these wireless security cameras are easily noticed.If you have an iPad, I highly recommend the My-Dlink+ app.  It is a lot nicer than the basic one.  The paid app will display multiple cameras(see the images) and does not time out.  Another feature not specific to this camera but included here is timed motion detection.If I were looking to buy an additional camera, this is the one I'd buy.  I posted an image comparing my three models.

Reviews.Title: No Muss, No Fuss
Reviews.Author: A Gamer at Heart
Reviews.Content: This surveillance cam was up and running in no time. I downloaded the necessary software from d-link's support website. I followed the steps (download the software onto PC, plug the unit into your router with the included Ethernet cable, select wireless or wired, setup a user account with d-link, register the unit with your d-link account).Then, I downloaded the d-link app for my Ipad from the app store. ($.99 for Ipad version)  I clicked on the Ipad app, entered my log-on information for the account I had just created on my desktop PC, and my video feed opened and I was up and running.  The camera is small and unobtrusive, and can be placed anywhere within your network's wi-fi range with a nearby plug. You can also keep the unit wired directly into your router if you prefer.I don't have a need to view via a PC browser, so I cannot address that issue. I can, however, remotely view from my Ipad wherever I have internet access.  The video feed is 10 FPS, so don't expect HD quality and smooth video, but the video and audio quality is very nice and the video is in color. (Night vision is black and white).

Reviews.Title: Does what I wanted it to
Reviews.Author: Todd Risser
Reviews.Content: This is nice and simple for the average person. I just needed another security cam for my own home security system I am hooking up.

Reviews.Title: i see  you
Reviews.Author: Carla Sabatino
Reviews.Content: Works like a charm...just wish it wasn't so easy to disconnect and i wish it was easier to record instead of just live feed. Overall..its a good product.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: IG "IG"
Reviews.Content: I have it in my garage facing out behind a window picking up an image of my driveway. Would get a mix of frame rates from 2fps to 18fps. It would drop the signal now and again but as it's not in the building as the wifi it's to be expected. All was going okay until they forced a firmware update on me last week and now it hardly works. I'm lucky to get an image up for a few seconds every hour.UPDATE. Yes after the fireware update I could never get this to work again.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Worked fine, and very easy to setup. But the site may down once awhile.It will be nice it can do recording, not just live monitoring.

Reviews.Title: works ok out of the box but not for the long run
Reviews.Author: V. Cortes
Reviews.Content: has a lot of connectivity issues, with that said the cam douse everything it is supposed to, but after the year mark it started to get very hot as well as drop communications and connection with rougher. this cam gets very hot and i am afraid to leave it on due to fire risk. burnt my thumb on the port on the back it got so hot. i guess you get what you pay for but at 25. bucks it was good for the year. update called the company and they replaced it. the new one has limited wireless connectivity and range ...  quick fix is to open it and find the antenna and attach a wire to it, it increased my range 10 fold and stopped the buffering issues i had.

Reviews.Title: Overall, a nice unit...
Reviews.Author: Thomas Duff "Duffbert"
Reviews.Content: I got the D-Link from Amazon Vine to try out and review. I've been wanting something that I can use for keeping an eye on certain areas of the house when I'm downstairs working in my home office. This fits the bill on many accounts, with only a few things I wished it had.The video quality is very good for the size and price. I was able to get the software working with no problem, and I could monitor the feed from my desktop machine as well as from my iPhone. The wireless capability is excellent, as it gives me part of the freedom I need to place the unit anywhere in the house. The downside is that it needs a power connection to run (no on-board batteries). Being that our house is on the older side, there's not as many power outlets as I'd like, and it's a bit of a limiting factor on where I can use it (especially if I don't want obvious cords hanging out).Probably the biggest downside is that it doesn't come with a built-in way to store or record the video. That takes additional (read "more expensive") hardware/software to make happen. So if you want to use it to keep a record of the area being monitored, you're out of luck. On the other hand, it does have motion detection, so it can email you a snapshot of what caused the triggering of the detector. That might be "after the fact" instead of real-time, but it might be what allows you to see "who dun it".All in all, this is a cool unit to have around in certain situations. If you know its limitations and those don't come into play for you, then this is a good choice.Disclosure:Obtained From: Amazon Vine Review ProgramPayment: Free

Reviews.Title: For the price, this camera works well and is easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Hoppaguy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to check on the house every once in awhile while I am out. I do not use this as a robust security solution but it does allow for email alerts for motion or sound activity. The camera is very easy to setup as you simply download the .zip file from the D-Link website and run the install and follow the instructions. It took me about 3 minutes total to set up the camera. From there, you can view the camera from the MyDlink website or from your mobile phone device. The web access seems fine if not a little slow but I have tested several cameras from Belkin and D-Link and they have the same lag. I will have to say that the iOS app for iPhone is a really slow on loading up the camera. It also strikes me as strange that you have to pay 99 cents for the iPad version of the MyDlink app whereas the iPhone version is free. Overall though this is a pretty good value surveillance camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Roka
Reviews.Content: This is true plug and play. Nice way monitor your home while away.For such an inexpensive item although not HD, it's still clear enough to do the job.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, works well, is reliable
Reviews.Author: Celestialsky29
Reviews.Content: First off, apparently you can record with this unit, by downloading the free software from D-Link's site.  I emailed D-Link and they pointed me to the right link on their site.  I, however, could not get the software to download.  I would rate myself as having higher then average computer knowledge, and after multiple attempts, I was still unable to get my computer to fully download the software.  That being said, I would have given this a 5 had I been able to test it with the recording software.The picture is good, but you really have to have a good amount of light in order to see anything.  The Night feature is perfect for this!  You won't see it in color, but you will see everything clearly.  I used my Droid phone, downloaded the free app., and tested it with my cat while I was away during the day at work.  There is about a 10 second lag when used with my smartphone.  I have tested it, and counted to determine this.  There isn't a lag when I view it on my computer.  With the app., you can take photos with it, in case you needed to.I haven't played much with the computer software, as it really doesn't do me any good to view it while I am here at home.  However, the software itself is user friendly, and was fast to install.  I think it only took me about 15 minutes to get the camera up an working.  I love the wifi feature!  I can place this camera anywhere in my home.  I have a D-Link router, so the instructions matched my unit.  You plug it in, download the start up wizard, and it leads you through what to do.  I had absolutely no problem getting it up and running quickly.  I didn't need to refer to the instructions that came with it except to locate the website so I could download the software.If you can get the recording software to download, this is an excellent camera!  I thought the picture was fantastic, especially the day time image, as it is in color, and very clear.  If I can get the recording software to work, I will change my review.  I have one more idea up my sleeve, and then I am giving up.

Reviews.Title: Great security solution for the price, iPhone app very useful
Reviews.Author: Steve Ruskin
Reviews.Content: For the price, this S-Link camera seems to be a great value. It does not promise to be a whole-house security system with real time recording, etc. If you want that, look elsewhere and expect to pay more.But what you do get is a very good camera with high quality imaging that can be set up quickly and accessed by an easy to use app.I installed this camera in a matter of minutes on my home system (Mac based). The installer really was a breeze. The free iPhone app also installed quickly and in less than 10 minutes after opening the box I was monitoring my kitchen and living room on my iPhone.Daytime-mode images are nice and crisp, and the night-time images are also very good and seem to have a range well beyond the 15 feet D-Link indicates (perhaps I have more ambient light in my area at night). You can also connect the camera by cable or wifi, but wifi seems to be by far the best choice as then you have much more flexibility as to where to place the camera.Other reviewers have complained that without a recording feature the camera isn't very useful, as you would have to be watching the feed all the time to see if anyone was breaking in, messing with your stuff, etc. However we have a good home alarm system and if it ever went off we would be notified immediately, which would allow me to turn on the app and check the camera right away. The app also includes a photo option, so you can take still photos from the D-Link camera that are saved to your Photos app (on the iPhone/iPad anyway).Two minor issues were 1) the iPhone app sometimes doesn't connect to the camera, and needs to be restarted to get the feed; 2) there is a 2-3 second delay in the feed, so it is almost but not quite "real time" (this may be a function of network speed, cell-phone distance, etc.). And of course, should your network go down, the camera is useless. But that almost goes without saying.For the price, this is a good-quality camera. It requires manual monitoring but unless you are willing to pay much more for a hard-drive based surveillance system, in this price range the D-Link camera is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: Surprising video quality and ease of use; does not come with record feature
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Dlink has been doing a great job reshaping their whole line of wireless products.  We replaced our old TPLink router with a Dlink Cloud router a few weeks ago and were very impressed with the results.  And now we have acquired this wireless camera and are equally impressed with it.  Dlink is beginning to create a Dlink ecosystem, where you can remotely access your Dlink Cloud-enabled wireless devices over the internet.  That means you can control and monitor your home network and wireless cameras from anywhere you can get on the internet.  Setting up this camera took literally less than five minutes.  With no fuss at all, we were seeing the camera on our network and viewing images on our Mac laptop, iPhone, and iPad.  The picture quality in full light was a quality VGA image (don't expect HD, since this is a wireless camera and it is viewable over the 'net).  We then tested it in full darkness and were not disappointed.  We could easily see the advertised 15 feet.  The one catch in the darkness is that the first time we set it up, there was a sidewalk lamp in the image, and the light from that lamp tended to wash out much of the image.  So be sure to test your placement before leaving for your trip.  The mobile app for this camera allows you to change zoom and switch from daytime to nighttime mode.  You can also setup the camera interval (continuous feed, intermittent snapshot, etc.).So the quality of the camera at this price range is very good.  Ease of setup is a major plus. Do note, however, that this camera does not come with the software or hardware to record video.  It would be 5+ stars if it came with an SD card slot to capture (and loop) video, or if it came with software to record a loop of video or stills online or to a computer. If you do buy this camera, you just need to understand that it is live "surveillance" which may not be appropriate for a true security system.  We use it to check the house once in a while while on vacation and it has worked great for that.  However, if your home is compromised while you are a way, this camera alone will not capture and store the incident.  Also keep in mind that the camera does not have a battery, so it needs to be plugged in all the time and is not suitable for exposure to bad weather.  A fun quality camera for sure, but be sure it fits your needs.

Reviews.Title: This is a cool product
Reviews.Author: Multi-Media Man
Reviews.Content: I have not used a product like this before, so I am comparing it to ground zero.  The set up was easy and the features work very well.  The night vision seems fairly limited, but other than that the product does what they say it will do.  We like this product and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: WORKS LIKE EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: fmwaalex "fmwaalex"
Reviews.Content: D-LINK CAMERAI have been pleased with thus product thus far as it has done what I expected it to do. It was easy to install and set up which is always a plus. I have this placed where I can see what is going on at all times in my house. Like described it works during the day and night with its night vision. If you have an I Phone, pad, or android then you can watch from those devices at any time. The only thing that some people might not like is that there is no recording storage unless you do it yourself. That isn't that much of a big deal but it does take up your space. Other than that I have liked it and would recommend it if you know everything going in. The picture quality is good and the product works, so I guess is all is well.

Reviews.Title: Quite nice and easy.  I'd give 4.5 stars if I could.
Reviews.Author: Truth Teller
Reviews.Content: Setup: - Pro: Fast, simple, easyI've got a new Dlink router with the "MyCloud" feature.  I don't know if this helped with setup, but I didn't have to hassle with anything really.  I just plugged it in once via wired and it automatically set itself up for wireless and then I was able to take it elsewhere. - Pro: Can be mounted on wall / ceiling - Con: Network is wireless, but power is not. Would like a battery pack option.Website use: - Pro: Pretty simple and easy. - Pro: Visible from anywhere (not just when at home) - Pro: Can see live view or change settings - Pro: Can see both my router (Dlink) and the cameraMotion Detection: - Pro: Is configurable for detection areas. - Pro: Can be scheduled for the hours and days.  - Con: can't have multiple schedules:  e.g. every night after bed and during weekdays when at work - Con: A little too sensitive at times.Smartphone App (Android): - Pro: Simple and easy - Pro: Responsive - Con: Missing settings control (other than day / night)Picture Quality: - Pro: Good enough for most use - Con: Only 640x480 and I don't see a way to increase resolutionNotifications: - Pro: Can send you an email with screen shots on schedule, on motion, or on sound. - Con: Emails pile up fast, need some alternative option to store pictures for review.

Reviews.Title: A great way to keep an eye on my dogs
Reviews.Author: John Flora
Reviews.Content: We have a couple of Australian shepherds - Jack, who is almost 2, and Dora, who is an 11-week-old puppy. As is characteristic with Aussies, they prefer to lounge around near the back door when they're outside, so I positioned the camera in a kitchen window with a view of the back door area of our screened-in porch. It gives me great peace of mind to be able to check on the dogs either from my upstairs office desktop computer or my netbook or iPhone when I'm away from home. I particularly like the free iPhone app that lets me switch the camera from daylight to infrared remotely and to snap freeze-frame photos.The resolution and frame rate are hardly broadcast quality, but they're more than adequate for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: First Time Security Cam User - A Home Day Care Helper
Reviews.Author: S. Rudge "Always Even Steven"
Reviews.Content: I've never used one of these surveillance system cameras before and I was eager to give it a try.  One of my nearby neighbors runs an in-home day care and we installed it in her house so she could keep an eye on the main day-room when she was not in the actual room.  She uses her smartphone to monitor the activity while she is preparing meals or doing simple chores.  Installation was simple, not plug and play, but plug, download set up software, sign-up and play.  The unit can be easily mounted to a wall or ceiling (screws included) and the camera itself is on a swivel head so it can move anyway you need it to if you attach it to a surface.The picture was pretty impressive in a normally lit room.  The field of view was wide enough to cover almost the entire room.  Not the greatest quality, but still pretty good and totally adequate for our needs.  I don't think it was designed to be a hidden camera, but it is small enough, about the size and weight of a deck of cards, to at least be unobtrusive.  The sound quality was also fine, but for our purposes we didn't need really high quality sound, we just needed sound.The place we have attached it there really isn't much use for night vision as nobody really uses the room much after the kids leave.  I didn't have a chance to test the night vision much other than to turn the lights out in the room and wait for darkness and then move in front of the camera.  For that it appears the image is view-able to about 20 ft. We set up the auto e-mail function for movement just to test it and it worked every time we tested it.  We didn't really get as many false positives (actually none) because the room is almost all artificial light with very little light coming from outside to throw off the motion detection system. Turning the light on in the room sets it off every time.We have been very happy with the set-up we have and although we are not using the camera to its fullest potential, it has become a very handy and useful tool in this environment.  We believe we found one of the perfect niches for this kind of technology.  The mostly glitch free quality and ease of set-up makes this a great choice for home day-care providers.

Reviews.Title: Simple monitoring solution
Reviews.Author: P. McCauley
Reviews.Content: The camera is reasonably straightforward to set up, and once it has been it can be used wirelessly away from a router. It always needs to be plugged into the mains, the lead is not very long and there is no battery option, which restricts where it can be placed. But if that is not an issue you can set this where you please, or screw it to a wall.Once it has been set up you can access this simply from your computer on the D-Link website or from your mobile device using the mydlink app. You can have a number of devices set up on the one account and easily switch between them. You can also set it to alert you when the camera picks up movement or sound.The image quality is decent and allows you to zoom but not pan in any direction. The night mode makes it a lot easier to see what's going on in darker places, and the audio quality is good enough to actually hear what people are saying on it.A simple monitoring solution, depending on what you actually need it for.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and a Built-In Wi-Fi Extender (DCS-933L)
Reviews.Author: In the AmaZone...
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed overall with this camera. I found it easy to set up, easy to use and easy to access remotely using all the default setup parameters. While the audio quality is lacking in my opinion, it doesn't have much effect on my primary use for this camera which is monitoring the dogs inside the house during the day, with a third camera on the outside front porch and door (it is also handy while traveling to make sure the dog sitter isn't drinking all my beer -haha).I am using this camera on a Linksys N wireless network, serving both Win XP and Win 7 PCs. I completed the initial installation, including the MyDlink registration in about 15 minutes, just by following the instructions step by step. I did set up the camera with a different username and password than I did for the MyDlink.com web account, since it appears that accessing the camera remotely, also reveals network settings. I have another DLink camera and both are accessible from the same website/user account. During the installation you may want to also check the DLINK-dot-COM website for any firmware upgrades (which can also be done later if/when necessary) and a copy of the Windows Setup Wizard. I did my initial setup with a wired connection, then later moved the camera and connected wireless. Once set up and in place, you can login to the online account and fine tune your camera settings.The night vision works very well, and while accessing the camera remotely on the weekend during a thunderstorm, I was surprised at how quickly the camera adjusted/recovered from room illuminating lightning flashes back to regular night vision. One note on night use is that between the red "night-lights" and the green indicator light, this camera is actually fairly bright and very indiscreet. If you are using it for security or visible to the outdoors, it will get noticed. Daylight or indoor illuminated use is quite good. Colors are clearly differentiated and movement is pretty smooth for a camera this size.

Reviews.Title: Small, affordable, decent feature set, and acceptable image quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: [I haven't tested the repeater function or cloud services so I won't comment on those.]This is one of the many cameras that I have in my home. I've also used Axis cameras (the best so far but also the most expensive), some Dlink PTZ cameras, and Foscams. The DCS-933L is everything that I would expect at this price range and I recommend it. The biggest annoyance (for me) is that I couldn't mount it in any of my existing locations because it doesn't accept a standard camera tripod mount.Good+ Installation was simple and trivial. I plugged in an Ethernet cable and the camera instantly got an IP address from the DHCP server. I logged in using the user name ("admin") and default password (it's blank. there is no default password). That was it. I didn't bother with the dlink software or their installation instructions.+ I found audio quality to be great.+ Day/Night image quality was pretty crisp+ Reliable. I've had it on for a week 24/7 with no issues at all+ Emailing images on motion and sound detection works well+ Works well with my favorite iOS App - IP Cam Viewer Pro (NibblesnBits)Bad- Nighttime range can be poor (similar to most cameras with infrared night modes)- Proprietary mounting system. Most cameras have tripod mounts which makes them easier to install.- Annoying java security warnings in my browser- Motion detection can be hard to configure and is sensitive to changes in lighting

Reviews.Title: Useful and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Archie Mercer "Archie"
Reviews.Content: I had never needed a surveillance camera up until recently and really had no experience in what to look for. I had the opportunity to try the D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera (DCS-933L) and found it to be an adequate unit for our situation. Very easy to set up as you just plug the unit into your computer to download the software, then go online to set up a free account with D-Link. Seriously, there is nothing to it even for a technology-challenged person like myself. To me that is the best part of the product.A couple of things to note, the camera really begins to get hot if you leave it plugged in for extended periods (hours). I would not feel comfortable using this as a 24/7 type of unit. But for operating a couple of hours for a specific situation, ours being a child visitation hosted at our house, it's perfect. The streaming leaves a bit to be desired as sometimes it stutters. That could very well be a product of my older computer or our internet server so I can't really dock it for that. But the stuttering is minimal so no worries. Last point, if you plan to maybe hide the camera for stealth monitoring it is probably too big for that. While not huge it still is relatively obvious.Overall this is the perfect unit for our situation. Not to pricey and very functional with an easy set up. I would have no problem adding additional D-Link cameras if needed.

Reviews.Title: Wish it was HD, wireless extender option is problematic
Reviews.Author: Ms. T
Reviews.Content: Update 8/12 - I had to turn of the wireless extender option because it was really causing me network stability issues and I would have to unplug and replug it in daily to get my network back up to speeds.  Since I turned this feature off, my network has gone back to completely stable.Original:I like the software on this DLink camera better than the hardware.  The app, and the web interface both have more options than the similar Belkin Netcam.  I use the Dlink lite app with this and it is okay, but they do occasionally lose connectivity which requires me to reboot it to restore it's connection.  The picture on this, is just okay - image quality seems subpar compare to the Belkin netcam HD, even when you factor in hd vs non hd.  However, the DLink does better in low light/bright light than the Belkin does.  What I like most about this camera is it's advanced web settings (this is something the Belkin netam doesn't have at all) which let you set it up to record activity to FTP server or send email pictures.  I tried the email option on motion detection, but that really produced a lot of false alerts.  Instead I set it to record to an FTP server, which I set up with my asus router to use one of my router attached usb drives as an ftp server, and this works flawlessly with very few false alerts.  I mostly just use the dlink app for viewing live feeds.  I did try the paid DLink + app which is supposed to let you view multiple streams at once, but it couldn't connect to this camera or the PTZ one that I also have, so I uninstalled and had it refunded.  I think maybe this and the ptz one are older models that they have updated the firmware on and added the wireless extender option - which I am using and it seems to work pretty good.  With the wireless extender option turned on, I know have full wifi signal in every room in the house.  The PTZ camera is identical in image quality and advanced web settings with the only added feature being the PTZ, which I reallyt don't use much because it moves slowly and only in increments.  I like this camera, but at this price, I'd recommend spending a few extra bucks and getting an HD version.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, nice size but with quircks
Reviews.Author: SMXSteve
Reviews.Content: I have several webcams/network cams and security video systems. My favorite is a Panasonic BL-C131A wireless network cam which has been running for over four years 24/7 pointing out our front window onto the porch. The Panasonic has excellent picture quality and fantastic software. The Dlink costs less but has a few quircks.First off the Dlink DCS-933L webcam is slow to connect to the network and it is slow to open the video every time you open or change to the video web page. These aren't huge issues because you rely on motion detection most of the time, however, motion detection requires JAVA to set up.Installation did not go according to instructions but it's not that hard to set up. I used (and prefer) the browser to set up and access my webcams instead of installing software. This way you have the same interface anywhere in the world.  I tried the D-View Cam software but immediately ran into trouble so didn't bother with it and uninstalled it.The built-in software has too much extra junk on the screen so that you have to scroll to see the full cam view. Yet there are no record, snapshot or other useful functions while viewing the image. It takes several seconds for the image to come up each time you visit the page. Brightness and other controls are on a separate screen so you can't see the image as you make changes - bizarre.This is the only cam that I have ever used that requires JAVA to run MJPEG video and for setting up areas for motion detection.  Unfortunately you have to install JAVA if you want to use motion detection because you have to CLICK all of the areas to MAKE THEM WORK (contrary to what the screen says). The manual states otherwise and in order to see the screen to click it you must install JAVA.You can only select one FTP server. The Panasonic allows you to setup several different triggering times and options each having its own FTP settings. For instance, for one trigger I have it capture an image every second for a web page, other triggers are set for motion detection and upload to a different server.Accessing this from outside of your network is as easy as setting up port forwarding on your router. Works great!Image quality indoors is really good especially getting correct colors. I tried to point it outside through the window but the image was washed out and I couldn't get it adjusted to see much.Caution when updating firmware, the links on their website are not correct even though you click on the specific camera and choose firmware you aren't taken to the link specific to that camera on the next page, you must select it again.I like the size of this little cam for the picture quality it gives. The small size makes it easy to take with you or move around which can come in handy.It's a decent, wireless cam, nice size and fairly easy to set up. But with its few quirks including having to install JAVA make it not so attractive.

Reviews.Title: Finally! A Webcam that works on Smartphones and is Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Bill Nicholas
Reviews.Content: My primary objective over the last several years has been to find a smartphone usable IP cam. This one actually works and is easy to use. My experience has been that most IP cams SAY you can use your smartphone to monitor your home via smartphone, but most either don't work or are very hard to configure (meaning figuring out port forwarding and other router configurations). The marketing prose says "easy" but the marketing wears off as soon as you open the box. I have also seen some recent products geared to smartphone capabilities come on the market that were met with mixed reviews, so I have held off trying them. This model, however, I think has finally made it workable and easy for the average user. Please note I am using a wired configuration, so I don't know how well the wireless feature works.Pros:---I am in a Windows and Android environment, so I don't know how it performs on Apple products, but the set up was quick and easy---Using the android app, My Dlink Lite, on my Galaxy S3, the setup was easy and the video image came through beautifully. Again,this is the first IP Cam I have found that actually works as advertised on a smartphone---The video resolution is fair, but far better than other cameras I have been using. The colors are excellent but the resolution is not high enough to serve as reliable evidence in court testimony. For everyday use, however, it is good---Nice sound capabilities, which can be turned off---Notifications by e-mail can use images, video or both. I found this feature to work better than any other camera I have tried---The price, I think, is a great value---Using MyDlink you can view from any computerCons (none are deal breakers, to me)---Can't pan camera. The field of view is pretty wide, about right if you are monitoring a driveway, for example, but I would like to see D-Link come out with a model that can pan back and forth/up and down remotely---Motion sensor allows you to pick the areas to watch, but only in chunks of square blocks that can't be finely tuned, so you may end up with areas you don't want---Smartphone app has had trouble connecting a couple of times so far. If I log in or out it starts working again. Not sure how often this will happen, as I just started using it, however, I am hoping firmware and/or app upgrades help (There was one new version of the firmware available I just installed)---Motion detection too sensitive, even on lowest level in basic setup options, but read on below for solution---Night vision not great, but better than others I have tried. If you have outdoor motion sensitive lights, you can see enough to figure out what's going on (it caught an interesting snap of a bird in flight)A couple of things to note:1) Nowhere could I find anything that says if this product was for outdoor use. I installed it outdoors, but I'm in S. Cal. and it is under a overhang, so it isn't getting exposed to much. If anyone knows if it can be used outdoors, let me know2) The setup and configuration options available in the basic setup probably will do for most users. However, I was very glad to find more options and abilities in the Advanced Setup section. You login in with your same credentials as your MyDlink. For users with a little more knowledge that average about IP Cams, this section is really useful and easy to use. One thing you may want to venture into it for is the sensitivity settings of the motion detection feature. The basic setup only goes down to 25%, but you can set it to whatever you want in the Advanced section (see my Update, though).So, this is my initial review, which, I admit, I did earlier than I normally so, but this camera works so well, so far, I just had to get something out right away. I will follow up and revise as needed.Update 7/15/13: I decided to turn off the motion detecting e-mail alerts. Even set at the lowest sensitivity and selecting a small area to monitor, it sent "false positives" too often. A common problem with motion detection is that it is often triggered by changes in light, like when a cloud passes over. This model doesn't have a solution for that (I e-mailed D-Link customer service last week, but I haven't heard back from them). I may use it if I go on vacation. Otherwise, the camera is still working reliably on my smartphone.Update 8/29/13: D-Link Support finally answered the e-mail I sent in early July. Wow! Pretty slow response time, I would say. They said, yes, changes in light trigger the camera to take a snap, and to just play around with the settings more. Luckily, the camera is working, for my purposes, solidly.

Reviews.Title: good solution for occasional monitoring needs
Reviews.Author: Sreeram Ramakrishnan
Reviews.Content: If you are content with using it purely as a IP camera, this is very easy to install (10-15 min) camera and serves the purpose (monitoring driveway, school bus stop, basement playroom, UPS deliveries, and get data to answer questions like 'when do deer eat all my hostas?').  Perhaps not for something that will require constant monitoring, especially if you are going to set up email alerts. The Java (JRE) updates needed for viewing this via the website (with improved functionality and alerts) can become a nightmare if not patient.  Took about an 1-1.5 hour to update, reboot and change virus program settings etc. Wish it were a tad easier than that.  (-0.5*)The night-time vision is good but with its limited range and resolution, you may not be able to monitor wide areas. The zoom functions to visualize the view is quite responsive.  The only issue I have had with the camera is that it sometimes drops the WiFi signal - may say more about the overall signal strength in where I am placing the camera than the device itself. The Android app worked fine for me (Samsung Galaxy) but the reviews seem to suggest "hit-or-miss" for different handsets.For the price range, it is a good IP camera once you get beyond the installation issues. The app with its limited functionality will serve most people's occasional monitoring needs but may not be sufficient for a security camera. For more serious applications, a family of products from Panasonic that includes body temperature sensors may be worth the investigation.

Reviews.Title: One of the better ones I've used
Reviews.Author: M. Kelley "mpkelley20"
Reviews.Content: I have several home cameras around my house right now.  An expensive outdoor Nexia one, an indoor Belkin one and now this D-Link one.  I have been trying to find a good system to use to expand my home coverage but I;m having a tough time deciding on what brand to go with.  Nexia requires a subscription (no thanks), the Belmin one worked great at first but seems to have issues when viewing on my Iphone over 3g/4g (the image is very sporadic on when it comes up).  The D-Link, so far, seems to be a good compromise as it loads fast and is equal in quality to the others from what I can tell.Setup was easy for me as I currently use a D-Link Cloud router.  I simply plugged the camera into an outlet and connected it to the router via ethernet and it was configured.  I logged into MyDlink accounts (I had set this up a while ago because of my router) and the camera was there for me to add to my devices and quickly begin using.On a PC, the video image is pretty good considering this is not HD video.  On my Iphone, the video looks great.  What stands out so far is the audio.  It is much better than the Belkin camera as it comes through very clearly.One of the other benefits to this camera is the ability to use this as an extender for wi-fi.  I use several other extenders throughout my house but more is always better.  I added this to my living room and now I get a very strong signal in my upstairs bedrooms which always had mediocre signals without it.  Setting up the externder was simple as you just need to check a box in the camera settings.  This can be done either on a PC or using the phone app.  You can also use the settings area to activate motion sensor and alerts.The funny thing about this camera is that it looks like my Belkin camera.  The Belikin camera looks like other cameras.  So I am guessing that there is some factory pumping out these los cost cameras and then the company is putting its proprietary software on it.  And I think it's the software that makes or breaks how well these will work.  So far, the D-link is doing great.  I would love to figure out a way to make my Belkin camera work on MyDLink but I haven't figured that out yet. Anyone??!!!

Reviews.Title: Makes clicking noises, but is very easy to set up (not on Mac)
Reviews.Author: Mark Taylor "markdtaylor"
Reviews.Content: This day/night camera comes with mounting hardware.  The Camera also has sound, and it rotates 360 degrees (manually).The only two problems are:1. The power cord is not routed through the base, so the photo is not that realistic.  The photo should show a power cord snaking away from the camera.2. The camera makes random clicking noises, it seems to happen when it turns on or tries to focus.  It sounds like an old mechanical shutter.  Not a deal breaker, but I would not want to use it in a child's bedroom as it might wake them up.The wonderful things are:1. Night vision, albeit only a short distance (10 to 15 feet)2. Motion activated camera, no need to see a constant stream, just review the scenes with motion in them.I have this unit tucked behind a curtain looking out a window so that I can see if my cats have left the deck for the back yard. The yard is about 75 feet deep and the fixed focus allows me to see right to the back fence very clearly (at least during the day).There is a third problem just for Mac users. The JRE version required to view your camera stream online with Chrome or Safari is not compatible with the latest version, so no luck viewing your camera with a late model Mac with the latest version of Java. (this as of 7/7/13).  The iPhone app works great, but I would like it to have all of the setting that the web browser has.

Reviews.Title: Great internet camera offers foolproof setup
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ray
Reviews.Content: I've wanted an internet camera for security purposes for some time. It's nice to have a way to see what happens when you aren't home.My chief requirements for such a camera were that it connect to my wireless network, have a motion detection feature, and that it be able to save the video files somewhere for safe keeping. The D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and Built-In N 300 Mbps Repeater (DCS-933L) fulfills all of those requirements nicely.Setting up the camera was a snap. The manual directs you to the D-Link website to download the configuration software. After download, the wizard ran through the configuration quickly and easily. After setting up the camera, you can connect to the advanced configuration panel by using the IP address for your camera in a web browser - I used Google Chrome and it worked fine. If you have a D-Link router, I understand it is even easier to set up.The advanced configuration offers very granular control over a myriad of settings. You can adjust the video and audio settings, image quality, motion control settings, day and night mode, email, ftp, and the time and date.The time and date settings have an option to allow you to synchronize the camera's date and time with a time server, which is usually my preference. However, the D-Link camera was always an hour wrong using the time server (regardless of whether the DST option was enabled or not), so I finally changed to manually setting the time and date.The FTP option allows you to upload captured images and videos to an FTP site. This has been my favorite so far. I have an FTP server in my home network on my NAS device, and the camera is able to write files to it using the FTP server's internal IP address to avoid using bandwidth from my ISP for these transfers. I also tested the FTP settings with an FTP site outside of my home network and it wrote there just as easily. With most residential ISPs having limits on monthly bandwidth usage, however, it doesn't make sense to write it to an external FTP site if I have another option. Those without an FTP site could easily set one up using free FTP Server software such as Filezilla if you have a computer that stays within your home network, like a desktop PC.The email option allows you to email images and videos to an email address of your choosing. You must enter settings for an SMTP server to be able to use this. I used my Gmail account and within 5 hours, Gmail blocked my account due to excessive usage. I can't blame them for that - with several cats in my home, the motion detection feature was capturing images and video constantly and emailing each to me. I do not recommend using this option if you have pets who can access the area the camera is surveying unless you are sure your email provider will not block your account for such high usage. My Gmail account was available again after about 12 hours, but I do recommend that anyone using this feature consider setting up an email account dedicated to just this process rather than an account you use for normal email. If your email is blocked, at least it would not be one you rely on. Another thing to consider with the email option is that you are using bandwidth with your ISP for every image and video that is emailed. This could quickly get high if you aren't careful. While it is nice to have the email option, the FTP feature serves my needs much better.I do wish that the camera could write to some of the file services such as Dropbox. That would be convenient, but of course would use bandwidth and you'd need to be sure you have enough free space in your account to use it. That might be why it isn't an option.This camera also offers a wireless extender option. Basically, it has its own wireless access point built in so you can connect your Wifi devices to it rather than your main wireless router. If the camera is in an area of your home where there is a weak signal to your main router, this is extremely helpful. I recommend allowing the camera's extender option to use the same wireless network name as your primary router and also giving it the same password. That way, connecting automatically to the wireless network with the strongest signal will happen seamlessly as you move around your property.One thing I really wish this camera had was a wider angle camera or the ability to pan and tilt. For the price, I would have expected one of those features to be included.D-Link does offer an app for Android phones and iPads to be able to configure and view the camera remotely. The app works pretty well, although the video is halting even when computers connected to the same network as the Android device stream the video without interruption. I've only tested it on my Motorola Droid Razr Maxx HD and my Kindle Fire HD, both Android devices. I do not use iPads or iPhones.One thing that really disappointed me is that the resolution for viewing live video over the internet. If the device you are viewing the live video on is in the same network as the camera, the video resolution is 640 x 480. However, if you are viewing the live video over the internet, then the resolution is only 320 x 240, which makes it hard to see what is happening in the video. The resolution in a web browser on a computer is worse than the resolution on my tablet or smartphone. I do understand that the smaller resolution setting will save bandwidth, but would prefer this be a configurable option.This camera has a foolproof setup and great image and video quality with a robust feature set. If you need to monitor a very specific area, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: All around excellent
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Gave this one a 5 star rating because of it's ease of use and easy to follow directions.  This camera has audio which can be disabled as well as the green connectivity light on the front.  I have mine in my three season room out back to monitor the outside.  The picture quality is far better than what I expected and by using the d-link app on my iPhone, there is no guess work.  One tap and I'm online.The only thing to mention is that when setting up this camera, you will be asked to update the firmware.  When you do this, do NOT forget to update the drivers too.  If you don't update the drivers, you will NOT be able to change any settings and the camera will be stuck where it's at.  I found this out the hard way but after a simple internet search, I was on my way again.  The manual does not tell you this.  This is a great camera and I'm going to be picking up another one or two soon!

Reviews.Title: Great live picture day and night...once it's set up
Reviews.Author: Mysti
Reviews.Content: This camera arrives with no software but the instructions tell you where to get the installation package. The installation software is easy to use and guides you through setup step by step. For some reason this camera could not find my wireless network when it scanned for wifi networks, and the wps setup took 3 tries to take, very inconvenient since my router and computer are on different floors. Once set up, the camera started live streaming through the website, and could also be accessed through the cameras IP.Having read, "sound and motion detection" on the box and on the amazon product page, I spent a bit of time looking for recording options. Eventually I confirmed, THIS CAMERA DOES NOT OFFER CLOUD STORAGE OF VIDEO RECORDINGS, OR COME WITH RECORDING SOFTWARE. For all the capability of a wireless camera I was disappointed that the "sound and motion detection" would trigger an email being sent to an address you set. That means I could get an email, login in from my phone or work computer and I would have to hope that whatever set it off was still there in front of the camera for me to take a screen capture. For this reason I would only recommend this camera as is, as a baby monitoring device, or for other similar jobs where you will be watching the camera at all times.The sound and picture quality is great and indoors the night vision works very well.Overall: Minimally challenging to install, with great sound and video. Wireless versatility limited by lack of recording.

Reviews.Title: Effective and Easy to Set Up
Reviews.Author: Tradecraft "Live by the Sword"
Reviews.Content: The D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and Built-In N 300 Mbps Repeater (DCS-933L) is a functional camera that provides an added sense of security. From opening the box to complete set up took me only 20 minutes. I could have been faster but the D-Link website could be set up to be more user friendly. I had no problems downloading the software and hooking up the camera. Everything went very smooth. It took me an additional 5 minutes to download the mydlink lite app to my phone which also was very easy and works flawlessly. Within 25 minutes I was completely up and running. I did not screw the camera to a fixed location as I may decide to move it based upon my needs.Pros:+ Simple, fast, and easy set up+ Camera picture is good although not HD quality+ Audio is very loud and clear+ Night Vision works very well on both my PC and phone+ e-mail alerts can be set up+ Ability to zoom+ Can connect up to 32 cameras on a screen to be viewedCons:- No ability to pan or tilt camera remotely- User manual does not come with package but is available for download online- If you lose your power source the camera will not work. It would be nice to have a backup battery supply.Overall Assessment:The DCS-933L Surveillance Camera is a simple and easy to set up providing you with convenient methods to remotely view your camera(s). It is important to know what your security needs are prior to purchasing this system and see if this will appropriately suit your particular needs. This system is easy to use and provides flexibility but there are also some limitations such as no backup power and the power cord can be unplugged rendering it useless. This camera system is for "light" security or to monitor kids or pets while you are away from your home. It can also be useful to supplement an existing security system which it what I am using this for.Overall, I like this camera and will be purchasing two more.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: R. Francis
Reviews.Content: This product is relatively easy to set up, hardest part for me was getting JAVA to work correctly. Resolution is a little fuzzy so if you want really good detail on small things I would upgrade to a better version.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to set up with a Mac
Reviews.Author: Ben Zvan
Reviews.Content: The camera works great and I'm sure it would be simple to configure with a Windows PC. Configuring it with a Mac was much more difficult as I had to download and install the setup software which was far from perfect and threw many errors before finally connecting to the camera and the internet and working correctly. The built-in web server works great for day-to-day configuration like notifications, exposure, and motion sensitivity, but you have to use the setup software to connect the camera to mydlink.com.

Reviews.Title: good camera but low resolution
Reviews.Author: T. Hronas
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Easy setup.  Incorporated with my other D-link camera easily, so now  I can access both camera on-line  with ease.  The only drawback is that the 930-L is lower resolution (240 vs 480), so the imagine quality is less.  That wasn't clear when I purchased the cam.

Reviews.Title: many pluses
Reviews.Author: Bebbia J.
Reviews.Content: I've owned Edimax and Panasonic wireless cameras as well.  The D-Link is my favorite.  Easiest to set up, easiest to access from web or mobile phone.  Although lightweight and all-plastic exterior, it has lasted well.  Using motion-activated images emailed to my gmail account, I managed to detect an intruder in my back yard within minutes of him being there.  I had the police notified by the time I left my office for home.  Had we more effective law enforcement in Tucson (they have to be among the worst, probably due to budget cuts), we might have gotten the perp.  But at least I could send the images around and alert the neighborhood watch.  The only thing I wish this camera featured (so far as I know it doesn't) is real-time iphone notification which can be set to be pushed when motion detection is most likely a bad guy (in other words, especially significant motion filling the field of view near the house).  But I don't know any camera that has this feature.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Turbo
