Reviews.Content: Easy set up and very reliable. I use it to make sure my dog doesn't break out of his cage while we are gone and its been pretty flawless at that so far. Connected to my wifi network with ease and its real quick to reestablish the connection if the power goes out or if I unplug it to move it. Definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: James W. Gerber "Jimmy"
Reviews.Content: This was very inexpensive so it is bare bones. It works fine except that uPNP does not work.  Got blown off by support,

Reviews.Title: Don't buy unless you have 24hrs to wait on hold to talk to someone.
Reviews.Author: apg
Reviews.Content: The instructions didn't work for the first two cameras, and this is my second call to D-Link. I have been on hold now for 60 mins. for the second camera.  My original plan was to install four cameras on my wireless.  So far only one works.  I just spoke to "Jeff," if that is his real name and he told me I had press the wrong number on the phone and that he only handles old cameras....  I told him I press the exact number that I did with my first call to D-Link but just placed me on hold again !!!  That was 15 min. ago and I'm still holding. I hate them.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price....
Reviews.Author: Christopher T. Cheung "Just4SC"
Reviews.Content: Got this a couple of months ago and waited until I had a chance to really use it before writing this review.  The unit is okay for the price I paid for it.  The setup was pretty straight forward IF you follow the directions.  I have a Foscam and I assumed the setup to be about the same so it took me a little longer to set this up than necessary.  Anyways, I found that after using both the Foscam and this that I really do miss/need the pan and tilt feature so if you think you need that feature you are better off looking for another unit.Here's a list of the pros and cons:PROs:Good network speed (comparing to the Foscam I have) - I get about 15-24 fps (my Foscam is about 2-8 fps)Easy to set upCan turn off LEDMotion sensor - able to select particular area as "trigger"Included software is "intuitive" for meCONs:Sound quality is terribleOnly has one way audio (can only "listen")Short power cord (about 4ft)I'll update this when I have more time to play around with it.  Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Wayne Paterson "allpar2"
Reviews.Content: For the $40 it was selling for, a great deal. It takes a while to get it set up properly, and I followed the advice of another Amazon person by hooking it up via Ethernet first, setting it up via the web interface, then moving it out on its own with a pre-set IP address and such. It did not "take" all settings the first time but eventually worked fine. Missing a lot of the features of its more expensive brethren but great for my purpose, which is watching an alarm panel, heater cutoff switch (which people tend to hit by mistake), and, most important, cat food and water. (It's only used when we go away.)

Reviews.Title: Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Neeland
Reviews.Content: Simple to setup.  Camera pictures are fair.  Digital zoom is not good. Only works in daylight, not for dim light.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Stephane Richard
Reviews.Content: I have 3 of these cameras. 2 of them are this model and the other has night vision. I've had them for well over a year now. They work pretty well. The video quality is so-so. Similar to that of a webcam. The audio isn't very good and cuts out a lot. It wouldn't work well to listen to conversations but does that job to hear a screaming/crying kid. Set up was easy however I can't for the life of me get it to work with a static ip. Keeping it on dynamic does the trick but I'd prefer to give it a static ip address. The Android software (mydlink app) again isn't great but is functional. I prefer to use icam to view the cameras. That way I can see all my cameras at once + webcams too. Overall I think this is a great camera FOR THE PRICE. At 50-60$, you get your money's worth. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Super buy and a real good little camera.
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Haltermon
Reviews.Content: I wanted this to monitor my weather station console on line and it works very well.  Had to work on the lighting for night time use but no problem.  The software is great and I use it on both the internet as well as the intranet behind my firewall.  Can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Terrible for wireless
Reviews.Author: Crompton
Reviews.Content: FRUSTRATING. Firmware updates were not working, wireless settings were a disaster. I couldn't get dlink to add the device...gosh, what a nightmare. I'm computer savvy and have set up plenty of wireless networks, devices and cameras, and this was the worst experience I've ever had. It arrived five hours ago and after four hours of cursing, yelling and frustration, I'm packin' it up and sending it back!  Trying to use the wireless on these cameras was impossible--maybe others have had better luck hardwired, but these weren't for me.

Reviews.Title: Fair camera for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Mason
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new one but I think it had been used.  I had to reset the sys admin password.  On new ones there are no passwords.  Also this one resets itself more that the 932L.

Reviews.Title: junk products
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It took several calls to tech service and 4 hours on the phone to get it to partially work, never got the motion detector to work.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Arson 91
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras last month, it seemed to work 'okay', so I orderdd 2 more. The 2 newest cameras never connected to my wifi and even when I connected ethernet hard wired, the cameras were unable to be added to my D-Link account with error messages always popping up. After almost 4 hours of trying a variety of different setups I decided it was time to pack them up and send them back. I have since ordered a different camera.

Reviews.Title: wireless bad
Reviews.Author: terry disheroon
Reviews.Content: wireless will not work two rooms a way from router had to run wire to room to make it work

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: flyfishNS
Reviews.Content: I tried the 930L on four different computers - three Macs and finally a Windows machine (because the tech support guy said he "couldn't help" with a Mac). The thing did not ever get installed. D-Link's solution was, after an hour on the phone, for me to take it back and get another one.So, in summary - I paid almost $90 to purchase a camera that cost me three or four hours of headache trying to get it set up, and then an hour with tech support, to finally be told "guess it doesn't work".Sorry - I'll take it back, but this is the fourth d-link product I've purchased in the last two years, and I have now learned my lesson, as I've been on tech support for every single one of those devices, and three out of the four didn't work (two right from the start and one after working for 2 weeks.) The rest of my electronic world works very nicely - and will continue you to as long as I repeat the mantra - "Don't buy a D-link product, don't buy a D-link procduct" !What a piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: D link Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Rufo
Reviews.Content: Once the unit is hooked to WIFI it works greatIf you lose power it automatically resets , so thats a good feature

Reviews.Title: uses outdated certificates = worthless
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: seems easy enough to set upbut unfortunately the certificates are outdated and deemed dangerous so I get warnings about thatalso it is completely impossible to get motion detection setup working since the image never loadsDo not buy this product. Look for something else that is actually working to set up and use as is advertised (motion detection)

Reviews.Title: Resolution and mobile compatibility
Reviews.Author: Norman Fung
Reviews.Content: I set this up on a PC.  It worked ok when using Chrome to view on my laptop, but had trouble with Firefox.Had trouble with the Mydlink Android App to view it on my Android phone (Virgin Mobile, LG Optimus Slider).Gave up after this since the resolution did not meet my requirements, anyway.Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: Worked at first, then white-out
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: 1. Setup was easy, based on several good posts here:- setup using direct network connection- no not use the dlink install wizard software- no not use the dlink install wizard software- log into the unit and fill in the forms- disconect the network cable and wifi connects- works great on my Kindle Fire HD using the free tinyCam monitor app- setup port forwarding on your router for remote access (portforward.com has step by step for most routers)- setup a dynamic dns service (my router uses dyndns.com)- login remotely using the provided url (mine is ~ "name-dyndns.com")2. Worked fine for about 2 weeks, then video suddenly became extremely bright/washed out. I have spotted two other posts here with the same issue. I am guessing the automatic gain control circuit went south. It was never pointed at the sun or bright lights.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: Works just the way it is supposed to work.  Can monitor it from smart phone or computer. Took about 30 min. to set up.

Reviews.Title: perfect, but took a while to setup with FTP &email;, port mapping etc.
Reviews.Author: nvjames
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this camera sets up pretty quickly if all you want is streaming video that you can view through your laptop or PC. However, documentation begins to fall short when it comes time to use the more advanced features such as email, ftp and port mapping to a public domain. mydlink.com makes it easier and fast but you don't have advanced control of the camera outside of your local network unless the port is mapped from your ISP IP and doing this could cary by router vendor. The motion detection is sensitive to sunlight so as the sun moves around your house sometimes you will get false positives based on the amount of sunlight in the detection area. I found a 60% sensitivity works pretty well except for at sunrise and sunset. The hardware is excellent and I would give this 4.5 stars if D-Link made the advanced features easier to setup or at least explained them in more detail in English. The manual is awful. Great value for price though and I'd most likely buy another. The iPhone (iOS) is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Can't get started
Reviews.Author: wbw
Reviews.Content: I'd be frustrated if the software in the setup program couldn't see the camera ... but it can't even see that my computer has a network connection.  In fact, I have both wired and wireless connections in my home, and I've used both and tried both with this Dlink software.  No luck.  The Dlink camera might be fine, but if I can't get it configured, it is a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent simple camera
Reviews.Author: Bronson Goddard "NewEnglander"
Reviews.Content: I've had one for almost a year and a half. I use it to remotely monitor a property. No problem setting it up.  It has been remarkably reliable.  The My-dlink site works well and I use both the Ios and Android apps (free!) daily.I use it wirelessly with no issues (I've recently changed from a Belkin router/wireless access point to the excellent ASUS RT-N66U router and it has performed flawlessly with both.Low light performance is not particularly good, but for the price this camera, with the supporting MyD-Link site/apps is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: decent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: briehl
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work like they claim. Easy to setup, but having only the white color is a huge dissapointment. Also, the app for the IPHONE seems to work ONLY if you are connected to wifi and in your own home. They claim it will work with 3g, and it does for about 6 seconds, then freezes up. Also, will not connect to wifi if you are out of your home.

Reviews.Title: Great device but install & configure was difficult
Reviews.Author: Angel Castillo
Reviews.Content: I now have the device working as I want. I love the mydlink app on iphone as I can see live video of the camera from anywhere I am, plus audio too.I also have set it to automatically email pictures of the viewed area to a special address. I could FTP them too but email is fine for now.So the device is great, but getting it to work properly, specially registering to mydlink was painful. The install CD had trouble with the wireless configuration a few times and them crashed when trying to register to mydlink. I eventually ignore the wireless wizard on the CD and connected to the device's own little web server to set up wireless. After that I went back to the wizard and skipped the wireless setup to register the device to mydlink. I wish there was another way to register devices to mydlink as I was concern the process for registering them from the CD would fail as the wireless setup had. But it didn't so that's good.So for about $60 I have live video from the camera, plus picture every 10 minutes. I'm definitely going to buy more. It's a great tool to have video from the office perimeter before I arrive to make sure it's all ok.However if you don't have networking knowledge I suggest getting a friend who knows so you can set it up for home or office monitoring as you could get frustrated. Well if you do get frustrated, please sell it to me :-)

Reviews.Title: good surveillance camera
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Andrade
Reviews.Content: It met the requirements for my needs. I was able to install this d-link camera in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Great for remote monitoring of property
Reviews.Author: Johnny Nimmons
Reviews.Content: Smooth and simple installation with easy plug & play set up.  Easy access by smart phone or computer and provides both video and audio.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Jerry Ottinger
Reviews.Content: the camera works fine wirelessy only in close proximity to the router. ihad to hard wire the camera I placed in a remote location fron the router.

Reviews.Title: Fairly decent IP Cam, with shortcomings
Reviews.Author: Thomas Simmons "Big Ugly Guy"
Reviews.Content: PROS:Easy to set up. Included wizard is intuitiveGood Rangeworks well with Ispy (Freeware)Dlink also has a "Cloud" viewerEASILY fits in small places. like between curtain and windowCONSvery poor night time viewing (Common to many IP cams)resolution of image lags other cams in this Price rangeSurprisingly narrow field of view at VGA resolutionI bought this to view my front door/walkway. I placed it in the front window, and it's small enough to be behind the curtain. It was important the camera had no onboard light, as the reflections would blind the camera at night. During the day, this camera will show anybody approaching and the motion sensor has activated each time. At night, one would need to have a 60 watt bulb in the porch light. It's easy to find a motion detector that screws into the porch light and then accepts standar bulbs (ccfl, etc) so the light wouldn't be on all night.. I found that this camera's field of view isn't as wide as I hoped, so will likely place this where the narrower angle and low light issues are mitigated.Bear in mind, this is a low cost IP camera. It would work GREAT for a baby monitor or places where a very wide field of view isn't required, more than the 90 degrees or so of this one.All in all, I would buy this camera again. While it has shortcomings FOR MY APPLICATION it would be a great cam for others.

Reviews.Title: not bad, but frame rate to low.
Reviews.Author: rgarza83
Reviews.Content: I didn't get this camera from amazon but just letting you know my experience. I think its an easy setup camera. The frame rate are at .5 at best, it should be way higher than that, even when its hard wired frame rate pretty slow. I can see the camera on my android phone which is good and you can even setup motion sensor, that sends u an email when it picks up something. <<well that feature is very sensitive mine picked up shadows from the time changing from the outside light so it works too well. You can also disable the LED light on there so no one know there a camera there. The microphone very good picks up everything. even on the phone view you can take screenshots and it saves on the phone.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: j lopez
Reviews.Content: works great!! just as the description.  this is my 5th camera and they continue to work great.  I also have the ir night one. it work great as well

Reviews.Title: DON'T DO THE FIRMWARE UPDATE!
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to monitor outside my house while I am away for the winter in florida.I placed the camera in a window looking outside.the set up was very easy and I had it working in about 30 minutes.the picture quality is pretty good.Not hd by any stretch but on the hole pretty good.the problems started when I did the sujested firmware up grade.while on line I was prompted to do a firmware update by the manufacturerer which I did.the camera has not worked properly since.After several hours on the phone with their tech support they were unable to fix the problem.I had to send the camera back for a full refund.the firmware on my camera was 1.03 when I went to 1.06 the problems started.moral of the story is I guess if you have a camera with firmware of 1.03 DON'T DO THE UP DATE! I have since purchased another d-link dcs 930l camera with 1.03 firmware and its worked perfectly for 30 days.I have refused to do the sujested update on this one.

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: humberto oliva
Reviews.Content: excellent camera!! works great with the WiFi connection, makes surveillance easy and affordable. Now I can check out my stores from my phone!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Fisher
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my home. The wireless disconnects occasionally, but you just need to be sure you have the camera within a reasonable distance from your wireless router. For the "budget" model, it's very nice. I appreciate that D-Link even makes a model like this, without the auto pan/zoom and night vision for example, for those of us not wanting to spend an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: Good value and easy set-up
Reviews.Author: backwoodsguy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to monitor my boat that is parked at my cottage for the winter and it does exactly what it advertizes. It is a simple and low quality audio and video device with some fairly primitive but effective software.The configuration worked great. It took me about 20 minutes to configure the system to work in wireless mode with my wireless router, another 10 minutes to configure for remote web based viewing and about 20 minutes to set up the scheduled email so I would get several emails per day. I think the reason I was able to configure so quickly is because I had already done this previously with my Panasonic camera and knew all the settings for the incoming and outgoing mail server and wireless setup. If you have all this information in advance it should go quickly.The physical setup was not quite as fast. The unit has no screw down points on the base and since the unit is thin plastic it is very light and will not stand on it's own because even the weight of the power cord is enough to pull it over. I made a wooden base and a simple clamping system with a few screws and washers to pinch the base of the camera to the wood. There is a limited range azimuth and elevation adjustment and that made it easy to point.The software is fairly limited and will only let you set up either scheduled emails or motion sensing but not both at once. My simple Panasonic BLC1 camera is about the same price range can do both and has much more feature rich software with multiple event possibilities so you may want to look into that option.The pictures are fairly low resolution but in this price range I would say perfectly acceptable.The website has always worked fine for remote viewing but will time out after about 10 minutes and you have to log in again. You can change the settings of the camera remotely which I find useful.I tried pulling the plug to see what would happen to the camera and I found that it lost the clock setting so this will present a problem if you are relying on scheduled emails.I have had the unit set up for a month now and the temperature has dropped to -5C (23F) and it is still working well.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Josh B. Bloom "movie guy"
Reviews.Content: I wish the field of view was bigger, but I can see what the camera sees from anywhere on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great Product...but....
Reviews.Author: S. Urquhart
Reviews.Content: Very, very easy to setup and use - had it up in just a few minutes...; immediately had to do a firmware upgrade which was also painless....  Used advanced settings to examine the motion sensors - after the firmware upgrade the motion sensors page fails to load with an error..Pretty interesting settings and utility and overall I think worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Web Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dan the Man
Reviews.Content: I have a total of 18 D-Link cameras that I use for my home security surveillance system.  I have everything from the old DCS-900 to the DCS-5300.  I now have added 5 DCS-930L cameras and I am very happy with the performance these units have for the money.  The upgraded software that comes with these cameras makes the configuration process a breeze.  Total time to confirgure the camera takes about 5 minutes.  The MyDLink Lite app on my IPhone is a great tool for quickly checking watching (and listening) to each of the DCS-930L cameras.  The color quality of these cameras are as good as some more expensive brands out on the market.  The only complaint I have would be the low light sensitivity is not as good as the older DCS-900.  I have mounted some of the DCS-930's outside under the eve of my roof and they hold up well to the outside weather here in Dallas Tx.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive way to have web accessible cameras to purchase the DCS-930L.

Reviews.Title: Not a reliable wireless connection, short life on the camera.
Reviews.Author: Reality
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up for wireless using WPA2, the WPS didn't work. The video quality wasn't bad for the price. However, the wireless connection dropped quite often and I would have to reset (power off and on) the camera. It was even more unreliable than my Foscam cameras, which I don't like either. After a few months the camera's video would get saturated (show a completely light screen) under fairly bright lighting conditions (inside, but the sun shinning in the house). Made in China, so you get what you pay for I guess. I would call mine a 4 month disposable wireless camera. I was disappointed that a company like D-link would put their name on such a product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup after a little bit of research
Reviews.Author: Steve Page
Reviews.Content: I have already setup a camera before on my home Verizon network, so it just took a bit of digging around to get these cameras to work with wireless. (I bought 3 of them)Steps to setup:1) plug in the camera with Ethernet cable2) run install from CD and choose wired3) Log into your mydlink account in a web browser4) select the camera and then click on "settings"5) click on "Advanced setting"6) click on "setup" and then "wireless setup"7) Click "enable"8) Click on "Site Survey"9) Choose your network and enter the password in the Key 1 field below. You may have to change the Encryption mode to 64 or 128 accordingly10) Click "Save Settings"11) Disconnect Ethernet cable and you should be ready to rock

Reviews.Title: Wireless signal is very weak
Reviews.Author: Ben Meek
Reviews.Content: I tried to like this product, I really did. The setup went smoothly, software and other tools (android app) worked nicely, but the wireless signal strength is just horrible. I had this camera one floor above my router and the signal was around 15%. Right next to my router it was 30%. Signal would drop out constantly where I wanted it. If I could have done an ethernet connection, I would have kept it, but instead it went back to Amazon, and replaced with a Foscam knockoff.

Reviews.Title: slow internet, still works
Reviews.Author: mommy loves
Reviews.Content: We have possibly the worst internet ever so I was worried about getting this camera.  Even with our poor internet, it still works fairly well!  It loses connection maybe once a day, but quickly turns back on.  Set up was very easy...you put the CD in, run the wizard and that is it!  The picture quality is ok (you see what you need to see).  We use it as a baby monitor and it does really well.  The only reason why it is 4 stars and not 5 is because the cord is only about 4ft long for the camera!  When you want to mount a camera (it even comes with mounting equipment), you typically mount it up high... unless you have 4ft ceilings, it isn't going anywhere.  That has been slightly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Admin Password change warning
Reviews.Author: Jack Azout
Reviews.Content: The DCS-930L works as advertised, but if you want to set it up manually using your browser instead of the wizard please note that if you attempt to change the admin password using the browser you will NOT be able to log in again and will need to reset the camera.  I went through this 3 times, thinking I had fat-fingered the password, but it turns out that the web interface has a bug.  If you use Windows, you can simply run the wizard from the included CD, change the admin password and then use the web interface for everything else.  If you use OS X, you need to download and run D-Link's MacUtility, which is found at [...].  Again, once you change the admin password via the utility, you can then do everything else via the web interface.  Besides that minor yet frustrating issue, the camera worked well for me, and I realize that most people will be unaffected since they will use the wizard.  Also keep in mind that you do not need to use the mydlink setup; if you know a bit about networking you can set the DCS-930L up manually for outside access via port forwarding.

Reviews.Title: Has a great Motion Detection
Reviews.Author: Chito Pono "Stay CazuaL"
Reviews.Content: I bought another unit because this unit has the capability to select portion of the screen to detect motion. This is a great feature because there are always motions on some parts of the image you want to detect not necessarily the entire image.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good!
Reviews.Author: Susan C. Carpenter
Reviews.Content: I bought and installed this for my stepdaughter and grandson who was born last week (Yayyyyy!!!).  We converted our upstairs to a suite and my office into a nursery.  The nice thing about that is that my office was set up for wired internet with the LAN plug right where my stepdaughter placed the crib!(I know, right?).  It found my network, and with the provided CD, walked me straight through a firmware upgrade for the camera, a java updates for the PC which included creating a name (email address) and password on dlink's website.  The video of the crib popped right up on my stepdaughter's PC which has Chrome, Firefox and IE9 (worked on all 3 browsers).  Next, I took our android phones and went to Play Store and downloaded mydlink lite.  Once again, after the name and password, we have video!  On the downside, the audio is very poor, with an audible buzz on the mobile phones (but not the PC).This is my stepdaughter's first child (and my first grandson, thank-you-very-much), and she is somewhat hyper-vigilant regarding any separation from him which I think is pretty normal.  This camera has provided her some comfort in that area as she can check him online as she does chores, cooks, etc.  For what we paid for this unit, we are very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This is good network camera because I can look at my dogs when they stay at home without any person.All features are working good. Only I can't save motion detection images on my computer which in the same LAN. This is working only with FTP server.

Reviews.Title: Seems good enuff ...
Reviews.Author: Bisdak SysOp
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these for a friend, for her small shop's cheap security. Setting up the 2nd one now, via its ethernet port (haven't tried wireless tho). Seems a breeze to install even if done manually (no need to go Wizards). I like how you can control Brightness/Contrast/Saturation. Set up an FTP service so I could test its FTP-upload functionality, seems to work. ++ on the frequency of uploads (e.g. interval of seconds), and the ability to create folders/subfolders and date/timestamp filenames, then set it up on an NTP service so it could update its time. Power is 110-220V auto (this matters to me) so you could plug it on wherever continent you are ;-) There's other features but the ones I mentioned are the ones I needed so I can't comment on them.Default firmware was 1.03. Updated it to 1.06. Screen says takes 140s (are they fans of the twitter-140-char-limit?:-p) to do so, and did exactly that.My only qualm is the images do not contain the date and timestamps but you can do away w/ this w/ their YYMMDDTIMESTAMP folder/subfolder/filename scheme.Happy w/ it ;-)

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Set up was so easy. I am comcast customer, so my router had a WPS button. I don't think it took me longer than 3 minutes and I was able to easy to get it set up and test it. I think I am going to buy ateast one more. I am kicking myself for not buying one of these sooner. Awesome purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good item so far
Reviews.Author: Romans134
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to use as a security device for our home while we are away. For the price, it does what I need it to do. Unfortunately, it is not outdoor rated so it limits where you can place it but it definitely does the job.The PLUG AND PLAY, ZERO CONFIG feature is NOT up to par. I spent about one hour with the free tech support trying to get this up and running. The instructions say that all you really need to do is hit the WEP on your router and the link button on the camera itself and you're good to go. WRONG! I ended up having to install/reinstall the CD about 5 times and TECH support had to help me set up IP address's so the camera would 'talk' to the router. I am not an expert on these things but I think I'm pretty competent but this was way too complicated for something that states it is user friendly. Of course the TECH support is a call center with reps that barely speak English so that was fun.It is a decent item for my needs especially since you can download the free iPhone/iPad app and monitor it away from home. You can also view the camera feed on any web browser once you set up your account. Some reviewers mentioned no audio but I can get audio on the web and my App.  Just be prepared to spend a lot of quality phone time with TECH support to install it properly.

Reviews.Title: This is OK.
Reviews.Author: skp
Reviews.Content: This is OK for this price, there is no sound. It doesn't work when there is no light or it is dark.. ....

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and does the job.
Reviews.Author: Elpablo
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd D-link wireless camera I have purchased. I set one up for my parents and the other 2 at my house. One looking out into the front of my house thru the glass panel of my garage door. I did not use the IR camera because the IR reflects back on glass panel and blinds the camera. The second, night vision capable, is installed in the backyard under my porch.Easy to install and setup to send me pics via email when motion is detected. Read some of the reviews by others and it helped greatly with setup. Will be adding cameras inside the house once baby arrives instead of buying a baby monitor since it transmits sound too.Would give 5 stars if it was weatherproof, so 4 stars for now.

Reviews.Title: Great little IP camera
Reviews.Author: John F "Interested Investor"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as my initial entry into IP cams.  It has a good picture and was easy to set up.  For what it is and the price it really a good camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "D"
Reviews.Content: easy set-up, good picture, I can access picture from my Android phone, so far so good. Would definately recommend. Would get the night vision version if I needed it, but this one is good enough for my needs

Reviews.Title: A lot of IP camera for a little money
Reviews.Author: pbug56 "Photobug"
Reviews.Content: Now keep in mind that this is not an expensive product.  It has its limits.  And it is a BIT of a pain to setup.  Hey - I spent about an hour getting it going.  I'll start with the bad;1. WPS setup did not work; I had to first get it online via wired Ethernet and connect to it with a browser to setup the wifi.  Shouldn't be, but I've never had much luck with WPS anyway.  No big deal.2. Default audio settings are VERY LOUD.  BEWARE the loud feedback and noise.  Easily dealt with by going into audio setup either via mydlink.com or direct control or the android program.3. It's not what you call hi res.  Nor did I expect it to be.  It is standard VGA.  You want more - pay more.4. Doc's aren't the best; but on the other hand I've seen a lot worse.  Just have some patience.5. Couldn't find anything in the docs on the android program that goes with it.  Again, no big deal; type in dlink, check the FREE ones that come up. One will be right and it will list this unit as compatible.I have not yet tried in in low light, will when I can.  I also intend to use it remotely when away from home.What I like!1. Really not hard to setup.2. A decent image for what it is.3. Once you get Java, etc. installed, pretty easy to use both on mydlink.com and on a local browser and on the android software.4. Exactly what I want maybe inside the house when I'm away, or looking out the driveway when home and I need to see what's going on outside.5. The built in web server is rather cool and easy to use once you get Java working.  Active X doesn't seem to work; probably blocked in the browser.6. I like the idea that it can be set as a security camera to detect motion and send emails to get your attention.I'm still exploring it, will eventually update this review.

Reviews.Title: Motion Detection Didn't Work at first
Reviews.Author: tbarkermn
Reviews.Content: The main reason I bought this camera was for the motion detection feature.  Unfortunately, that feature does not work.  Everything else seems to work fine.  I was able to configure the motion detection settings in the advanced configuration however the camera itself doesn't seem to respond to motion, even with sensitivity setting cranked up.  Junk!UPDATE:  Shortly after posting this review the motion detection started working magically.

Reviews.Title: Video is good, but sound is horrible
Reviews.Author: Rosemary J White
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a nanny cam and so far it's serving its purpose. It was a breeze to set up and the video quality is decedent. There is a slight delay sometimes but it could be my wifi hookup. The sound is terrible though, you can't hear anything but static, so if you are hoping for good sound quality, consider another camera.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED changed my mind
Reviews.Author: RedDevil
Reviews.Content: 10/22/2013 updated review:Never could get a total of 4 cameras to work in my small home. Also, the D-Link software is horrible. Had my ISP folks out testing and found the camera (1 or 3, didn't matter), pulled 3/4 of my internet service. They continually booted up my internet service and whatever it was, this software pulled 3/4 of the service. You can imagine how useless a service can be with that much dedicated to one system. No surfing the net. No game stations. Bah-humbug. I emailed the techs and they told me 'D-Link software is what it is'. However, the 3 cameras I use work wonderfully.12/2012 updated review:Added 3 cameras.Very good image. Video a bit clunky, but could be my internet too slow. With Dview software I've used the motion sensing, email, scheduling (motion and constant video) all without problem. Still no valuable sound. Mine is just static at any volume setting. I installed 3 cameras for my daughter and her sound works fine. Perhaps it is hit-n-miss with the 930-L?8/2012 original review:As long as the user is familiar with how to access their router admin site to activate the wireless search for the camera (most have a default IP & password of 'admin'-check your documentation), the camera fires right up as easily as advertised. I've only just gotten it so have pecked around with the advanced features (motion, email, etc.) very little and they seem to work fine. Maybe I need to work more with the sound feature (although there is only a volume function), but the sound is completely worthless. It's not an issue for my use, but isn't a feature to brag about. I've ordered 3 more. Also, setting up mydlink.com for viewing online was a piece of cake.

Reviews.Title: Reboot often
Reviews.Author: rejedejo
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a year and if I haven't rebooted it recently it probably isn't working.  I have it set up to FTP to my d-link dns 323, which works pretty good when it works.  But then it needs rebooting so often, and I can't get the NTP service to work so everytime it reboots it makes another 1/10/10 folder, unless I set the date manually.  I also can't get it to email out, probably because I can't run it, don't know enough to set it up....  This on doesn't have any lighting, IR or otherwise and in dim conditions the pictures are worthless.  This one is less troublesome than some other 'big name' brands that I've tried, so in general, it's okay, I'll buy another., I would give it 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.

Reviews.Title: Can't Stream Well via WIFI
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the wireless streaming, however it will not stream continuously over WiFi.  I had software monitoring the video feed and it would drop out intermittently. It works much better when wired, but if it's wired you can probably find a better camera too.

Reviews.Title: Easy!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A. Coulter "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera a few weeks before our second child was born to monitor her during sleep time. I had no issue whatsoever setting it up with my Apple Time Capsule and then moving it into their room wirelessly (minus the power plug which is needed to power the device). It has been a real blessing to have this, as we can check on our daughter on our computer, iphone or ipad. The picture is clear and the sound is great. This is well worth the money, in fact we are thinking about getting another for an additional angle in their bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Works well, a bit of a challenge to setup the wireless connection
Reviews.Author: M. Katona "mkjava"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to get this after all of the issues I've read in the reviews, but decided to go for it any way as it's not very expensive.  I have a Mac and downloaded the beta Mac setup program from the D-Link site, and it worked like a charm to setup the camera.  The camera had to be plugged into the router for the setup, I could not do this wirelessly.  Once I got it running with a wired connection, I wanted to set it up wirelessly.  My Verizon FIOS router does not have a WPS button, so I couldn't configure it via that method.  I went into the advanced settings of the camera configuration where it allowed me to search for my wireless network and input the access key.  I encountered a problem where my network used a 10 character WEP key and the camera insisted on a 13 character key.  The only workaround I could find was to change the security method on the router to WPA instead (which is more secure anyway).  After that, I was able to enter the WPA key in the camera settings and the wireless connection worked like a charm.  Of course I then had to change the wireless key settings on all my devices, but not too big of a deal.  All in all the camera is working exactly the way I wanted it, an easy way to check in on the house while I'm away.  A little effort on the wireless setup, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough for small area with my 8 watt led light (40 watt equivalent)
Reviews.Author: Riky
Reviews.Content: Bought one from Frys tried for 2 days and returned it cause Amazon is way cheaper and Amazon was not on their list to beat internet prices,Ordered 2 so this is the third time setting it up but could not set it up using "wps" on my Dlink DIR-605L router. Patience is the name of the game here. Followed the instruction on the manual and installed both for half a day. Why? Im using Comodo Internet Security and Malwarebytes and it seems they prevent me from finishing the installation and no pop up whatsoever to let you know what's going on.I tried with my other computer with other Antivirus and same thing so i stopped all my  antivirus,firewall,etc,and everything works. Same set-up for both cameras and i use gmail account for notification since the manual used gmail as an example make sure one email address per cam or only one cam would send a notification. I tried mydlink inside and outside my network with Pc,Ipod touch and Galaxy tab 2 7inch no problem at all.I'm using Ip Cam viewer basic mostly on my Galaxy tab within my network cause i can see both cams at the same time but no sound with this free app and almost no lag compare to mydlink, i havent tried outside my network yet.This is the easiest set up for me compared to my other dlink dcs-2100+ that i used 6 years ago plus extra monthly to access camera outside my network.Update:So far so good>>I bought this to monitor our apartment while we're on vacation to Reno,use the hotel internet and i was able to see whats goin on in our apartment pretty cool.I forgot to mention when setting up your dlink camera be careful not point it in your face the wall would be better.I forgot to reset the one i bought from Frys and somebody bought it and i can see his face showed up on my email alert while he was setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Works well with proper illumination
Reviews.Author: The Mighty Quinn
Reviews.Content: The camera has pretty good range even through structures. We've had good luck with distances up to around 100 feet. With enough daylight or artificial light, picture quality is good. For the price this is good value, and I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice video quality and quick setup
Reviews.Author: X
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I was nervous about purchasing this camera. I decided to go for it, and couldn't be happier. Installation and setup was complete in about 15 minutes. My camera is now running wirelessly, I can view it on my PC and on my iPhone. My router doesn't have the WPS button, but that wasn't a problem at all. I was able to set it up very quickly and easily. I'm no genius either. All it took was the correct router password and following the guide on the setup CD that came in the box. I'd highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Never stay connect
Reviews.Author: H. Le "TheInvestor"
Reviews.Content: Quality of the camera is fine but the unite never stay connected to WiFi and very difficult to have it connect.  I had the 932L model it is a breezy.  Not recommend this model.  Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: Cameras do the trick.
Reviews.Author: G. Green
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to monitor our primary home in Texas while we spend the summers in Colorado.  I was skeptical of the cameras because of the price.  They arrived two days before we left and I had no idea of the time factor for installing them.  I placed one camera on our patio to monitor the rear of our house and the other to monitor the living room.  Both cameras connected wirelessly to our router without problems. In Colorado, we are able to monitor our home by computer and iPhone.  The quality of the images is very good and several of my Colorado friends, who also flee the Texas heat in the summer, are planning to purchase Dlink cameras to monitor their primary homes.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised - so far so good!
Reviews.Author: S. Reynoso "bitwise"
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a simple to set up and use surveillance camera that I could install on my home network.I settled on this D-Link camera because it seems to have the best documentation available online.Just finished installing it and am happy to report it WORKED on the first try, right out of the box.  It even prompted me to upgrade the firmware, which I did nervously, and it completed successfully!  You need to be patient though as it takes about 5 minutes and does not display a progress bar.I should point out that I went with an ethernet-based installation (as opposed to wifi).  The wifi setup experience may be completely different (probably more complicated I'm guessing).Also, I have not tried viewing from outside my private network.Based on what I have seen so far, I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: cdixon
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these camera they work great for checking up on your house when away.  I will say they are hard to set up at first but once they are you are good to go.  You can use a Dlink app to see live feeds from your iphone or ipad. I plan on buying more in the future to cover more of my house.  Great cheap camera with good quality picture.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't network properly
Reviews.Author: Ernie Sharp
Reviews.Content: The camera will not connect wirelessly, using WPS, or any other method. I tried it with three different routers. It only connects by hardwire. The software requires the use of ActiveX controls, and the wizard could not install them. This means that the camera is worthless. Do not buy. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. It works great. I bought 2 of them. Since they don't swivel, I bought 1 to cover each entry point of my home.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update required!
Reviews.Author: rteder "rteder"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that "just works," keep looking.The biggest shortcoming of the device is that it will periodically demand of you; "firmware upgrade required!"  I foolishly did so the first time, which turned it into a brick.  D Link, after much cajoling, did replace this, but you are still out the hour plus of time such events always consume. We cannot rule out that I did something wrong, but I am an electrical engineer who develops products with firmware for a living, so I doubt it.So, not every time I log on it nags me: "Firmware Update Required!", but I click "Remind Me Lator", as I do not want to turn it into a brick.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but......
Reviews.Author: mizzoutiger
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera mainly because it is fairly inconspicuous looking. And secondly, because it has a zoom feature.  Well, one out of two isn't bad.  The zoom feature is pretty useless, but perhaps I expected too much for the price. Setup for the camera was pretty easy.  I don't think the monitoring software is very user friendly (too many steps involved). However, I am able to monitor the camera using the existing app on my android phone and that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: For the money its not a bad buy
Reviews.Author: Scooter Kat "Scooter"
Reviews.Content: For the money its not a bad buy . Like others have said the camera resolution is not the best .Turning up the resolution gives you a decent picture quality . If your home router has a  WPS button installation is a breeze . Took me about 20 minutes to get two cameras online .

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: GWG
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to keep an eye on the office and house while traveling.I had to call customer support on both cameras for the set up.The cameras will not track a person walking across the room when they are connected via wifi.The cameras need a lot of light to be useful. Lamp light from another room that you can see to walk around by will not do the job.For the price they are good.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up. Motion detection isn't perfect.
Reviews.Author: PLH
Reviews.Content: Camera was easy to set up using the WPS on my Trendnet router.  Just push the button on the camera and the button on the router and it was connected.  Purchased the camera with the purpose of emailing photos when motion is detected.  Setting up the email is fairly easy, but finding motion detection settings that work during daylight hours and night(with plenty of lighting) is impossible.  I have to either turn on and off the email function, or change the sensitivity twice a day. Many purchasers have requested a software mod that would allow the email function to be turned on and off based on the time of day, but it hasn't happened.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: AmazonGuy
Reviews.Content: The wireless range is terrible. Totally unusable inside the house 15-20 feet away(different rooms). The setup is really easy and the camera is very easy to use. The image quality at its best is still pretty bad... 2 starts for a low quality camera but yet easy to use

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel P Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera to view a robins nest in my backyard. It's located under an eave, so it's protected from the elements. The camera is mounted about 6 inches from the nest and I am very satisfied. The camera is located about 30 feet from my wireless router, and there is a 16" think stone wall, plus 2 windows between them. The camera streams live continuously. There are occasional pauses in the stream for buffering. The audio is acceptable. I can hear planes flying overhead, and birds chirping. It's not hifi, but acceptable for the price point. It's not a rugged device, and is designed for indoors. It only works in daylight, and the mydlink portal works great.

Reviews.Title: Does nothing it says it does.
Reviews.Author: Ruth "Urth81"
Reviews.Content: Its supposed to connect on your wireless network with just the push of a button, but it never would.  Even when I followed the more complex instructions I came up short.  I'm not a computer guru, but I know my way around a keyboard and finally just had to find a place that had a ethernet cord.As for the video feed, I have an iPhone and an iPad and both aps just shut down every 1-3 minutes for no reason.  I've done updates, I've re-installed and it will not work.  So then I try to go online to use their site.  There it tells me that a java update needs to happen to see video, even after I've just updated everything like they asked.  I can not get a working video from the darn thing.Spend a few extra bucks and get something that is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Wireless
Reviews.Author: rgyulee
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 DSC-920 Camera for a few years now, both running 24/7 outside and they have been great.  So I wanted to add a few new cameras and have the ability to monitor them with my smartphone and the MyDlink app. So I ordered 2 DSC-930L and have run them (indoors) for about 3 months and they have been fine.  Today I decided to move one to my closed in porch to replace one of my 920's.  Well the 930L would not connect to my wireless system.  I tried both of my 930L cameras and neither would connect.  I had them setting right next to the connected 920 camera.  I checked the wireless strength on the 920 and had 66%, I connected a network cable to the new 930L so I could check its wireless strength and it as 10%.  Now I am not pushing it with distance here, this camera is only 25 feet from my wireless router.So if you expect to use wireless to connect to your camera and your more than 20 foot away from your router/access point don't bother with theses 930L models (or the 932L which also does have any distance).  My older DSC-920 cameras are about the same size as the newer 930L, but the older 920's have a 3 inch antenna on them where the 930L does not.  While the HTML interface on both the 920 and the 930L looks the same, the MyDlink Site will not recognize my two 920's.I have been a faithful user of DLink products for years, but I am disappointed with the new 930L and 932L cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Silver M "mhk1999"
Reviews.Content: Got two of these to watch my deteriorating dog while I was at work and while on vacation when a sitter watched my dog. It was comforting to be able to physically see the dog and be sure he was safe. The camera was relatively easy to set up wirelessly and works perfectly. As the view gets farther from the camera it blurs up a little but is still viewable. When our power went out, the camera came back up automatically after the power was restored.

Reviews.Title: Works great and REALLY easy to connect.
Reviews.Author: Luis D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I had one of this camera already in use at my home and needed an extra one for the back porch, I bough a second one. Easy to install and picture is not too big but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: good but does have some issues
Reviews.Author: Jacob S. "Suade907"
Reviews.Content: I gotta say I'm kind of impressed. In a bright room the image quality is fantastic. In low light it's just so so. On mine audio was disabled by default and the resolution was set to 320x240, but it's easy enough to sign in to the IP address and tweak the settings.  I did notice however the audio is pretty bad, it's crackly and cuts in and out on most of my devices. Also the android app is pretty bad. The free app only gets you 60 seconds of video at a time and crashes often. There is a pay version but reviews state it's buggier than the free version although I have not tried it yet. For the money I'd buy a couple more if I had the change.Edit: 5-21-2012. I bought two more cameras over the weekend. They are all setup now. I have to say the camera mounts are pretty nice. I was able to mount one under my kitchen cabinets with no trouble whatsoever. The mount comes apart and has a spot for small screws and then you can just flip the camera if mounting upside down. The camera pc configuration while painless does take a little while. But it's so well done I have no complaints. Once again I had to go in and crank the video up to 640x480, no biggie though.I bought the android pay app. For my tablet it's a great app giving you multiple camera views but with only one active at a time. It works very well and you can even take snapshots. On my phone though the pay app needs some work. I cannot go full screen, it fills half the screen and then fills the other half with your other cameras. They need to fix that. You should be able to go full screen. But overall I'm very happy and have a easy way to check in on my kids while they are being watched by their grandma.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Abhilash Kushwaha
Reviews.Content: I was actually impressed by how easy and painless the setup was. All I had to was pop in the CD and everything worked fine. I was actually able to set it up using wireless, which was a pleasant surprise since most of products I have seen usually need wired connection set up. I use it with Blue Iris software to record the stream to my PC and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Easy Set-up
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This was really easy to set-up.  I initially configured the camera wired and then set-it up using my wifi.  It isnt the best quality video but I only needed it for an overview of the house.  The ability to view via a cell phone or computer was excellent and easy and the audio is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: Cannot set motion sensor alert on a schedule
Reviews.Author: Office User
Reviews.Content: I got this IP camera for home security when I am at work. Unfortunately its firmware does not support setting a schedule for its motion sensor alert feature. You have a choice of either motion sensor on at all times (even while you are at home), or send you pictures on a schedule at fixed intervals (when nothing is going on.) They need to marry the 2 features together so the unit can be of some real use.Besides that major shortcoming, the unit works great and easy to access with Android, Iphone and PCs.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup - Droid App results Spotty
Reviews.Author: Kevin White "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: I found this easy to set up and get working on the network (I hard -wired it).  It looked great on the computer, but I really wanted to use it on my Droid phone.  The results were so so over 3G.  Sometimes it was OK but sometimes it just showed a blank screen.  I would say it is fine for using as a camera to view from a computer, but perhaps not ready for prime time on a Droid yet - may have been due to cell coverage though so may work better for you.

Reviews.Title: Horrible service, makes me think horrible company.
Reviews.Author: August
Reviews.Content: So I just bought this camera.  After a little trouble I was able to get it to connect via a wireless connection to my home network and see video on my PC.  Could never get it to work remotely, either by setting up a D-Link account or using port forwarding.  This was the whole reason I bought the cam.There is absolutely no reason I should have had to waste 2 hours of my time on the phone with an under qualified support person.  I'll do my best to never buy a D-Link product again, and this cam is going back to the store tomorrow whether or not I can get a refund.I think the high point was that after explaining I had a desktop computer and the camera was connected to my home network via a wireless connection, I had to emphasize that no, my desktop did not have to have a wireless connection even though the camera was communicating using wireless technology.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...Not so great setup...
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these 8 months ago and setup was a breeze and performance has been flawless.  Bought two more and had a great deal of difficulty in getting them to work wirelessly.  Finally figured out that they had to be set up as wired and then changed to wireless in the Advanced settings on MyDlink.com...not difficult, but maybe more than the average non-techie would be comfortable with.Buy accordingly.Update (12/25/2012): We now have seven of these around our Lakehouse. Rarely have any trouble with connectivity...however, updating the firmware is a pain because they have to be done manually one at a time...from a wired connection.Also, we have two of them outside under the eaves of the house...never had any difficulty with them being exposed to the heat and cold.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work at first, but it worked later
Reviews.Author: Hello
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat tech savvy person, but I had issues with this camera.Auto-magically, the issues were gone and it works now, and I love it.Cons - The setup is bit confusing. I connected the camera to my router and went to the web address and it worked in wired mode. I configured the wireless while it was connected and it didn't work once i unplug the Ethernet from back of the camera. So I popped in the CD, and went through the setup, and same thing, it worked wired, but not wireless. after about 4 or 5 setup runs it worked. Not really sure what happened. I have Fios wireless router, that may have been issue. not sure.The final steps to make it work - i re-started the process, reset the camera from the back (there is a tiny button, hold it with a safety-pin till it goes from green to red and resets it self) Popped the CD, followed the steps. manually went to the ip address of the camera and created the wireless setup there. unplugged it from the router and it power cycle and it worked. I'm not really sure what didn't work earlier and what worked later.- I did sign up for [...] and checked it out and it works.- Also, have it on the iPhone app, $4.99 which is ridicules. It's a tiny picture, can't use the whole screen of the iPhone to view the picture. there may be a way to do it, I haven't found it yet. Also, ATT 3G is very slow, so unless you've got wifi the video is more like blur images. over the wifi, it works good. Don't waste the money, just sign up for free mydlink and you'll be able to log in from any pc, haven't tried on iphone that way yet.- this is my 2nd wireless camera, i have the older linksys wireless g camera, the picture quality is better in this one. i don't use my linksys anymore, i only used that for about 2 weeks.- I haven't tired the other features yet. For now it's got video, and i can log-in and see what's going on.Cons - the setup could have been simpler. when i first installed my Linksys, there was a chat button and they walked me through, it was nice. I wish D-link would do the same. I still don't know why it didn't work the first time.Pro - so far I like it a lot. it does what i need it to do. I will need 1 or 2 more, and I may buy the same or the newer/higher models in future. Night vision is not needed for this setup, but for the next one I may need to go for a higher model for night vision.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Easy setup
Reviews.Author: R. Martin
Reviews.Content: This camera is well built and has good functionality. It is easy to get set up and working. I have this one and the night vision version.

Reviews.Title: Sleepless nights
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Poteet "Rockdweller"
Reviews.Content: I usually limit my electronic devices to one sleepless night.  I think of my self as average savvy when it comes to electronics but this little critter is a nightmare.  The setup disc is pretty straight forward but it only goes so far.  I had a video stream within just a few moments but it turned out to be not much more than a web cam.  No wireless to my router.  No settings of any kind on dlink. No motion detection.  Nothing.  So all I can say is take these reviews like a grain of salt and take your chances but just beware that a lot of us do have problems.  If the setup disc worked as advertized than this would be a breeze but believe me it didn't work that way.  It's on it's way back today and I'm sure I'll be cautious of any security camera after this experience.  I'll stick to game cameras for my security.I must admit that I never tried to get any support from the company on this but than why should you have to go thru someone else to set up something that should be simple enough anyway.  And I understand that you have to pay for air time on product support?  That's a bummer!I actually feel bad to give products a bad rating but at the same time I don't like to see people throw their money out there for products that aren't as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: SM
Reviews.Content: Very good product for this price, except for the night mode is not supported.I still do not understand how to set up a motion detector.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Mack69pa
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product a week ago and it works great. I found it was easy to get hooked up. I believe the bad reviews are mostly because of who was setting them up. LOL Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Affordable and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: PDot4
Reviews.Content: An affordable wireless security cam. Setting up the WIFI and on-line viewing is simple.  I am very pleased with the first one and may purchase a few more for the entire house.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I purchased a few of these to monitor a pet during the day, and they work great, both with the computer and the iphone.

Reviews.Title: Once setup - its not bad
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A.
Reviews.Content: I had quite a bit of difficulty setting this up, even following the directions explicitly AND using a D-link Branded router. Tech Support was able to make some online changes and it finally connected. Once setup it works fine. The picture is better than expected but still not perfect. I mainly used it to keep an eye on some new puppies and also will use it when using a pet sitter that is not my regular one, just to ensure I know when they come and go.Cheap plastic, so be careful with it.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: JamesGH "itzhak37"
Reviews.Content: Camera would send pictures to my e-mail account when it sensed motion, but it would not stream live - on my Chrome, Firefox, Safari or iPhone app, inside or outside the same wireless network, and I could not wirelessly access the camera settings. When I disconnected and reconnected the power supply, the problem would be solved for another 5 minutes. This problem existed both before and after I updated the firmware.I cannot imagine the issue was distance from the router, as the camera and router were fewer than 5 feet apart, with no obstructions.I suppose I could try all the work around measures mentioned in the D-Link forums, but I bought this D-Link product because it was user friendly. When the ease of use disappeared, so did the value of the product.Camera on its way back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Can't Get it To Connect Wirelessly
Reviews.Author: Candace M. Decou
Reviews.Content: Am on my second item after first return of this and we cannot get it connected wirelessly.  It works well enough with the LAN cable, but I wanted wireless, so for now I have to give this a less-than-satisfied rating.  Tech Support helped the first time but said to return it.  Second item responds exactly like the first and I have not re-contacted Tech Support for help yet. I don't think anything is wrong with the unit, I believe it's something screwy with my W7 setup that I haven't figured out yet.  So I am basically still in the process of trying to figure out how to get it set up correctly.

Reviews.Title: Works ok so far
Reviews.Author: Chuck G
Reviews.Content: I setup two of these today. Setup was fairly easy, but I'm a techno-geek. Mostly just followed the directions. So far I've got them externally viewable, including through the mydlink lite android app, and have played a bit with recording video using the D-ViewCam app.Plusses:The picture wasn't bad.Seems to be decent set of software that is included.Easy setup.Wired connection works well and provided fairly smooth videoMinuses:The jury's still out on wireless. I have one camera about 30 feet away going through a couple walls. The connection drops frequently and motion is very jerky. Perhaps the wireless network is too busy, my wife could be watching videos upstairs on her laptop. Fortunately, I have lots of cat-V wires pulled to various locations in the house in case I need to go the wired route.Followup review 2013/06/11I decided not to bother with wireless for these cameras. As I mentioned originally, I have lots of cat v runs in the house, so I've got all these hardwired to the network.I've played a bit with email alerts to confirm they work.More significantly, I am now feeding these into ZoneMinder running on a Ubuntu Linux server. I'm not too far into the setup yet, but everything's going well. I have 4 930L and one 932L cameras connected to ZoneMinder. I have a subset of them set to detect motion and record, working great. I still have more ZM setup to do, but so far the combo of low priced D-Link cameras coupled with FREE ZoneMinder and FREE Linux on a several generation old PC is working well.

Reviews.Title: Up and running with video on my iphone in less than 15 minutes
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was hesitant to buy this product.  I am a techy and can get most things to work but hate the hassle.  Since it was a Gold Box deal I decided to purchase and give it a try.  From the time I inserted the CD into my computer until I was watching video on my iphone was less than 15 minutes.  My 10 year old daughter could easily have successfully setup this product without any problems.  Just follow the CD exactly and you will have no issues.  The App works great on the iphone and picture quality is similar to what you would see on skype or facetime.  Not great quality but good enough to see just about everything.  If this shows up again as a Gold Box deal I will without hesitation buy another.

Reviews.Title: Dreadful
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Slow, slow, slow, slow. Did I mention it was slow? It does not matter how fast your internet connections are (mine are lightning fast) or if you are on a phone with 4g speed. It takes at least one minute to load the image, then it times out after one minute, even if you have UPNP configured on all your routers. It just does not work the way it is advertised. Very frustrating. I am going to sell this on ebay then spend the extra $20 for a professional grade wireless security camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Shadowclown
Reviews.Content: Good inexpensive camera. If you are saving directly to a network HDD (NAS) it does not save video, just a series of jpg images. Poor low light performance.

Reviews.Title: Nice remote cam
Reviews.Author: Joseph W. Burkart
Reviews.Content: Received cam and had a minor problem setting up, but with a call to customer service, I was up and running in a very short time.  I have had it for a couple of weeks and so far, (except for light levels) it works great on both my android telephone and my laptop. The light sensitive issue is only a problem if you need to point it outside, works very well inside.

Reviews.Title: If you have a Mac, I have a secret ;)
Reviews.Author: SheilaE
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to go with the iCam app on my iPhone.  Had no idea if it would work, but it was the weekend, and I had time. The box told me it would work with a Mac.  The disk that came with it, however- was ALL PC :(I googled for help.  On the first page of results, I saw that D-Link had nicely placed a 5 minute video for using on a Mac system on YouTube! Yes!!!The only error I made afterwards was not placing my wireless key into the browser when it came up (I'm not too technical, I didn't realize that's what it wanted) otherwise- downloading the Mac installer, step-by-step instructions- it was awesome.I was able (using the iCam's excellent forums, which are chock full of data) to get it to run on my iPhone and iPad, along with my iMac's built in camera, using the iCam app. No audio, though -iMac is running snow leopard (don't know about Lion with this); iPhone is AT&T; with an IP starting with 166 (read the iCam forums).  I'm a happy camper! 2 camera security system in my pocket for the price of this camera, and a $5 app. Of course- when the sun goes down, unless a thief turns on all the lights, it's useless-Good luck!!!!  I'm saving for at least one night vision camera, too.

Reviews.Title: Entry Level Network Cam
Reviews.Author: D. Howard
Reviews.Content: I bought this in the last lightning deal so ive had it for a few months now and I will say it's a decent product for the level they are labeling it. This means you get a no frills type of network cam.For one I never did get the "My Dlink" service to work (didn't want to anyway) and did give it a shot, but the software never wanted to recognize my camera. Because of this I set it up the way I was going to anyway which is manually and not using the dlink website at all; that process took a little bit of trial and error simply because they don't really give any instructions on not using their software (fair enough).I use this mostly for watching my dog while at work and bought two and once they are configured they work great for the basic needs im using them for; you can get sound although it won't pick up any subtle noises, it will get things like barking or howling (which I found my dog does apparently when not happy).The image quality is decent also, in a nicely lit room you can get very good detail on the cam and the FPS is pretty good if you have a good signal. I am planning on purchasing more devices to place around the house and possibly outside as these are cheap enough to be useful. Would not recommend for low light situations whatsoever as they do not have a large enough sensor and also no infrared or any of that kind of stuff.Overall I give it a 7 as it does everything stated and is a good jumping point to get started.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised
Reviews.Author: A. Goodman
Reviews.Content: this was pretty easy to set up.  Did have to install ActiveX and Java, however, once all that was finished it works as described.  I did not have to call tech support to get it working.  Thinking about buying another one.

Reviews.Title: Easy install with very cool functionality
Reviews.Author: S. Snell
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to monitor my house while I am away.  This is my first security camera to install and use.It's very easy to set-up and add to an existing home network.  It takes about 5 minutes to plug in and launch the installation CD to complete the initial set-up.  However, since most home wireless networks utilize internal (private) IP Addresses, if you want the video viewable from outside your home network, it requires additional technical work.  Another reviewer provides detailed information on how to allow the assigned camera IP address to be accessible from *outside* the home network.  Basically, it requires forwarding to the camera's assigned IP address.Coolness factor:1) The camera links to an account you create on mydlink.com where the camera image can be viewed and controlled.2) Additionally, there is a smart phone app (mydlink Lite) so you can view your camera(s) and take snapshots.3) Finally, if motion is detected, you can easily configure the camera to email snapshots when motion is detected.Note - these are provided at no additional cost.Overall, inexpensive, very easy to install (with medium-level wireless technical knowledge), user friendly interfaces, accessible from outside the network.  Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: John Coleman
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to keep an eye on the cat while I'm gone. Also got the Dlink 655 wireless N router (has UPnP) which works well with the camera.  Camera works fine for live viewing while on a trip - using my laptop or Android phone.Not sure I'll use the motion detector or email/FTP features since it tends to send a lot of email/pictures.

Reviews.Title: Bulls Eye
Reviews.Author: John Piquette "John P"
Reviews.Content: I turned off the audio, don't need. Its new so cannot talk about reliability but assume it will be good with D-Link as its name. Did not call tech support either.The rest, PERFECT...... Great size, incredibly well poackaged, so easy to set up, test and install wirelessly, The stand was adequate for its purpose. Needed to buy an extension cord for the power supply as the standard is 4 feet and it should be 6 to 8 but no one has that.The price, the best...... For nice, simple easy security this camera hits it out of the ball park.I just wish the email set up was easier but all else was simple and easy if you follow the instructions and write down information along the way so you have it there for the future.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cost Effective IP Camera
Reviews.Author: North2AK
Reviews.Content: I like the camera.  Its small size and wireless functionality make it perfect for putting up just about anywhere in the house.  The MyDlink web portal capability is super easy to setup and the app is fantastic for checking up on the house from my android phone.  The only thing that I wish it had was the ability to enable/disable the motion detection feature on the camera through the phone app.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L Wireless Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Armbrester
Reviews.Content: Good product overall.  However, I was hoping that the camera could be motion-detection activated to begin recording to an FTP website.  The on-line product overview implied that this device was capable of such performance.  Unfortunately, after several attempts, I could not get the product to perform this function.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack21 "Jack21"
Reviews.Content: This camera has some problems with dropping wireless connectivity, even while right next to my (D-Link) router. I am still working on resolving those problems.  Seems to work fine otherwise.  I would recommend to D-Link that they provide an AC/DC power converter with a longer cord, though.  You have to locate an outlet really close to the camera position to be able to use the converter without an extension cord.  If you are plugging into a normally spaced wall outlet and want the camera above head height you will have to use an extension cord.  I really like the iPhone app which allows me to monitor while away from home.

Reviews.Title: tech guy
Reviews.Author: michael linville
Reviews.Content: very difficult to configure, I had to directly connect it to my wifi hub for installation.  Even then it continually dropped off the network and had to be re-started.  Not good for a security camera right!  The camera advertised it had motion sensing features and while the software was present, I never got this feature to work.  Low cost, cheap product.

Reviews.Title: software does not work with win7.  Have good images but motion detector does not work
Reviews.Author: Maggie Googler
Reviews.Content: the order I received was missing camera and mounting kit. I saw other reviews had the same problems, seems the prolbem is Amazon's packaging.  The installation software works fine until setting up wireless, as soon as I remove the cat5 cable, the internet is disconnected.  I have to restart my att router.  So I set the wireless manually as other viewer suggested.I set up motion detector and it worked for few minutes then stopped.  I restarted the camera and the motion detector worked for few more minutes and stop completely.  If it worked, i will give it 4 stars

Reviews.Title: Nice and easy to use CAM
Reviews.Author: Antonio E. Z. Castro "Risk Services"
Reviews.Content: Works fine with a very good reception. Easy to install and a lot of good software for free including for iphone. I'll buy the other one with infrared cause it doesn't work with low light! Excelente choice...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for little money!
Reviews.Author: Kasas
Reviews.Content: I Liked the camera, and it works fine! If there is a lot of traffic on the wi-fi it is sometimes difficult to get logged in with it. but when it works it is easy. I used the Mac set-up and it worked great.

Reviews.Title: Not the best but for the price its a decent value
Reviews.Author: A. Ru
