Reviews.Content: PROS:Great looking form factor and small and easily mountable.Doesn't require a computer to be always on for the motion sensing and camera setup features (computer required for the motion recording)Compatible with both Mac and PCWirelessHas an iPhone app (but limited to 1 mins durations)I didn't buy this through Amazon but still paid about $10 bucks less.CONS:NO night-vision, I didn't think this would matter that much but the lack of any low-light capability makes this pretty useless at night unless you have some sort of motion sensing light near it, which I luckily had bought already but even with an LED light there is still just barely enough light to see what shows up on the camera.AUDIO is limited to the camera through a PC in your home network through a JAVA/Active-X enabled browser. There isn't any audio transmission on the my-Dlink web-site feature or iPhone app.Cannot pan-and-tilt, the camera has a wide-angle so this isn't as much of a problem but for a bit about $30 more someone might want to go with a Foscam instead.Power cord is rather short.

Reviews.Title: Excitement to disappointment
Reviews.Author: E. Haley
Reviews.Content: The setup went very smoth and the picture quality looked very good, so i was very pleased while I was setting it up.  But when I strarted trying to connect and check on it later, I could not get connected.  this was in a remote cabin so I made a return trip to check it out.  Nothing was wrong and I finnally got connected to it OK.  It seems I can connect about 1 in 4 tries and then it is extremely slow.  then I found the part that if you do not have UPnp you have a 1 minute time limit.  I thought the advertisement said it would record to the web site and I could retrieve picture from the web site.  I have not figured out how to do that if it is even possible.  I tried the email and like every camera I've tried it jst fill up your email completely with nothing.  I lowered the sensitivity down to 60 and it still sent emails with no change.  I was going to send it back but was out of town and let the time slip by.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Bludgeon
Reviews.Content: Camera works great, the online mydlink also works great. The DVIEW Cam software took a little bit to figure out, but it does what I expected which is to record when there is motion detected. I had to turn off the virus software and firewall to install the everything, but after that no problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: SteelWheel
Reviews.Content: We have been really pleased with how well these little cameras have worked out. Image quality is decent and the wireless lets us move these around a school campus to monitor suspicious activity easily. In some ways these are better for our needs than the $5,000 high end cameras that is part of our DVR security system.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but limited
Reviews.Author: Steve_C
Reviews.Content: Range and video quality low. Easy to setup. Possibly suitable for limited uses, like baby monitoring at short range. I got this D-Link and a Foscam in the same order, intending to compare and keep the better unit. I'm keeping the Foscam, this one's been returned.

Reviews.Title: Crappy wireless range
Reviews.Author: A. Wang "A Dub"
Reviews.Content: I bought this wireless camera so I can place it about 20 feet away from my main router.  I had no issues setting it up initially while connected through ethernet to my router.  However, after I moved it to where I wanted to set it up, I could not get it to work.  I spent about 6 hours trying different things, moving it downstair (but closer to the router) to no avail.  I gave customer service a call and they deemed it a defective camera after going through their troubleshooting steps.  I did give it one last shot and was able to connect to the router wireless when it was 5 feet away.  Then I noticed the site survey feature on the manual setup window.  Apparently, this camera has an effective range of about 13 ft, maybe.  It greatly limits where I can place this wireless camera.For those who has some reception issues, try connecting to the router via wireless G instead of N.  It may give you a little more range.The only positive is that I think it is built pretty well.  I threw it across the room and kicked it out of frustration and it still works.

Reviews.Title: Not the greatest
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: Video quality is marginal at best. Wireless range is poor.Purchased because I got a decent price <50. Might be best used as a webcam

Reviews.Title: Worked at first
Reviews.Author: Al Becker
Reviews.Content: I have a Mac and this camera was very easy to install with the Mac. You have to download the Mac version from the D-Link website. I tried a Panasonic camera and it was very difficult to get running with the Mac. I never could get the camera to work wireless or on the net. I had this D-Link cam setup working wireless and on the net very quickly. When viewing the camera it seems to work better with Mozilla FireFox than with Safari. The sound works fine with FireFox. There is an app for the iPhone that is also very convenient and easy to use. The only drawback with this camera is that the recording software included only works with a PC.Update: The longer I have the cameras the worse they perform. It's almost impossible to get an internet connection. I can't get it to connect using a computer unless at home, which is completely useless to me. The iPhone app connection is spotty. The sound feature is intermittent. This has become a disappointment and I bought several of these. There has to be something better than this.

Reviews.Title: IT works
Reviews.Author: Jesse Benway "jbenz"
Reviews.Content: This camera works, the video could be smoother, the audio could be better, I have had to reboot the camera occasionally, but for the price its not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It is very simple to setup. It took me just 5 minutes to unpack and setup. I set this up in family room and use to watch my baby with the babysitter. I like this product and will buy one more for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my second home, and was so impressed by its small size, ease to install and picture quality that I got two more. It is so simple to use that all you have to do is log on to the "mydlink.com" website from any computer, anywhere, and you can view your home, yard, business, or whatever you want to view, and all done wirelessly, except of course for the power connection from the camera to an outlet.I highly recommend this camera, and it is very affordable!

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: Fred Acevedo
Reviews.Content: Purchase two one work will connected via Ethernet, the other works on occasion.  Neither works via wifi.  Good price but limited flexibility

Reviews.Title: Requires Java to work, apps throw security warnings
Reviews.Author: S. Jentsch
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, as I've liked other D-Link products I've used in the past. The setup process was easy to follow and the step-by-step process did result in a successful camera installation accessible via my local network.Unfortunately, viewing the images from the camera requires Java, which is strike 1. There have been so many Java-related security issues in recent history, that the most secure Java installation is the one that you don't have. It's just not worth the risk in most cases, and I only have one machine with it installed, and then it's only for a very limited use with one web site that I have to access for work purposes.But, for the purposes of this review, I wanted to see what the camera could do, so I allowed Java to run for this application. Unfortunately, that's where strike 2 comes into play. When you go into the camera administration, it wants to show you a live view of the camera. One of the apps it wants to run generates a security warning from Java, which says that the app (CVCA, I think it was called) has some security concerns, and is only partially signed by the developer, and the user should contact the developer to make sure that it hasn't been tampered with.In the game of security, you only get two strikes, and you really shouldn't even get more than one. When one of the most problem-riddled platforms in existence is flagging your application as a possible threat, you know you have a serious problem. This may be a false alarm, but it doesn't matter; companies should do everything in their power not to have such warnings appear in front of their customers.As a result, I cannot recommend this product to anyone that is not able to be sure that they aren't opening a huge security hole in their network by allowing this product onto it. In order to see this camera from the outside world, you have to open your network and allow access inside of it. How can you do that with confidence? I can't. I'm not giving it one star, because it does work, but it barely deserves the two I'm giving it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I've used three different network surveillance cameras over the last five years and the D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and a Built-In Wi-Fi Extender (DCS-933L)is about as good as any of them. Actually, the features on the camera it's self stand out. The video is crisp and the sound is really very good. I have a rather small house, so there's not really a need for the built-in Wi-Fi extender, but the signal was always strong to the router and I have yet to experience any real drop offs.Now, the bad news. As with all these cameras I've tried, the real sticking point is the system set-up and the software that runs the system on a computer. If you are an advanced computer user you won't have any problem, if not, it may be best to find a friend who is to stand-by while you set this thing up. I installed the camera on a Windows 7 computer running a dual core intel processor with 8 GB of ram. Before trying to set-up the camera first go to the D-Link site and set up an account. Go to the Adobe Flash site and make sure you have the latest edition of the Flash player and take the camera and accessories to your router.You attach the camera to the modem via the provided LAN (cat5) cable. Then after plugging in the power for the camera you're ready to go. Once the software is installed and the camera is registered you can unhook it from the modem and use your Wi-Fi connection. Keep in mind the power cord is pretty short, so you may need an extension cord and the camera is designed for indoor use, so it's not weatherproof. I wanted to use it to monitor the front door, so I just mounted the camera on the sill of the livingroom window and pointed it toward the door.I have also used the iPod viewing app and found it to be easy to use and that it provides a good quality picture. Overall, this is a good camera, just make sure you have your ducks in a row before starting set-up and you'll do fine.

Reviews.Title: Solid piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Danrr
Reviews.Content: Heated up and stopped working after five months of on again off again service.  Customer Support is almost impossible to reach and I am expected to pay for the return packaging and shipping of their defective product.That's it...never again will I have a D-link product in my home

Reviews.Title: Nice surveillance camera, but no recording w/ a Mac
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Kilo Delta
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, reasonably priced surveillance camera to use as a baby or pet monitor, or to check in on your house while you're gone to make sure the house is still standing.  We have ours set up on a shelf that overlooks the living room and office.  Set up was easy.  The picture is quite good, though we use it to see if the TV or the computer is missing, or if the dogs are being a nuisance by having a barking contest (thanks to the audio feature, we can hear them!).  This is pretty much the limit for what we use this camera for because we have a Mac.  Using the D-ViewCam software, you can use this camera as a security camera with motion triggered recording or manual recording options.  But the D-ViewCam software only works with Windows, not the Mac operating system.  If this camera instead had a slot for an SD card to record with, it would be a 5 star camera.  For the price though, it's a very nice unit if it suits your needs.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Patrick Holt "txdragon"
Reviews.Content: First off a disclaimer, if you have dlink router with one touch setup enabled, you might have a much easier time with this than I did,  However for those of us who believe in wireless security.  Here is what I think if this product.  Actually getting the camera on the wireless network is not so hard if you have a spare cable.  However one you have the camera up and going, its a nightmare to actually connect to it and view it.  D-link uses a java app which doens't seem to run on chrome at all, sometimes will run on firefox, and only seems to consistently run on IE after much java updating.  Basically its way more trouble than its worth.  Also you are stuck using their site out of the box which limits you to 1 minute of video at a time.  You can set it up to be a straight camera if you don't mind making some firewall modifications.  When its working its not a bad camera, and pretty good low light sensitivity, but as I said before its just a pain to setup and use with the Java dependency.

Reviews.Title: A Simple View: A D-Link DCS-933L Wireless Day/Night Cloud Camera 1150 with Built-In N 300 Mbps Repeater Review
Reviews.Author: L. T. Beasimer "www.LBphoto.net"
Reviews.Content: I was sent a D-Link Wireless AC1000 Dual-Band cloud router to test and review, so I thought it might be interesting to the same with this camera.  We have a large house which requires the use of a repeater for full Wi-Fi coverage, so I also wanted to see if these camera's extender capabilities would allow me to discontinue the use of our Hawking HWREN1 Hi-Gain Wireless-300N Range Extender.The D-Link DCS-933L wireless day/night network surveillance camera, made in China, connected easily to our network.  The package contains the cloud camera 1150, Ethernet cable, power adapter, camera base and mounting kit, and the quick install guide.  I started by connecting the base to the camera.  Then, using the install guide's instructions, I connected the camera to the router by Ethernet cable, plugged in the camera's power cord, browsed to the mydlink website, and followed the setup wizard.  In about 5 minutes, the camera was networked and ready to locate.Using the free MyDLink Lite or the MyDLink+ apps, one can monitor connected cloud enabled D-Link surveillance cameras, set alerts, and make basic changes.  Camera specific options in both apps include volume on/off, take photo, image quality, day/night/auto setting, and display information.  Settings include renaming, Motion and/or sound detection, and extender mode. The MyDLink+ app adds a full screen mode button, the ability to assign an email for notifications, and a grid camera view.The picture quality is good as well, day or night. The picture is clear and in color during the day, and black and white at night.  The night vision does a good job of rendering an image, however light can cause some detail to be blown out.Adding cloud based functionality comes with a security risk.  Adding cameras to monitor areas of your home can open the possibility of your network being hacked or someone inappropriately opening the app on your device and accessing your camera views.  When setting up a MyDLink account, weak passwords are permitted; I'd suggest using a strong password.  Unfortunately, the apps save passwords and open without concern to your privacy.  This may be convenient, but I'd much rather be required to enter my password every time I access the apps.  There is the option of going into the settings menu and manually logging out of the application after every use.  Unless you intend to make heavy use of these features, it would be safer to avoid them or purchase a wired monitoring system.The D-Link DCS-933L wireless day/night network surveillance camera is capable of extending the wireless network range.  Placing the camera in an area with reduced signal and turning on the extender feature can enhance and improve overall signal strength.  With the addition of this camera, our network is more consistent in the area where placed, which keeps our devices from jumping to various networks.  This could be helpful when placing multiple cameras around your location.If you're looking for a basic surveillance wireless networked camera, the D-Link DCS-933L does a good job with the added benefit of being a range extender.  Unless you're looking for pan/tilt capability, the D-Link DCS-933L Cloud Camera 1150 is worthy of your consideration.PROS:Simple to connect and installRepeater functionality extends wireless rangeMotion/sound sensor and notificationsNo monthly service fees24/7 support1 year limited warrantyCONS:Use creates a security riskApps save passwords and auto log in

Reviews.Title: UPDATED
Reviews.Author: Vynny "Vynrod"
Reviews.Content: Review update ****I didn't like certain aspects of the set up of this camera and feel needing to set it up on location by jacking it directly into your router, as opposed to just entering info, is an important thing to note. Imagine having set up your phone or tablet by getting cat5 out! However, I did get it going and finally got a chance to use it properly and I have to say the viewing software, phone app and camera quality is very, very good. Night vision is amazing and audio and imagery is crystal clear. For a camera at this price point, this is an excellent choice for home security or child monitoring.I still do not like the setup and feel it's a cumbersome way to get it going, but if you intend to install it and set it up in the area which it will ultimately live, then this is a great choice.I leave my original review (where I gave it two stars) below.***I  guess I'm in the minority as other reviewers here seem to have found this camera a good solution for their needs. Sadly I feel the set up on this device is the issue - not the tech, not the quality of the camera vision or indeed the cost.I'll elaborate. I acquired the camera to protect my camper which is permanently stationed in a wooded campground. Unfortunately this meant I needed a computer to set up the camera insitu and I only had an ipad/iphone. So I took a laptop to the area where there is free wifi and thought this would be a straight forward install...Sadly, you need to directly hook the camera up to the router via cat5 to set it up. So despite there being a free non-wep enabled open hot spot I couldn't connect to the camera at all without going to the main office and jacking into their stack system (something that's obviously not going to happen). So I then brought the camera home to set up there and found that it just wouldn't set up as my desktop computer was hardwired to my network. Again, I fired up the laptop and then I directly hooked the camera to my own personal wifi router.Only once did it see my wifi network and it took forever to write any information to the camera. Of course, during the set up I realised that it would therefore be indelibly tied into to my home network. In other words, I could NOT set up the camera in advance to my campground's wifi despite knowing the SSID and there being no encryption there.Okay, I thought, at least I can use it at home... but no it never successfully found my hotspot. Never connected even with cat5 and only once saw my home wifi SSID then the software just hung.So in a nutshell, you seemingly cannot set up this camera in a different location than its final resting place. As a wireless device I find this bizarre and hooking it up to the router to set it up is also bizarre - why not a USB connection I can prefill the info then take it out to my boat/camper/cabin etc?I'm sure it's a great cam when set up - but the set up itself is archaic and just was too unfriendly. Wifi printers these days work without hooking up to a router or indeed a USB connection - why not this wireless wifi hot spot extender camera?I may update this review if I ever get it going... but for now two stars - both of which are for cool form factor and diminutive size of the great looking device.

Reviews.Title: Good affordable solution for smartphone viewing
Reviews.Author: almosthappy
Reviews.Content: Overall I have been pleased with this camera.  The night vision is surprisingly good and setup was very simple.  The My DLink app for Android works extremely well and I haven't had any glitches yet.  Obviously this is not an advanced security solution, but for someone who just wants to be able to view a single camera of their home or office to check on things, it's great.The main problem I have had is the inability to use it with Chrome on my Win 7 PC.  I am aware that some people have had success with Firefox, but I think it should be common sense for them to fix this so that it will work on IE or Chrome as well.  I don't want to have to use a separate browser just for viewing the camera.Overall, though, this is a very good price point for a wireless camera and it works great.  If you are only planning to view this on a smartphone, it's practically perfect.

Reviews.Title: Operation: Fine. Installation? A little troubling
Reviews.Author: Doug Hibbard
Reviews.Content: Like all computer gadgets, there's the setup and the operation. Sometimes, the setup is easy the operation is a pill. Other times? It's the opposite, which fits the D-Link Wireless Day/Night Camera.I'll get back to the operation in a second. Let's look at the installation.First, the camera ships without software. It's a pet peeve, but I like having the program available, not having to download it. The download aspect has an annoyance. The camera ships in a package marked "Cloud Camera 1150." The product description on the website is DCS-933L. There is a place on the packaging that shows that, and the model number is on the unit--but what does the package call it? A "Cloud Camera 1150."What do you need to call it to find the software download? "DCS-933L." Now, I found that without much difficulty, but if you're looking for ease-of-setup for the off-the-shelf user, then the main product name should be used for the setup program.Second issue with setup: to setup the camera, you need to plug an Ethernet cable into your router and plug the unit into the wall by the router--then move it, after setup, to where you want it hooked up. Your computer space may be different than mine, but my router is setup out of the way--and hard, therefore, to put another cable into it. I'm also pretty well maxed-out on outlets. I got it done, but it was a little difficult.On to operation:This is just fine. It makes the slightly hassled setup stage worth it, because now that's all behind me. Here are the benefits:1. Easy aiming of the camera coupled with wide view range covers a large enough area for security purposes. I can see all the space I need to see.2. Sound quality is good--if you need this to monitor audio, you won't find it good enough to sing along, but the words are clear.3. Wi-fi repeater works. It's limited by the overall nature of repeaters, but it extends the range out for my wi-fi, thus helping me avoid data overages on my cell.4. Motion detection is a great tool. It's also adjustable, and can be set so sensitive that the A/C blowing a piece of paper sets it off. Or you can back it off. Also, the software lets you pick what area you're looking for motion, thus cutting the cats out of tripping it.5. Software controls are pretty good--not super fast, but good.6. Email pictures are clear--it will email either a time-programmed shot or a motion-detection shot.7. The phone app works well. The tablet app has a glitch, but the phone app works on the tablet. The main advantage to the paid tablet app is the ability to see multiple cameras, but I have 1 camera, so the free phone app is adequate. I would like to see them fix the tablet app, though.I think this camera will be handy when we are going to be out of town and want a record of any motion/action within the house. Do keep in mind that, unless you tell it to email pictures, this device is *not* recording, so you can watch someone rob you blind but have no actual evidence. You will need to click the "picture" button and capture a snapshot.For now, though, it's going back in the box. Having a 24-hour internet-linked camera feed is a little creepy.

Reviews.Title: If you need assistance, Don'tBuy D-link.
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Nelson "Sir Richard Thompson"
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to access D-links web site to see live shots from the DCS-930L camera. I spent 3 hours on the phone with a foreign teck that raised my blood pressure so high, I had to go to the emergency room. I called again, was pleased to here the voice of a native speaker of English. I told him that I had a case number; when I told him that he connected me to the same idiot that could not solve my problem. I have too many D-link products. When I log into D-link's Dir -655 (wireless N router), It shows the camera working, but I have not been able to get a PASSWORD for the Mydlik.com. If i have time, I am going to make an early call and hope to reach the Female tech that helped me set up my router last year. If I can't resolve the problem and I find that I can't return it, I'll throw in the garbage and start initiation of a conversation with any one I meet, and I will down D-link's crappy customer service to everyone I meet. I have no problems with their products if you can get them set up correctly. If they don't address their tech issues, they wil be out of this line of business like Cisco. Product good, tech is the worst I've encountered in over 15 years.

Reviews.Title: 3G Timeouts
Reviews.Author: Michael Earwood
Reviews.Content: This camera works great when connected via WI-FI. However, when connecting via 3G from my Android phone or from my wife's iPhone 3GS we have endless timeouts. The free myDlink program for smartphones is terrible and if you do get connected it times out after 60 seconds.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT for my needs
Reviews.Author: David "Foxboy"
Reviews.Content: I have a rotten neighbor I need to keep an eye on and this worked perfect.  I set it hanging upside down from a inside window, rotated the camera 180 degrees and I am good to go!  It works wirelessly easy on my wi-fi home network, so I can keep tabs on this "guy" from anywhere.  I don't expect he will ever know he is being watched when he's running his business from his house, which he tries to cover up...it is not legal in this area to run a business from a house.Anyway, whatever your use, it works!The camera seemed easy enough on Mac, but they left out some details on how to connect wirelessly, I did need to call and get talked down by their "tech guy".  I was able to fill in the missing blanks and had it running in about 45 minutes, pretty simple once you know how the menus work.  The product is great, the "tech help, well -- needs help themselves.  The line was very busy, first call was a harsh hang up, then second call was a 5 minute wait...Long way to India I guess.  They have a Mac installer which is Beta on their website, works fine although it is sort of PC clunky, not real pretty but functional.  Can not have everything and the price is sweet.Anyway I give it a 5 Star and I am happy with the unit.I will also now be able to see the conditions from anywhere, very nice.  I still wish they would move, there are sure better people and I was here first!

Reviews.Title: Worth trying
Reviews.Author: GC
Reviews.Content: We have been waiting for the day when this technology became affordable, functional and easy to use. We decided to give this one a try to see that day had arrived. In summary, it has. The issues we have are twofold. First, when setting up the feature where it will email you when the device senses motion, it asks questions about our email account that are technical and we couldn't answer. So far we can't find out how to deal with this issue. Second, where we have the device located we have satellite internet access. This all but eliminates the functionality of the unit. I wish we had known this ahead of time.The unit is well made, surprisingly small, and we are confident it will one day serve as we had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Missing Parts in box!!!
Reviews.Author: Lynn "Alinn"
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these cameras and when I opened the boxes, neither boxes had the mounting kit inside. I called the company and they said to contact Amazon and this was probabably an isolated incident. NOT!!! I returned the cameras and Amazon sent out 2 more cameras and low and behold NO MOUNTING KITS!!! I called D-Link and they gave their standard spill in barely understandable english (I'm B__tching). After being disconnected/hungup on once and then told to go back to amazon I am returning the cameras and ordering a different brand of camera. They also told me that it is on amazon even though it is their sealed product Amazon is selling. They also told me that i could purchase the kits from them via email. A Bunch of BS!!!AMAZON as always was excellent in their customer service. I returned the first two cameras and the other two were overnighted to me. Maybe Amazon should get in the business of making more electronic products (besides kindle) because I would try them out just based on my experience of their customer service department!!!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Setup for Wired but Hard for Wireless
Reviews.Author: Samuel Stone "Sam"
Reviews.Content: I followed the instruction manual and downloaded the setup software to start setting up.  You have to first connect to the router using a network wire that comes with the device.  It works nicely with the wired connection.However, when I tried to switch it to wireless connection, the disaster began.  I started with WPS connection, the device couldn't detect the router.  Then I changed to the manual connection, the software couldn't find my network.  I had to start over several times and it seems that I was able to connect it completely out of luck, meaning, even as a technology wizard (that's what people call me), I couldn't figure out why the previous times it didn't work and why now it works.  So I can't help anyone who have the same problem with a specific method to get it connected.  You just have to try it several time using several ways, including deleting the device from MyDLink account and starting over.Now it's connected.  I want to try email alert, so I tried to set it up.  It was a clumsy process, but when I click Save to save the change, it tells me that the wireless network name and password cannot be empty.  The network name field doesn't allow me to enter anything and it's not showing the currently connected network.  The camera is already working on the network, but the network name field is empty and since it is empty, MyDLink.com asks me to enter the information, or I wouldn't be able to save any changes.  But IT DOESN'T ALLOW ME TO ENTER ANYTHING, or choose from a list.  I tested with FireFox, IE, and Chrome, but they all showed the same problem.It's a nice camera with great pictures, even though the lens angle could be wider to cover more area.  But DLink failed on the software part.  Reading other people's reviews, it seems that this problem is not with everyone.  So if you are lucky, you will get a smooth ride.  I wish so much to give this nice camera a good five stars because of the price, but it just disappointed me with setup and configuration.Good luck!

Reviews.Title: It's not for me.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Kraus
Reviews.Content: If I had to sum it up as best I could in just a few words, I'd say: "All of the annoyances of the DCS-5020L, but with none of the benefits".The similar issues between the two cameras are mainly:Resolution: 640x480? What is this, the dark ages?Software: The mobile viewing software is slow and problematic.  Granted, it feels slightly worse with the 5020L because panning around is a nightmare, but just viewing can be frustrating.Updating the firmware for the device cannot be done over a wireless connection.  You need to uninstall the device from its location, bring it to your router and connect it to your network via ethernet in order to do the update.Happily, there's no adjustable lens on this one so you don't have to worry about that. The major down side between this and the 5020L, aside from no panning, is the much more narrow viewing angle for this camera.  It limits its usefulness to me.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera. But limited application
Reviews.Author: Brian Baker
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It's well made, easy to install and operate, and has decent range and resolution.But the question you have to ask yourself is this: what, exactly, are you getting a security camera for?If you're looking for a unit that allows you to check in periodically and see what's happening INSIDE your home, this is a great solution. It'll also send you "alerts" to check the device output. All well and good... except there's obviously a time lag between the alert being sent out, you getting it, and then checking the camera's output. Whatever's happening better not be a short-term event, I guess. If you're looking for a full-fledged security monitoring system, you probably want to rethink this as a "solution".For one thing, it has to be mounted indoors. It's not a weatherproof system. I consider that a very limiting requirement. It doesn't record anything. So if something's not happening while you're actually watching the monitor's output... you missed it. Not good at all, especially if there's criminal activity involved, as your evidentiary material is non-existent.So... good as a nanny-cam or pet monitor, or to make sure your house isn't burning down while you're away. But you'll need something a bit more advanced if you want true "security monitoring".Value for your dollar? Pretty good. Again, just be aware of the limitations.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy these cameras.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras, along with a D-Link wireless router. With quite a bit of tinkering, because of poor installation instructions, I finally got both cameras to work.The real problems began when I tried to use mydlink to view the images the cameras were transmitting. On two different computers, I was able to log into mydlink OK. Immediately, it started trying to download a Java applet needed to access the cameras. But the download would not finish - or even begin. I have downloaded several other Java applets in the past witout any problem.I sent an email to support explaining the problem. After more than 24 hours, the reply from support simply told me to try a different web browser. I tried that, but no dice.Don't buy these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Received a used item
Reviews.Author: DesignForLife
Reviews.Content: Received a clearly used product. Scratch marks hear and there, cords were wound up poorly, and the device had a preset password probably set up by the user who returned it. Couldn't figure out the password so I had to google it for some time and had to reset the device. I bet the device must also be an older version since it had two versions earlier firmware.Although I use a d-link router and the setup should have been pretty easy, the experience wasn't that smooth. Required quite a lot of set up steps, installing programs and updating Java.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended product for control and security of the home
Reviews.Author: romina gili
Reviews.Content: The product is excellent work perfectly the video quality is very good as well as the audioThe product arrived in excellent condition

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive Camera - perfect for through a window monitoring
Reviews.Author: Z Moe "Z Moe"
Reviews.Content: No need for PIR or IR leds if you are monitoring through a window.  The IR leds will reflect back, and the PIR is blocked by the window as well.  The only downfall is not being able to have the camera directly record video files and save them to FTP.  Great for still pictures and the video motion detection works very well.

Reviews.Title: Eye on you
Reviews.Author: pc
Reviews.Content: the D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera was the third one in my system.  I can now keep an eye on my sump, driveway and family room while I am away.  My alarm company wanted $2500 to upgrade my system to video and $60 per month.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: S. N. Burns
Reviews.Content: I was not looking for high quality when looking for a wireless IP camera.  Wanted to save some bandwidth for my repeater for the garage.  This camera fits the bill.  480p is all your getting.  All I need.  Gives a clear enough image to see what's going on outside.  Not sure how well night vision works as my garage is lit up like a Christmas tree and there's enough ambient lighting.  I'm not recording, just observing.  Easy to set up.  Can access remotely from Galaxy Note 2.  Thinking about buying another one.  Would recommend only if you want to watch and not worried about catching the small details.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: ToddlerMom
Reviews.Content: Easy to install when the camera is connected via Ethernet.  Then you can use it wirelessly after installation.I use it to check on my pets at home when I'm not there.  Doesn't pan from side to side so it only views exactly what you have it pointing on.  Buy a more expensive version of the camera for more features but it works well to just check in from time to time.

Reviews.Title: Good option
Reviews.Author: T. Mayer "Just a customer"
Reviews.Content: I have an older D-link and decided to get two of these in the twin pack. They work great for my needs.  They are simple to set up and the FTP option works well for me.  The software comes with a motion sensor option to take snap shots and FTP them to you site.  It works about as well as all the other motion sensing software I have tried.  Which means plan on getting lots and lots of false pictures taken when you view outside on a cloudy day.  Keep in mind all motion software works this way.  Inside it will work fine.  The live video you get through their website can have some lines running through it but for free it works great for checking in on things.  The range is fair.  It is very sensitive to walls.  I have gotten about 100 fee out it through 1 brick wall and a wood wall but inside it working is much more sensitive to obstructions.  With the software motion sensor you pick fairly large blocks of image area it would be nice if you could select odd areas but it still works OK.

Reviews.Title: Love it - does just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Kj
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera operating for 2 hours now and ordered another one already.  It was very easy to set up (must update the firmware as so many others have said).  I easily loaded it for viewing on my Windows laptop, Android tablet and Android phone and have all running now.  Now I can see what my dogs are doing in the living room while I'm in my office - I've already caught them at something twice.  I definitely recommend if you want a basic view of the goings on in your house.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Sweet Chi "Savy Shopper"
Reviews.Content: Although there were initial hiccups to setting it up wirelessly, the tech department walked me through everything.  It worked wonderful.  I used this while on vacation and I was able to view the going-ons in my home while away.  This is the cheapest camera that offers a lot of bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: WORKS ON FIOS ROUTERS
Reviews.Author: Honest USA
Reviews.Content: I got this cam to keep tabs on my brother i was antisipating having to get a tech to come from verizon to make it work with my router but i said let me give it a try so i took it out of the box hooked it to the back of the router (make sure you don't put it in the extender port) plugged it in my router accepted it and the light turned green and i started the configure process absolutely flawlesssexcept i had a firmware update is required in order to use it with cloud services

Reviews.Title: Affordable and Reliable
Reviews.Author: jill sheldon
Reviews.Content: We love our D-Link camera. It is a great option to use as a nanny cam or in our case, a doggy cam. The picture is pretty clear, especially considering the price you pay and we love using the free phone app. to check on our home when we are away. Definately a great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: Keeping tabs on elderly parents
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Bertoen
Reviews.Content: I have an elderly Mother that is home bound. This is a great option to keep tabs on her when she is alone. Easy set up and use. Purchased this on sale, but even at full price would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: Good, but the viewing via a browser can be iffy
Reviews.Author: D. Cross
Reviews.Content: The iPhone and iPad app work great. The browser sometimes doesn't connect and it seems to have more trouble over safari then on IE on a PC. Uses Java. The mic works well and picks up sounds very well. Night mode works great also.

Reviews.Title: Love it !!
Reviews.Author: amazonian
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these at same time , 1st one worked with no flaws , the 2nd one , exact same camera but had a older install CD and the cameras themselves have a little chip in them that have the program on them , ( they call it firmware) , the cameras also have their own unique IP numbers since they are on wireless and they have their own passwords you have to make up and put in , well the 2nd camera I could not change its password , tried using the 1st cameras install CD and still it would not work , after some hassle ,  went to the website , downloaded a new install program , ran that , it tells me the camera's firmware needs updated , downloaded and did that , then the camera would take a password and it worked flawlessly , just be aware if your not computer savvy get your family's computer guru to come help you or your going think the camera is bad and end up sending it back when it's a easy fix if you know what to do.I love it , I can see them from anyplace that has a internet connection , I even have Dlink's free app on my ipod touch and can bring up all cameras and watch them thru it , will order 1 more for complete coverage I want . Wish I had done this years ago , great way to keep tabs on your place if your away for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly
Reviews.Author: Austin Andersen
Reviews.Content: Set this up in apartment to watch pets when gone. Never once had issue connecting to them with IOS app.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup and use - works great with iPhone app.  I had a difficult time setting up the Easy N cam and this one is much easier with a free streaming service.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: jacqueline gonzales
Reviews.Content: I love this d-link camera.you can access it from anywhere and you can hear inside the home.just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: worried
Reviews.Author: Melisa
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of this camera but I am worried because how can you put the camera outside where it needs to be plug in the router. It won't work if it does not plug in the router. Hhmm a bit confused here.

Reviews.Title: would not connect
Reviews.Author: cagalindo "cagalindo"
Reviews.Content: would not connect at alli tried with windows and maci use the brighthouse turbo modembuy at your own risk

Reviews.Title: The website don't let you see it in full and is a s***ty website.
Reviews.Author: marcus verrill
Reviews.Content: You can't really see anything to small. It does not come in good and is slow things are happening and you see them later on. It's to slow.

Reviews.Title: If you have choice, don't buy this one!
Reviews.Author: don.zhang@qlogic.com
Reviews.Content: I bought a Dlink DCS-930L from Amazon. Link to my wireless router (also Dlink brand) is OK. But I never get it work when I am away home, neither my wife. In our house I can see the picture (video) in my laptop even it is in a slow mode, but not when I was away from home, never. Don't know why. The purpose to buy this is to moniter the home from my work, apprently it does not do its job. The camara showed in the web is alway "offline". I think I need to buy another better one to place this cheapy stuff.

Reviews.Title: easy setup
Reviews.Author: 796dsl
Reviews.Content: To test it out, I set it up with it near the router and it went fine and was done in like 15 minutes. I then put it to the location upstairs and it just would not connect to the router, even though my phone could (ok, it connected barely with 2 bars). I then put the router to a location that is closer to the camera and everything has been working fine.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Robbob
Reviews.Content: Great!! As expected The product came promptly and was a breeze to set up. I will be ordering another one soon

Reviews.Title: It works!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan W. Limebrook
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up and use.  I went on a long trip leaving my house unoccupied, and it was really comforting to be able to see how things were in my living room any time of day or night.

Reviews.Title: Camera quality decent, easy to view over cloud.
Reviews.Author: ASP
Reviews.Content: This review is for the DLink Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and Built-in Wi-Fi Extender (DCS-933L).The measurements of the camera are 3.5" H x 2.5" W x 1.25" D.  The camera lens is slightly less than half an inch in diameter.  The camera is attached to a ballhead so it swivels in any direction. Back of the camera has the power port and the Ethernet port.  The included Ethernet cable is 39" long (3 ft 3 inches).  The included power cable and plug is 60" long (5 ft).If you have a DLink Cloud Router, the camera will configure automatically. If you have a different router, you have to download the setup wizard from the dlink website.  PC and MAC software both available, about 10 MB size.  The wizard is easy to understand. You can setup the camera wired or wirelessly, but during initial setup it has to be connected with the ethernet cable directly to your router or modem. I had it connected to a switch which was an extension from my router (which was an extension from my cable modem). It didn't find it when it was connected to my switch. But when it was connected to my router, it found it within 10 seconds.The Cloud service is through dlink's website, and it support IE, Chrome, Safari, and Firefox browsers. You may also need to download JRE: Java Runtime Environment for your browser, but it will specify if you need to download it. Once logged in, I had to update the firmware on the camera. Once installed, you can configure the camera and set trigger settings, like Motion and/or sound detection.  If the LIVE VIEW doesn't work, go to SETTINGS, and then come back to LIVE VIEW and it should ask if you want to enable JAVA.The camera captures sound. I was snapping my fingers in another room and it still picked it up clearly. You can take a snapshot of the screen, and also turn on/off NIGHT VIEW. The quality of the image is decent. The colors are accurate. Certain text won't be able to be read, even at 4 feet, but I was able to read other text at 8 feet away.  In complete darkness, the night shot is quite good, but it's in black and white.  I'll post an update with more tests. The camera body feels warm to hot after using it for only 30 minutes.I ran into a few issues. With Chrome, I had excellent sound, but no picture. With Internet Explorer (IE 32bit) I had picture, but no sound. IE 64-bit isn't supported. Then I tried to connect the camera wirelessly, but since I keep my wireless network from being broadcasted, it didn't display in the list of wireless networks, and I was unable to manually enter my network name. So issue there. I'll have to try this out wirelessly and see how it works and then update this review.

Reviews.Title: Awful Product and D-Link Support equally as bad
Reviews.Author: Marvin B. Holt
Reviews.Content: Hello, setup disc that came with unit would not autorun so I went to D-Links website and installed the software, That is required for the unit to work, and it was complicated beyond belief. I am very versed at working on networks and with network app's and this one was so frustrating that I had to call D-Link for support. The initiation wait time was 10 minutes ( this was on a Tuesday morning at 10:00 AM ) - I was on hold for 58 minutes. Support wanted to REMOTE into my computer to setup the Cam. I told them no way ! Talking about opening up a hole in your network, they are nuts to use remote control for a fix to there mess. I saw a new story this morning that showed a cam that had been hacked and the person was watching and talking to the family's baby. Back to the meat of this review - as I was on hold for this 58 minutes, I had plenty of time to check out the D-Link FAQ database. Here are a few things I found;One of the most asked questions was " What do I do if the installation disc doesn't run on my computer ? "Another one was ' How do I get a MyD-Link account ? " --- A my d-link account is required for this camera to broadcast. It will not work if you don't have a my d-link account - Period. The installation disc that comes with the unit, if it worked, would take you through this process as you setup the unit. Without it you must contact D-Links support to setup this camera ( 58 Minutes on HOLD ). If I had known that this camera wouldn't work without having to be a d-link cloud member, I sure wouldn't have wasted my money on it.There are to many things bad about this unit, including after I set it up with supports help, the firmware was out of date. It has to be updated right out of the box --- come on D-Link, at least update the firmware or toss these units into the trash. That will be the next place these units will be, in our landfills ! They have lowered the price again and again on these units. That should have been a red flag. Trust me, it will be from now on. Don't waste your time or money on this unit. Once I got it working, the cams picture and audio were not even as good as the older webcams that are built in on laptops. The network part of the cam was in and out. I never was able to watch a steady stream. The app that you use with a smart phone is a 'lite" app.To get the full app it cost you more money ! D-Link has gotten the last dollar from this old man !!!

Reviews.Title: Nice but video quality can be poor.
Reviews.Author: Fuzzbean
Reviews.Content: I have also reviewed the similarly-priced Diamond Multimedia HP500CK camera, which offers similar functions; you can read my review of that rather than me repeating everything here.I would have preferred this D-Link unit for sure, except the video is so bad when viewed over the internet from my PC at work, it can't even be honestly called video. It is more like a series of still pictures refreshed randomly at 2 to 20 second intervals. Or often it just shows a black screen for a while.Viewed within my own house, using my cheap Android tablet, the video seemed acceptable. I assume cutting out the internet made that difference, though connections at both ends are not that bad normally.Well the sound feature, which the Diamond was lacking, is great. The infra-red night vision is super at indoor distances. The camera is simple, neat-looking, and reasonably compact. I had no problems with the setup or instructions, though maybe me having a D-Link router made things go smoother.I don't see any recording capability available... I think maybe you need to buy another gadget to add that to your system.

Reviews.Title: Not all that great as a baby monitor, but functional.
Reviews.Author: Ninjaba "Ninjaba"
Reviews.Content: This is our first wireless camera. Setup was not easy. I cleared some time because I knew this would probably take awhile (2 hours to be exact), and started by reading the very short manual. I followed the link to the setup and got nothing but a few D-Link headers and no place to download a set-up wizard. I got the complete run around on their website, and my blood pressure rose so high I wanted to throw the camera through a window.I took a breath, stepped away, and returned. The company's website seemed to be working and I finally downloaded the Mac Installation Wizard. The wizard was very nice and easy to follow. I set up an account and had the camera working in no time. On my computer I saw a little box video from the camera. Awesome! I clicked off of that and went to my account where I could view an actual larger picture  . . . and that's when things got difficult. I had to download Java 7, but I needed to uninstall Java 6. I tried, but I decided to let my techi-husband work on this. As of yet, I haven't seen a picture on my computer. BUT, that's okay, because really I wanted the camera to work over my iPhone.Besides telling me that there's a new Firmware download for the camera (constantly, even after I downloaded it), the video on my phone looks amazing. Ultimately I want to use this camera in my kids room, so I tested it out while they were sleeping. The night vision is superb! I wish my baby monitors were this clear. However, the camera kept making an annoying clicking sound, and flashing a green/red light in the back that was bright and bothersome.  The delay on the camera was also pretty bad, but that had to do with our internet connection and not the camera. So I tested the camera in a room with better internet connection and found the camera worked well, but there was still a 1-2 second delay.Pros:-Nice gadgety camera.-Wireless, just plug in the power cord and you're all set.-Picture quality is fantastic. Night vision is insanely good!Con:-Setup on the Mac is a pain.-Power cord seemed too short.-Wish it would zoom out more or pan.-Bright flashy light and noisy at times (not good for sleeping children).Overall this is an okay camera. I'm not sure I would recommend it as a baby monitor. Maybe the higher-end models allow for more features. The clicking nose is annoying.

Reviews.Title: This is a great product
Reviews.Author: zeemema
Reviews.Content: I really like the D-Link products and this one is no exception. It was easy to configure and install. The only drawback is the limitation on browsers that can be used to configure the automatic email when motion is sensed. I'm expecting that will change over time and I'll get updates.In the meantime, I'm happy to be able to watch my home from my iPhone whenever  want.Highly recommended..

Reviews.Title: Simple Surveillance for Everyone!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I have a far more complex contraption to monitor a remote office, but wanted something simple to keep an I on a particular area of a part time residence.  The D-Link Wireless is perfect for that application, and I have been happy with it since setting it up last month.Pros:-Idiot-proof setup-Idiot-proof operations-Decent security-Great nighttime visionCons:-Can't reposition camera remotelyIn summary:  great camera for simple remote monitoring and viewing, especially if you want to view the camera on your iPhone!

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: brian j conway
Reviews.Content: This was on clearance with free shipping. It is as discribed with easy set up. I will be useing it to keep a eye on things while im gone.

Reviews.Title: Impossible to set up
Reviews.Author: R. Rose "Ricktig"
Reviews.Content: After spending more than a dozen hours trying to keep the camera attached to my WiFi including two useless calls to dLink tech support, I've decided to return the camera.  I was able to get it to connect via WPS for a day but it screwed up my DSL router and a reset of the router has rendered the camera useless, once again.  I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: No night vision for this version but the picture quality in low light is decent. I have had connectivity issues that seem to linger for a few days.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: Good product!! Will get an extra camera one of the best products ever bought the connection is very simple three step set up the best!!!

Reviews.Title: An update to this purchase
Reviews.Author: Ed from Sunrise
Reviews.Content: Updated review.I was not able to connect the last of the 3 cameras. After few months, several attempts and contacting customer service, they finally decided that the camera had a problem. They asked me to send it back directly to them (return policy time had expired). I just received the exchange camera, installed and it works fine. I have 3 cameras on line in the same account and they all work fine. Looks like the limitation previous reported was fixed!Original review.I purchased one to make a test and it worked fine. Then I ordered 2 more and I ran into a problem adding the second device to mydlink.I searched in the internet and BINGO! That is a known problem that had not been fixed. Check this link: [...]One camera works fine but I will give a one star because of this problem. It should be a software problem easy to fix, BUT SOMEBODY HAS TO DO IT!

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera
Reviews.Author: HBN
Reviews.Content: I was unable to use this product. Dispite assistance with the service rep. It was returned as defective.  I bought this product as "new". I appeared to have been "used". It was very frustrating.  The linking "green" light never did illuminate for those familiar with the unit. However. We proceeded as if it had.  The software did move to the password menu. We found that it already had a password assigned along with a placement location. To all concidering a purchase, The package arrives unsealed and it cannot be determined if it is actually new or not. A new and functional camera may work just fine.I recieved a prompt refund.My purchase experiance was unfavorable.

Reviews.Title: Horrible isn't the word for this piece of junk..
Reviews.Author: snafubaby
Reviews.Content: I cannot give this camera a zero star rating??  I bought this camera a month ago. I installed the software, and connected the csmera as wired to configure it for wireless. It SEEMED like it was working, but I then noticed it had issue with the Mydlink app installed on my samsung sidekick 4g android phone. The app always crashes. I talked to both Samsung and D-link customer service, but they could not help me with ANY suggestionz on how to get the app to work. I then decided to use the phone's tethering feature and use my old, trusty Ipod Touch with the camera. It worked, or at least I got feed from the camera using the app store app. BUT, it really eats up the battery power on the phone. WHY do I need to do all this to get camera feed? It's ridiculous! Too late to return it to the store I bought it from, so I will mess with from time to time to try to get it working.  A definte bad investment!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the time/money
Reviews.Author: William Castello
Reviews.Content: You can get it it work, if you have vast amounts of patience and time to devote to tweaking your network settings until everything is *perfectly* the way this thing wants it.  It will not set up wireless unless you are very, very lucky.  You will have to downgrade the firmware, run the software to a certain point, upgrade the firmware and then hope it works.  If not, you start all over again.  Truly, not worth the money and time wasted.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Work Fully With Mac OS X
Reviews.Author: Leon Guzenda "RioVistaCA"
Reviews.Content: I already had a DCS-932-L, so I tried this model as it has roughly the same specifications. There's no installer for Mac OS X, so you have to search for it on the D-Link site. The one that's there is marked as a beta version and it hasn't been updated since early 2011. It runs on Mac OS X and I was able to get the camera to work on an Ethernet cable. However, I can't get it to work with my WiFi setup. The DCS-932L works just fine.I also couldn't get the setup "Wizard" to allow the camera to connect to MyDlink.com, making the camera visible across the Internet, which is what I bought it for. I get an error message saying "Updated Wizard Required". There isn't one on their web site and their support people can't find one either.So, if you don't have a PC and want a webcam that connects to your hard-wired network, this webcam works fine, but it doesn't do what it's advertised as unless you go out and buy a PC to set it all up.

Reviews.Title: Not fully Mac compatible.
Reviews.Author: Kar3n21784
Reviews.Content: This camera is a big disappointment. It doesn't work wirelessly with Airport Extreme. The advanced features only work with Internet Explorer. I can only use it plugged into an ethernet cable. Hopefully the software is updated so us Mac users can use all of the features.

Reviews.Title: Great Product- Wish for ability to remotely move camera
Reviews.Author: Wild Reader
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this product- in comparison to the other cameras that require a lot of tech know-how and router set up. This product in comparison was VERY easy- simply put in the CD and set up the cameras wireless. Took about 10 minutes for the 3 I purchased. At the time I bought them, I was thinking I only wanted to look at them in my house to monitor my pet when traveling. I since moved one to point outside. The app is GREAT and it is nice to use it on my iPhone on 3G when away from my house. I have yet to see any other company have both an app they own and ability to simply look at your camera outside your network without complicated port forwarding. After trying to view my house at night (I didn't think I needed night vision with the light in the house and wasn't contemplating outside) wish I had spent the money for the night vision. Even if you only use it a couple of times, it is well worth spending the extra money to get the night vision.My reason for the 4 stars is this- I would love to have a two way microphone, to talk to my pet as well as hear them. The other product I am looking for from D-Link is a camera that either has a wider view range or the ability to move it remotely as well- DLink has such products but they are almost a $1000 and not used with the remove viewing website. Give me both of those things and I will be in love.

ProductInfo.Features:
Built-In Wi-Fi extender can help boost network signal to reduce dead spots
Night Vision - View up to 15 feet in complete darkness
Sound and Motion Detection - Enhanced email alerting based on sound and motion sensing technology
Remote Viewing - View on iPhone, iPad or Android with mydlink app or mydlink.com
Wireless/Ethernet - Secure connection for flexible placement
ProductInfo.Name: D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled and a Built-In Wi-Fi Extender (DCS-933L)
